loans.name: Fatima's Wanafaraja Group

texts.en:
Fatima is 30 years old. She is married and she has one 7-year-old child. She became a clothes seller in 2000. Every day, she works from 7 AM to 12.30 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $350 from her sales.

Fatima now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Sophia, who has business dealing with food sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Mariam's Motivation Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with one 10-year-old child. She also takes care of two other children aged 6 and 16 years old. She became a used-clothes-seller in 1998. Every day, she works from 10 AM to 6 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Mariam now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Zamzam, who also has a business running a shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en: Mrs. Ouk L. was born in 1957, and she now lives in Preak Daung Village in Kandal Province. She owns a small restaurant where she sells breakfast and lunch to the villagers and passersby in the local village. Aside from this business activity, she is a farmer. In farming, Mrs. Ouk L. faces a small problem because she does not have enough animals to plow her rice field, thus she needs to hire a laborer with a cow to plow the field. So Mrs. Ouk L. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, and she would use the rest of the loan to purchase rice seeds to cultivate and fuel for her pump to water the field. Mrs. Ouk L. is a widow with three children, two who are 25 and 20 are working in a hotel while the youngest one is attending school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to hire a laborer to plow the field and she would use the rest of the money to buy rice seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Durga

texts.en:
Mrs. Durga R. is a widow and works as a farmer in Khogana Dobato.Mrs. R. has three members including herself in her family. Her husband Mr. Shanta R. died 22 years ago. Since that she took on all the responsibility for her children. Now her older son is working in a Finance Company and her younger son works in his own grocery shop.

Mrs. Durga R. prefers to grow seasonal vegetables on her land. Due to the lack of technology she has to depend on seasonal agricultural. Nowadays she is growing maize on her farm. She sells her vegetables at the local market. Now Mrs. R. is requesting her first loan in the amount of Rs 10000.00 to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farming work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Phin P., 38, works on her farmland in Sa Ang, Cambodia, with her husband. They have four children.

The field typically generates only US$2 each day in income and it is very difficult to support such a large family. Phin P. has asked for a loan of US$200 to purchase more vegetable seeds to increase her field's yield. She believes that this investment will allow her to increase her income; with the extra money she can improve her family's quality of life.

Many Cambodians are feeling the strain of high food and gasoline prices, so they are looking for ways to increase their income and provide for their families.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seeds

loans.name: Hang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hằng năm nay 30 tuổi, gia đình chị hiện có hai con đang tuổi đến trường. Tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vòng vốn đầu chị vay 1.000.000đ để đầu tư vào buôn bán nhỏ cho thu nhập khoảng 500.000đ/ tháng. Đến nay qua 5 năm làm kinh doanh gia đình chị đã tích luỹ được nhiều kinh nghiệm hơn và sử dụng vốn cũng hiệu quả hơn. Hiện tại 2 vợ chồng chị đều đi buôn gia cầm từ các trang trại về bán cho các nhà hàng , người tiêu dùng tại địa phương. Công việc cho thu nhập ổn định 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài ra anh chị còn kết hợp chăn nuôi lợn gà tại gia đình vì thế thu nhập của gia đình anh chị ngày càng ổn định và phát triển.Anh chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000 đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, buôn bán phát triển kinh tế gia đình.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Mrs. Hang, 30 year old, has 2 children at school age. Joining TYM, she made the first loan of 1,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in retailing, whose revenue was about 500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. For 5 years of hard-working and constant studying, she and her husband have become experienced and used the loan more effectively. At the moment, they are buying poultries from local farms and selling them to restaurants, or local customers. This business brings in 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Besides, they also raise pigs and chickens at home, so the family’s income is increasing securely. They plan to borrow 10,000,000 Vietnamese Dong for raising and the business.

loans.use: Poultry sales

loans.name: Santi

texts.en:
Mrs. Shanti S. lives in Khogana Dobato. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. Shanti S. lives in a nuclear family with her husband, one daughter and one son. Her husband's name is Mr. Yekendra S.. He works in his own electronics shop. Her daughter passed her SLC (School Leaving Certificate) this year and her son is studying in grade 7.

Mrs. Shanti S. opened a cloth shop few years ago to raise the living standard of her family because only her husband's income is not enough to run her family smoothly. She sells various qualities of cloth in her shop. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 10000.00 to buy various sorts of cloth for her business.

loans.use: to buy various sorts of cloth for her business

loans.name: Fadila's T.c.a Group

texts.en:
Fadila is a married woman with three children aged between 18 and 28. She also takes care of five other children aged between 16 and 8 years old. She became a food seller in 2003. Every day, she works from 6.30 AM to 9 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Fadila now hopes for a loan to buy more rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members. One runs a salon and the other is a shopkeeper.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Mrs. Jayanti K. lives in an extended family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and three daughters in a village called Khogana Dobato. All three of her daughters are enrolled in school, in grades 12, 8, and 6 respectively.

Both Mrs. Jayanti K. and her husband Mr. Ram Hari K. are farmers in Khogana Dobato. They mostly prefer to grow seasonal vegetables on their land because they do not have modern technology. They sell their vegetables at the local market in the morning and in the evening.

Now Mrs. K. is seeking a loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: New Life 2020-A Group

texts.en:
This small group's leader is Jokudu M.. She currently sells bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Jokudu is 35 years old and is married to a security guard. She has three children in school, ranging in age from eight to sixteen years old. Each week Jokudu makes approximately 240 Sudanese pounds in profits. With her loan, Jokudu hopes to increase her sales.

Jokudu is joined in her small group by Tabu P., Jackline N., Rose D., and Joice K.. Tabu P. sells charcoal and wants to buy more charcoal for sale. Jackline N. sells cosmetics at a shop and wants a loan to open up a new restaurant. Rose D. sells charcoal and wants to open up a clinic. Joice K. owns a small shop and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Increase inventory to expand and create new businesses

loans.name: Yen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Yên năm nay 42 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 3 con trong đó có 1 người con đã trưởng thành. Khi mới tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị xin vay vòng vốn đầu là 1.000.000đ để sử dụng vào chăn nuôi cho thu nhập 500.000đ/ tháng. Nhận thấy công việc chăn nuôi không mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao, gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư vốn để buôn bán than. Đến nay qua 8 năm buôn bán than kinh tế gia đình chị đã rất ổn định. Anh chị đã tiết kiệm mua được 1 chiếc xe tải để sử dụng chở than đi bán. Ngoài ra anh chị vấn kết hợp chăn nuôi lợn gà tại gia đình. Với thu nhập ổn định từ chăn nuôi, buôn bán anh chị đã có điều kiện hơn để đầu tư cho việc học hành của con cái và mua sắm trang thiết bị trong gia đình.Vòng vốn tới anh chị mong muốn được vay 19.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn vào buôn bán than

Thu nhập 4.500.000đ/ tháng

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Mrs. L. Thi Yen, 43 year old, has 3 children, one of whom has stayed independent from the family. Joining TYM, she made the first loan of 1,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in live-stock, whose revenue was 500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Noticing the business would not be very successful, she switched and invested in retailing coal. For 8 years selling coal, she and her husband managed to foster the family’s financial situation. They saved enough money to buy a truck to transport more coal. Besides, they still raise pigs and chickens at home. The revenue from businesses allows their children to go to school and them to buy home facilities. They plan to borrow 19,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in coal retailing.

The family’s income is 4,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

loans.use: Coal Sales

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun S., 44, is married and lives with eight of her children in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. Since 1998 S. has had a business making many kinds of baskets. Her husband, Pich Bunphoeun (pictured from his house) owns a motorbike with a trailer and travels around the province selling S.'s baskets. S. employs two of her children as security and waitress. The other children help their mother making baskets.

S. would like a loan of $500 to purchase more bamboo. This will allow her to make more baskets to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more bamboo to make more basket.

loans.name: Ema's Pamoja Group

texts.en:
Ema is 32 years old. She is married and she has four children aged 20, 17, 15 and 11. She also takes care of 3 other people aged 28, 18 and 16 years old. She became a fruit and vegetables seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 7.30 AM to 5 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Ema now hopes for a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with maize sales, shopkeeping, tailoring and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn S., 38, works together with her husband, Khim Bora, running a small grocery store in their home. They have three children, and they would like to see their US$3 per day income increased.

Yorn S. has asked for a loan of US$300 to purchase more grocery products and expand her current family business. She believes that by offering a wider variety of products, she can expand her customer base and increase her income. She looks forward to seeing how this investment will impact her business and is optimistic about improving her family's standard of living and quality of life.

loans.use: Increase grocery inventory

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Mr. Tuy L. lives in Koh Prak Village in Kandal Province. He is a farmer who always cultivates twice a year. In the rainy season, he cultivates rice, while he grows vegetable (beans, cabbage, etc.) in the dry season. Nowadays, Mr. Tuy L. needs to grow rice because it is the rainy season; unfortunately, he does not have enough money to purchase rice seeds. Thus, Mr. Tuy L. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, and he would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer. His wife, Mrs. Sath Chea, helps him in the field. Mr. Tuy L. is 67 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is 35 years old and has been married already but still lives with Mr. Tuy L.. That child is employed in a garment factory while another one is a house constructor. The youngest one is attending high school. Mr. Tuy L., his wife and his granddaughter are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Hoi Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hợi năm nay 59 tuổi. Tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương với số vốn vay vòng 1 là 2.000.000 đ chị đã sử dụng để kinh doanh buôn bán nhưng vốn là người phụ nữ năng động, nhận thấy nhu cầu thuê quần áo biểu diễn tại địa phương ngày càng phát triển chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư vốn cùng với con gái mở cửa hàng may và cho thuê trang phục biểu diễn. Cùng với sự phát triển của phong trào văn hoá văn nghệ quần chúng tại địa phương công việc của gia đình chị ngày càng cho thu nhập cao. Ngoài thu nhập từ cho thuê trang phục biểu diễn chị và con gái còn có thêm nguồn thu từ chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm trang phục biểu diễn về cho thuê.

Thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Mrs. Hoi Thi N., 59 year old, made the first loan of 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in retailing. Noticing the potential needs for performing costumes in local areas, she and her daughter used the next loans to open a performing costumes making and renting store. Thanks to the development of entertaining performance movement, the store is a successful investment with increasing revenue. Besides, they also have income from farming. She plans to borrow 10,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy more costumes to rent.

The family income’s 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

loans.use: Performing costumes rental store

loans.name: Surja Maiya

texts.en:
Surja Maiya M. is a resident of Thecho Village. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district. The majority of the people living in this region are Newar, the indigenous people of Nepal's Kathmandu Valley. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Most of the people living in this region are engaged in seasonal farming.

Mrs. Surja Maiya M. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and one son. Mrs. Surja Maiya M. is engaged in selling chickens. Her husband and son also equally contribute their effort to that business. They sell broiler chickens in their shop.

Due to the increasing demand of their customers, Mrs. Surja Maiya M. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 20000.00 to buy chickens for their business.

loans.use: To buy chickens for re-sale

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 48 years old. She is married and she has 9 children. She became a tailor in 1987. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 8 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $145 from her sales.

Rehema now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items fro her business

loans.name: Mayasa

texts.en:
Mayasa is 30 years old. She is married and she has 5 children. She became a fish seller in 2005. Every day, she works from 6 AM to 3 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $185 from her sales.

Mayasa now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Loan Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Loan là một phụ nữ còn trẻ tuổi nhưng rất năng động. Trong khi hầu hết các gia đình khác tại nông thôn đều có thu nhập từ chăn nuôi và trồng trọt thì chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh quần áo. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi lấy quần áo từ thành phố về để chị bán tại địa phương. Ngoài ra tận dụng thời gian rảnh rỗi anh chị còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn, gà vì thế thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định. Hai con của anh chị cũng nhờ đó mà được đầu tư, chăm sóc tốt hơn.Chị mong muốn vòng vốn tới được vay 19.000.000đ để đầu tư vào kinh doanh quần áo và chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình.

Thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Mrs. Loan is a young and motivated woman. While most of the families in local areas specialize in farming, she bravely invested in a clothingstore. Her husband buys clothes in a near-by city and brings them home for her to sell to local customers. Beside this business, they also raise pigs and chickens at home, improving the family’s income. Therefore, they are able to take care of their children properly. She plans to borrow 19,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in the store and live-stocks.

The family’s income is 3,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

loans.use: Clothing store

loans.name: Vay

texts.en:
Vay S., 44, is married and lives with four of her children in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She also has two children who are married and no longer live at home. She and her husband are pictured in front of their home.

Vay S. sells Khmer noodles in the village and earns about $5 each day; her husband has a business selling firewood and also earns $5 each day.

Vay S. will use her loan to replace the hand-tractor's tire and to purchase land where she can grow rice and raise domestic animals. She hopes this will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To replace the hand-tractor's tire and purchase land to grow rice and raise animals.

loans.name: Dus Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Dus Maiya M., a resident of Thecho, lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two children. Her daughter and son are studying in grades 5 and 2 respectively.

Mrs. Dus Maiya M. and her husband Mr. Nucha Maharjanare both engaged in idol making. They make different types of traditional gods' idols. They make idols according to the demand of their customers. Nowadays in their area, the demand for idols is increasing so to meet the demand, they need to invest funds in their business but due to lack of funds they are unable to meet the demands of their customers. So Mrs. M. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 20000.00 to buy raw materials like wax, silver, bronze, etc. for their business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Thi Mo

texts.vi:
Mrs. Mo, 48 years old, has two grown-up children. Before joining the TYM Fund, her family mainly focused on farming and raising livestock for a living. After joining the Fund, she decided to open a clothes shop in the market. She used the first loan of 2,000,000VND (about 133USD) to invest in this shop, which helped to increase her family's monthly income by 400,000VND (about 26USD). After a period of using the loans effectively, her family has become one of the better-off families in the village. Her husband works as a construction worker with the monthly income of 1,500,000VND (about 100USD). This time, she would like to borrow 450USD to invest in her clothes shop. Her family's monthly income is 2,500,000VND (about 166USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Mơ năm nay 48 tuổi, gia đình chị hiện có hai con đã trưởng thành. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào trồng trọt và chăn nuôi.Sau khi được vay vốn từ Quỹ tình thương chị đã quyết định đầu tư vào kinh doanh quần áo tại chợ. Với 2.000.000đ chị vay vòng vốn 1 chị đã đầu tư để kinh doanh, thu nhập của gia đình chị tăng thêm 400.000đ/ tháng. Đến nay qua một thời gian sử dụng vốn hiệu quả gia đình chị đã trở thành một trong những hộ gia đinh có kinh tế khá trong thôn. Chồng chị hàng ngày đi làm thợ xây cho thu nhập ổn định 1.500.000đ/ tháng.Vòng vốn tơi chị mong muốn được vay 7000.000 để đầu tư kinh doanh quần áo Thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Invest in clothes shop

loans.name: Put

texts.en:
Put K., 51, lives in Dangkao with her husband, Soa Choeun, and their three children.

Put K. works as a seamstress out of her home and typically makes US$0.50 each day. Her husband works on a farm, growing rice and other vegetables, generating US$1 in income each day. The family is also supported through the employment of their three daughters, who all work in the local garment factories and each make US$3 per day.

Put K. has asked for a loan of US$800 to purchase more materials for her business and also to repair her home. She believes this loan is a valuable investment for her family, and will allow her to improve her family's quality of life and standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase pieces of cloth and repair home

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 30 years old. She is married and she has 6 children. She became a food seller in 2007. Every day, she works from 5 AM to 8 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Salma now hopes for a loan to buy more food items like rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Thi Bay

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Bay, 59 years old, has 3 grown-up children. Her husband is a retired army officer. In 2000, she joined the TYM Fund and borrowed the first loan of 2,000,000VND (about 133USD) to start a business. After 8 years of borrowing, currently she has a beauty salon at home. Her business has been better over time, yielding substantial profit. Besides taking care of the salon, she also rears pigs and chickens to gain additional income. This time, she would like to borrow 625USD to purchase more tools for the salon. Her monthly income is 4,000,000VND (about 266USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Bảy năm nay 59 tuổi, chồng chị là sỹ quan quân đội đã nghỉ hưu, gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành.Năm 2000 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương, vòng vốn đầu chị vay 2000000đ để đầu tư vào kinh doanh. Đến nay qua 8 năm sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả chị đã đầu tư mở được một cửa hàng trang điểm, làm tóc tại gia đình. Công việc kinh doanh của chị đang ngày càng thuận lợi và cho thu nhập cao. Ngoài thời gian làm việc tại cửa hàng chị cùng gia đình còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn, gà vì thế kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000 đ đầu tư mua thêm dụng cụ để phục vụ cho cửa hàng. Thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: investing in her beauty salon

loans.name: Amadou Oury

texts.fr:
Amadou Oury S. is a young shopkeeper who retails basic need goods. He is able to look after his family thanks to his small business. He is asking for this loan to augment his stock of merchandise in preparation for the month of Ramadan, during which demand will increase.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Amadou Oury S. est un jeune commerçant qui vend au détail des denrées de premiéres nécessité. Il entretient sa famille grâce à son petit commerce. Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en perspective du mois de Ramadan durant lequel la demande va augmenter.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya is 31 years old. She is divorced and she has 7 children. She became a fruit seller in 2005. Every day, she works from 5 AM to 9 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Raya now hopes for a loan to buy more fruit for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for her business

loans.name: Thi Ly

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ly, 51 years old, has 3 grown-up children. Before joining the TYM Fund, her family's income came mainly from farming, livestock and her husband's income as a hired worker. After joining the Fund, she had more capital to invest in buying and selling poultry. Her first loan of 1,000,000VND (about 66USD) was used to purchase poultry from various poultry farms and resell them in wet market and kiosks. This business has brought about a substantial source of income for her family. Currently, her husband and children also help her in this business. Everyday, her husband and children buy poultry and resell them to various restaurants, while she sells them in the market. With the experiences obtained in 8 years, she is able to improve her family's economy, and her family's monthly income is now 4,000,000VND (266USD). This time, she would like to borrow 925USD to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lý năm nay 51 tuổi,gia đình chị có 3 con đã trưởng thành.Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi, trồng trọt và tiền đi làm thuê của chồng chị . Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương, có thêm vốn chị đã đầu tư vào buôn bán gà vịt. Với số vốn 1.000.000đ được vay ở vòng 1 chị đã sử dụng để đi mua gia cầm từ các trang trại về bán lẻ tại chợ và các đại lý. Công việc kinh doanh thuận lợi đã đem về thu nhập đáng kể cho gia đình. Hiện nay hai vợ chồng chị cùng các con đều tham gia buôn bán gà, vịt. Hàng ngày chồng chị và các con đi lấy hàng về bán lại cho các cửa hàng ăn, đại lý còn chị bán lẻ tại chợ. Với những kinh nghiệm kinh doanh đã được tích luỹ trong 8 năm thu nhập của gia đình chị ngày càng tăng lên, hiện nay tổng thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 4.000.000đ/tháng. Vòng vốn tới gia đình chị mong muốn dược vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mở rộng mô hình kinh doanh, buôn bán.

loans.use: selling poultry

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Mrs. Lach S. and her husband, Mr. Chheng Koy, are fishermen in Domrey Chhlang Village in Kandal Province. Aside from this business, they are pig breeders and they can make a small income on their two businesses. They have seven children, one who is employed in a garment factory, while five others are attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or attend school.  Mrs. Lach S.'s family now lives in poor conditions and her house does not have a kitchen for cooking. Thus, Mrs. Lach S. decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers to build a kitchen in order to cook a delicious food for her family. Mrs. Lach S. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy timbers to build a kitchen in order to cook a delicious food for her family.

loans.name: Rock City 2030-C Group

texts.en:
This small group's leader is Santina P.. She currently sells bread and is requesting a loan to build a house to rent. Santina is 38 years old and is married to a farmer. She has four children in school, ranging in age from six to eighteen years old. Each week Santina makes approximately 150 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Santina is joined in her small group by Grace L., Magret Gabriel, Hellen K., and Rose J.. Grace L. sells charcoal and wants to expand her business. Magret Gabriel sells biscuits at her shop and wants to expand the shop. Hellen K. sells cakes and breads in a shop and wants to construct an oven. Rose J. sells fruits at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Build a house to rent and expand their respective businesses.

loans.name: Mor Anta

texts.fr:
Mor Anta S. is a young entrepreneur in computing services, the sale of cell phones, motorcycle taxi services, etc. He is asking for this loan to strengthen his working capital. With his business, Mor supports his family and has created two (2) jobs in his multiservice area situated in the Boucotte business district in Ziguinchor.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon

Ce jeune entrepreneur est dans les services: cyber, vente de téléphones portable, moto taxi etc Il demande ce crédit pour renforcer son fond de roulement. Avec ses activités Mor soutient sa famille et a créé deux (02) emplois dans son espace multiservices situé au quartier des affaires Boucotte de Ziguinchor

loans.use: For various services

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is 27 years old. She is married and she has two children. She became a tailor in 1995. Every day, she works from 10 AM to 8 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $165 from her sales.

Salama now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items for her business

loans.name: Thi Gai

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Gai has been a member of the TYM Fund for 8 years. Before joining the Fund, her family relied mainly on farming and raising livestock just like many other families in the rural areas. After obtaining the first loan, Mrs. Gai invested in raising quails to sell their eggs. This helped to improve her family's income. Not only did she use the subsequent loans to continue raising quails, but she also discussed with her family to purchase machinery to make tofu. This is a suitable food for the income and demand of the rural people so the production and sale of tofu has brought about a stable source of income for her family. Currently, her husband raises 500 quails, while Mrs. Gai and her children make tofu to sell in the market. This time round, she would like to borrow 925USD to purchase bird feeds and raw material to make tofu. Her family's monthly income is about 3,000,000VND (about 200USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Gái là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương đã được 8 năm. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương, cũng giống như nhiều gia đình khác ở nông thôn thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Sau khi được vay vốn của Quỹ gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào nuôi chim cút lấy trứng bán. Công việc nuôi chim đã giúp cho kinh tế gia đình chị phát triển hơn. Không chỉ đầu tư nuôi chim cút các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đã bàn bạc với gia đình mạnh dạn sử dụng vốn đầu tư mua máy để sản xuất đậu phụ. Đây là một loại thực phẩm rất phù hợp với kinh tế và nhu cầu của người dân vùng nông thôn nên công việc sản xuất và bán đậu phụ đã đem lại nguồn thu nhập rất ổn định cho gia đình chị . Hiện nay chồng chị đang nuôi 500 con chim cút, chị và các con làm đậu phụ để bán tại chợ. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thức ăn nuôi chim và mua nguyên liệu để sản xuất đậu phụ. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Buying bird feeds

loans.name: Hija

texts.en:
Hija is 32 years old. She is married and she has 5 children. She became a fish seller in 2002. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 6 PM at her business.

Hija now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Rauf

texts.ru:
Rauf N. is a young man of 22 years with a post-secondary education, unmarried, lives with his parents. After graduating from the university, Rauf was an apprentice to a master sculptor. Together they did contract work, remodeling homes and apartments and also taking on commissions from various organizations for sculptures and monuments. After two years of apprentice work, Rauf wants to work on his own. He has learned his craft fully and is a master at what he does. That is why, after taking out the loan, Rauf wants to spend the money to purchase tools and equipment for sculpting. This is why he's turned to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Негматов Рауф парнишка в возросте 22 года , имеет высшее образование , пока не женат живёт с родителями.После окончания ВУЗа Рауф был учеником у мастера своего дела скульптора,они на заказ работали по европейскому ремонту домов и квартир у людей, а также принемали на заказ скульптуры и памятники от организаций.После 2 годов ученической работы Рауф хочет самостоятельно начать работать , т.к. он полностью обучился работе и стал мастером своего дела.Но у него возникла проблема отсутствия своего нужного для работы оборудования и приборов для работы. Поэтому Рауф хочет получив займ купить себе инструменты и оборудование для скульпторской работы. Для чего обратился в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Personal loan

loans.name: Hai Amarat 2038-D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Flora W.. She is currently in the business of selling vegetable oil and onions and is requesting a loan to set up a petrol sales point. Flora is 50 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 5 children ranging in age from 14 to 28, and her younger children go to school. Each week, Flora makes approximately 300 Sudanese pounds in profit and with the extra money from her loan, she hopes to be able to set up a petrol sales point.

Flora is joined in her small group by Daruka S., Mariya Salka, Mary W., and Rejina S.. Daruka S. has a business selling clothes and wants to expand the business. Mariya Salka is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to build a house for her own use. Mary W. operates a business baking bread and wants to expand her bakery. Rejina S. is currently in the business of selling vegetables out of her home and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: set up a petrol sales point

loans.name: Mwanakombo's Uvivu Si Kazi Group

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is 54 years old. She is married and she has two children aged 8 and 10. She is a chicken and bread seller. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 5 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $255 from her sales.

Mwanakombo now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Fatma, who has a business selling snacks.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for her business

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is 49 years old. She is a widow with 6 children aged between 2 and 21. She also takes care of a 70-year-old person. She has been a seller of snacks since 1993. Every day, she works from 6 AM to 4 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

In the past, Tatu has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Tatu now hopes for a loan to buy more products for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Nguyen is 30 years old. Currently she and her husband are running a refreshment beverage café out of their home. She has two children who are going to school. With a favorable storefront position and high quality customer service, the café is always able to attract a large number of customers. The family’s income is increasing day by day. Besides the main business at the café, the couple also raise pigs to supplement their income and invest in the children’s schooling. In this round of funding she is requesting 15,000,000 VND to buy more types of beers and beverages to sell. Their average monthly income is 3,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Liên năm nay 30 tuổi, hiện nay hai vợ chồng chị đang kinh doanh cửa hàng giải khát tại gia đình.Gia đình chị hiện có hai con đang tuổi đi học. Với vị trí kinh doanh thuận lợi và thái độ phục vụ khách hàng chu đáo cửa hàng của gia đình chị luôn thu hút được số lượng khách hàng rất đông. Thu nhập của gia đình chị ngày càng được cải thiện. Ngoài thời gian làm việc tại cửa hàng vợ chồng chị còn kết hợp chăn nuôi thêm lợn để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình và đầu tư cho các con ăn học. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.0000.000 đ để đầu tư mua thêm các loại bia, nước uống giải khát để bán cho khách hàng. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Buy more beers, beverages

loans.name: Youssouph

texts.fr:
Youssouph M. is a carpenter working in Tiléne and supports his family. He is asking for this loan to buy lumber to meet the constantly increasing demand for furniture and other small wooden products. He also participates in the training and integration of youth in woodworking careers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Ce menuisier travaille à Tiléne et soutient sa famille. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des planches et faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante en meubles et autres petits équipement en bois. ce menuisier participe aussi à la formation et à l'insertion des jeunes dans les métiers du bois.

loans.use: To buy carpentry supplies

loans.name: Yoeut

texts.en:
Yoeut C., 23, is married and lives with one child in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia.

C. sells charcoal with the help of her husband, Phai Hang (pictured). Her business has been around for about over ten years and she makes US$2.5 every day. Selling charcoal has been a difficult business. She would like a loan to purchase a cart and motorbike to transport the charcoal for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and trailer for transporting charcoal.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen is 59 years old. Her famiL. currentL. lives in Ning Gian, Hai Duong. Besides income from raising livestock, they also do business selilng poultry at the market. Everyday her husband, a retired government worker, helps her butcher and prepare the poultry so she can sell it to the market-goers to use. Two of her three children are grown and help their parents in their free time. Not onL. does the famiL. sell poultry at the market, but they also deliver to customers’ houses; therefore they employ one person with a salary of more than 1,000,000 VND a month. With her husband’s pension, the famiL.’s income is very stable at 5,000,000 VND a month. In this round of funding she is requesting 15,000,000 VND to continue investing in the poultry business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lý năm nay 59 tuổi, gia đình chị hiện đang sống tại huyện Ninh Giang Tỉnh Hải Dương. Ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, hiện nay gia đình chị đang kinh doanh gia cầm tại chợ. Hàng ngày chồng chị - một cán bộ hưư trí thường giúp đỡ chị giết mổ gia cầm để chị bán cho người tiêu dung. Hai trong số ba người con của chị đã lớn và có thể phụ giúp cho anh chị trong lúc rảnh rỗi. Không chỉ bán gia cầm tại chợ gia đình chị còn phục vụ cho khách hàng mua tại nhà vì thế gia đình chị hiện đang có một người làm thuê với mức thu nhập trên 1.000.000đ/ tháng. Cùng với lương hưu của chồng thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định 5.000.000 / tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư vốn vào kinh doanh gia cầm.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo L., 33, owns a little grocery store in the local market where he sells a variety of goods, including coffee. He works together with his wife, Poi Khemara, and together they can make around $10 per day in revenue. They have a 3-year-old child to support and they live in Dangkao.

Keo L. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase more grocery products, allowing him to expand his options and increase his inventory. He believes that this will allow him to reach a wider customer base so he can increase his income to help provide for his family. L. looks forward to seeing the results of this investment and hopes that his family can become more economically secure for the future.

loans.use: Increase grocery inventory

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. S. Thi Nguyen is 56 years old. Prior to joining the Fund, her family’s finances faced many difficulties due to the unfornate passing of her husband while the children are still young. After joining the Fund, she has boldly borrowed money to invest in doing business. Being a quick-minded, smart woman, she easily familiarized herself with the details of business and trading. To date, she has become a woman who is very experienced with dealing in agricultural products. This business helped the family’s finances become more stable. Besides this business, she also worked with her son and daughter-in-law to raise chickens and fish. The family’s quality of life is getting better day by day. In this round of funding she is requesting 10,000,000 VND to invest in her business. Their average monthly income is 3,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Sâm năm nay 56 tuổi. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị gặp không ít khó khăn do chồng chị không may mất sớm, con còn nhỏ. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán. Là người phụ nữ nhanh nhẹn, tháo vát nên chị đã làm quen với công việc kinh doanh không mấy khó khăn. Đến nay chị đã trở thành một người phụ nữ có rất nhiều kinh nghiệm trong kinh doanh các mặt hàng thực phẩm. Và chính công việc kinh daonh đã giúp cho thu nhập của gia đình chị ổn định hơn. Ngoài kinh doanh buôn bán chị còn kết hợp cùng con trai và con dâu chăn nuôi thêm gà, cá. Cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang được cải thiện từng ngày. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vào kinh doanh phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Patima

texts.en:
Patima K. is 45  years old and married with six children. She began selling clothing in 2008. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90.
Patima now hopes for a loan of $275 to buy more clothes (khanga and vitenge) for her inventory.

loans.use: To buy clothing for her business

loans.name: Muon

texts.en:
Muon S., 20, is married and lives with her little child in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She runs a business selling grocery products in front of her house. On average, she makes $5 in profit a day. Her husband earns approximately $5 a day as well from his motor-taxi.

Muon would like to borrow money from Kiva via Credit, Kiva's local partner, to purchase a trailer to attach to their motorbike. In Cambodia, we call a motorbike with a trailer attached a “tuk tuk”. Most of the foreigners who visit Cambodia prefer to get a tuk tuk rather than riding on a simple motor-taxi. In the future, Muon plans to expand her store by diversifying her product range.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to attach to a motorbike

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma O. R. is 42 years old and married with four children, ages 22, 19, 15  and 3.  She sells perfumes and porridge, a business she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to 10 a.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $50. Mwajuma  now hopes for a loan of $150  to buy more perfumes for her business.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her perfume business

loans.name: Akossiwavi

texts.fr:
Ms. Akossiwavi A. was born in Lomé on February 1st, 1970. She's single and has one child to support. She sells coolers and plastic trays at the Agoè Assiyéyé market, one of Lomé's local markets. Additionally, she also sells staple products in her home shop. She would like to resupply her stock and seeks this first loan to purchase 100 trays and 100 coolers.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Demoiselle A. Akossiwavi est née le 1er février 1970 à Lomé. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant en charge. Elle exerce le commerce de glacières et de plats en plastique dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé l’un des marchés locaux de Lomé. En plus de cette activité elle vend quelques produits de premières nécessités dans son magasin à la maison. Elle veut reconstituer son stock et sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 100 plats et 100 glacières.

loans.use: To purchase plastic trays and coolers

loans.name: Ambroise

texts.fr:
Ambroise D. is a young carpenter based in the Tiléne-Kadior area. He is asking for this loan to buy lumber and to make furniture for his customers. Thanks to his business, he is able to support his family, based in Joal.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Ambroise est un jeune menuisier basé au quartier de Tiléne -Kadior. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des planches et confectionner des meubles pour sa clientéle. Grâce à ses activités il arrive à soutenir sa famille basée à Joal.

loans.use: To buy carpentry supplies

loans.name: Cvijeta

texts.en: Cvijeta is a woman living in the community of Strijezevica, outside the town of Doboj.  She is divorced and is raising 2 children.  She currently works as a veterinarian, earning around 600 KM ($450 USD) per month.  She also receives some small welfare support for her children.  This is her first loan through  Zene za Zene, and she has requested a loan amount of 1200 KM.  She wants to use the loan to buy some young chickens and piglets.  She will purchase some food to feed and fatten them, and then sell them for a good price when they are grown and their meat is most valuable.  She hopes that this will bring her family some extra income that can be used to meet their everyday needs.

loans.use: To buy chickens and piglets for fattening

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Eya D. is a 38 year old widow and the mother of five (5) children. Her business is selling pagnes (decorative cloth) in Avetonou, a village located about 100 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. With this second loan from FECECAV she would like to increase the size of her business by acquiring a greater number of customers and increasing her revenues. This will assist with improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer.

Eya D. est âgée de 38 ans, veuve et mère de 5 enfants. Elle tient le commerce de pagnes à Avétonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV accroîitre la taille de son activité pour attirer beaucoup plus de clientèle et dégager ainsi beaucoup de bénéfice. Ce faisant elle contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of Pagnes (Decorative cloth) for resale

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Vu, 59 years old, has three grown children. After joining the Fund, she borrowed 2,000,000 VND to invest in buying manufacturing equipment for the lumber factory her famiL. owns. With the successful usage of this loan, her famiL. now has lumber factory that is quite reputable in the region. The factory not onL. creates stable jobs for her children but also create jobs for people in town. Besides helping her husband and the children in the factory, Mrs. Vu also raise chickens and fish, so the famiL.’s income is very stable. Her famiL. is one of the families in the region that is doing business with postive results in the region. In this round of funding she is requesting 19,000,000 VND to invest in buying more machinery and wood for the factory. Their average monthL. income is 5,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Lý năm nay 59 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 người con đều đã trưởng thành. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị đã vay 2.000.000đ để đầu tư mua dụng cụ sản xuất phục vụ cho xưởng mộc của gia đình. Với việc sử dụng vốn vay ngày càng hiệu quả hiện nay gia đình chị đã có một xưởng mộc khá quy mô tại địa phương. Xưởng mộc của gia đình chị không những tạo được công việc ổn định cho các con mà còn tạo thêm được công ăn việc làm cho người dân trong thôn. Ngoài thời gian phụ giúp chồng con làm mộc chị Lý còn kết hợp chăn nuôi thêm gà, cá nên thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định. Gia đình chị hiện là một trong những hộ gia đình làm ăn hiệu quả tại địa phương. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 19.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm máy móc, gỗ phục vụ cho xưởng mộc của gia đình. Thu nhập : 5.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Buy wood, machinery

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Chhum S., 46, operates a motor-taxi service in Dangkao, where he lives with his wife, Sok Phinin, and their three children. Two of his children are younger and still in school, while one of his sons works in construction and helps support the family with his US$ 2 per day income.

Chhum S.'s motor-taxi service typically generates US$ 4 each day in income, while his wife sells a Vietnamese noodle dish called "Ban Srung" and typically makes US$ 4 each day as well.

Chhum S. has asked for a loan of US$ 1000 to open up a cafe for his wife. He would like to purchase some equipment to make coffee and create a more permanent stall where his wife can sell her noodles. He believes that there is great customer demand for his wife's dish and that she can expand her customer base through this investment.

loans.use: Purchase equipment to open up a cafe

loans.name: Maryam's Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Maryam S. is 34 years old and married with three children, ages 16, 12  and 8. She owns a small restaurant and also sells clothing, which she has been doing since 1998. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $140.
Maryam  now hopes for a loan of $1000 to buy more  restaurant items and clothing for her business. She will share this loan with her group members: Mwanakombo, Zainab, Riziki, Mgeni and Sada.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Aminétou

texts.fr:
Mrs. A. Aminétou M. was born on March 8, 1970 in Alédjo in northern Togo. She is married to a salesman and has four children. Since her husband has an irregular income, she helps him with family expenses with the revenue that she acquires selling charcoal. She began this activity in 2001 and sells to retailers in her neighborhood. To avoid a stock shortage caused by the rain, she is requesting this first loan to buy 20 bags of charcoal in order strengthen her stock supply and be able to meet the demand of her clients.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame M. A. Aminétou est née le 8 mars 1970 à Alédjo au nord du Togo. Elle s’est mariée à un revendeur et a quatre enfants. Son mari ayant un revenu irrégulier, elle l’aide dans les dépenses de la famille avec le revenu qu’elle tire de la vente du charbon de bois. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2001 et vend aux détaillants de son quartier. Pour éviter une rupture de stock qui peut être liée à la pluie, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de charbon de bois afin de reconstituer son stock et de pouvoir faire face à la demande de ses clients.

loans.use: Purchase of 20 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Stara's Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Stara K. is 45 years old and married with two children aged 30 and 25.  She has been selling charcoal, firewood, and food since 1998. Every day she works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $155.
Stara now hopes for a loan of $925 to increase her inventory. She will share this loan with her group members, who also have businesses selling clothing, juice, and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Nataša

texts.en: Nataša is a young woman from the town of Doboj.  She is not married and supports herself by working in a local coffee bar.  Since her income from this job is pretty small - around 260 USD per month - Nataša wants to try her luck with a second business. She wants to start selling cosmetics and thinks this will be a good way to increase her overall income.  This is her first loan from Zene za Zene, which she requests in the amount of 600 KM, and all of it will go towards building this side business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Asha Muhammed Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Asha Mohamed. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Asha is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children ranging in age from 12 to 20 all of whom go to school. Each week, Asha earns approximately 50 Sudanese pounds in profit and with the extra money from this loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business. Asha is joined in her small group by Grace P., Leya T., Esther K., and Jenifa Y..

Grace P. has a business selling local brews and wants to expand the business. Leya T. is currently operating a business selling videos and televisions and wants a loan to expand her business. Esther K. operates a business selling green vegetables and beans and wants to expand the business. Jenifa Y. is currently in the business of selling bread, charcoal and vegetables from her home and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Expanding Various Retail Businesses

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun S., 23, works in the local garment factory together with her husband, Kruy Kry, and they live in Sa Ang. They each make US$ 2.50 per day in the factory and they have one young child at home that they support.

Bun S. has asked for a loan of US$ 600 to open a stand selling vegetables in the market. She sees this additional source of income as giving her family some economic stability and diversifying her sources of income. This will also allow the family to better support their young child and they look forward to the benefits that this loan can provide.

loans.use: Open up a vegetable stand in the market

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili J. S. is 30 years old and married with four children, ages9, 7, 5 and 2.  She has been selling charcoal and clothing since 2006. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $90.
Pili now hopes for a loan of $275 to buy more charcoal  for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Darjana

texts.en:
Darjana is a young woman from the town of Doboj. She is not married, and to support herself she has been working as a waitress in a local coffee bar. However, she is only able to earn 300 KM (around 230 USD) a month from this job, which is not enough to live off of.

To supplement her income, she works as a typist, getting business from students and other individuals, and can earn around 200 KM per month, depending on how much work she has. She is requesting this loan from Zene za Zene to buy a new printer. She cannot afford to buy a new one on her salary, but she needs this printer to be able to do her work.

Darjana hopes that she will continue to get new clients and keep increasing her income through this side business.

loans.use: To buy a new printer to assist her in her typing business

loans.name: Rakiétou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Rakiétou T. was born December 31, 1987 in Bafilo in the Kara region of Togo. She comes from a modest family and has worked in small business since her childhood. She is married to Mr. Yérima Fousseni and has one child. Since 2006, she has become involved in the sale of grain and charcoal in Adidogomé and Agoè markets. This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy three bags of corn, four bags of rice and four bags of sorghum in order to increase her stock of grain over charcoal.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame TRAORE -YAYA Rakiétou est née le 31 décembre 1987 à Bafilo dans la région de la Kara au Togo. Elle est issue d’une famille modeste et exerce le petit commerce depuis son enfance. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur FOUSSENI Yérima et à un enfant. Depuis 2006 elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de céréales et de charbon de bois dans les marchés d’Adidogomé et d’Agoè. Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter trois (3) sacs de maïs, quatre (4) sacs de Riz et quatre (4) sacs de sorgho afin de reconstituer son stock de céréales au détriment de charbon de bois.

loans.use: Purchasing grain

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is 30 years,She is a married woman with 4 children ages between 9 and 2. She is a charcoal and clothes since seller in 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Pili now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en: Arafa M. is 25 years old. She sells charcoal and juice; a business she started in 2008. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $78. Arafa now hopes for a loan of $175 to buy more charcoal and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Ngheb

texts.en:
Ngheb C., 37, works out in her fields as a farmer together with her husband. They make US$ 2 each day and they are aided by the support of one of their children who works in a local garment factory and makes US$ 2 each day as well. They have four other children at home to support and are seeking ways to increase their income and care for their large family.

Ngheb C. has asked for a loan of US$ 400 to purchase seeds to expand her family's farm and increase her yields. She believes this investment will increase her family's income and allow them to improve their standard of living. It will also help to create some economic stability for the future.

loans.use: Purchase seeds to expand her farm

loans.name: Palakiyem

texts.fr:
Born on March 10, 1970 in Elavagnon, a village situated in the Plateau Region of Togo, Mrs. Palakiyem T. moved to Lomé where she works in the sale of teak wood. She is married to Mr. Kpegouni Tchatikpi, who is a taxi driver. She has two children and handles their school expenses. This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 60 teak trunks so that she can better serve her clients, who are primarily the bakers of her neighborhood.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 10 mars 1970 à Elavagnon, village situé dans la région des plateaux au Togo, madame T. Palakiyem s’est installée à Lomé où elle exerce le commerce de rechutes de teck. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur TCHATIKPI Kpegouni qui est un conducteur de taxi. Elle a deux enfants et s’occupe de leur frais de scolarité. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 60 rechutes de teck afin de bien servir ses clients qui sont pour la plupart les boulangers de son quartier.

loans.use: Purchase of teak wood

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjovi T. was born in 1979 in Lomé. She is married and has two children. Her main business is selling bread in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in Lomé. Her primary suppliers are bakers and often she buys bread on credit and sells it before reimbursing her lenders. She has benefited from one loan through WAGES and is requesting this second loan in order to make purchases in cash so that she can earn a good income.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame T. Adjovi est né en 1979 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et a deux (2) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de pain dans le quartier Adidogomé à Lomé. Ses principaux fournisseurs sont les boulanger et souvent elle achète du pain à crédit et le revend avant de rembourser son créancier. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter au comptant afin de pouvoir gagner un bon revenu.

loans.use: Purchasing bread

loans.name: Rabia's Wache Waseme Group

texts.en:
Rabia R. is 25 years old and married. She started her business selling meat in 2007. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $90.

Rabia now hopes for a loan of $1000 to buy more chicken and beef for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who lso have businesses selling soap and coconut oil, clothing and cakes, charcoal and groceries.

loans.use: To buy more chicken and beef for her business

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
A. Suhrob lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 23 years old. He recently got married. He has no children. He lives with his parents, and is the sole bread-winner for the whole family. He works as a contract-based taxi driver. He has a "Tiko" car. The income isn't bad, but is enough just for day-to-day expenses. Now he wants to take out a loan to be able to pay for a wedding for his sister. He only needs $800 USD. He plans to take out this loan for ten months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Алиев Сухроб житель города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 23 года . Не так давно женился . Детей не имеет. Проживает вместе с родителями , поэтому он один обеспечивает всю семью. Работает частным таксистом. Имеет автомашину «Тико». Работа приносит не плохой доход , но его хватает на текущие расходы. Сейчас хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы провести свадьбу сестры. Ему не хватает всего 800 долларов США. Срок на который он планирует получить кредит 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Wedding.

loans.name: Bozor

texts.ru:
Bozor S. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda with his six children. He works at an aluminum plant. His wages are barely enough to support his family. Now he's planning to take out a loan and purchase a car called "Tiko". He will use the car as a taxi. This will help the family increase its income and improve living conditions. He plans to repay the loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Сатторов Бозор житель города Турсун-Заде. Женат , имеет шестерых детей. Работает на аллюминиевом заводе. Зарплата , получаемая им еле хватает для того , чтобы прокормить семью. Сейчас он планирует получить кредит и купить автомобиль « Тико». Использовать машину будет в качестве такси. Это поможет семье увеличить доходы и создать лучшие условия. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Car purchase

loans.name: Kayi Afi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kayi Afi D. was born on November 14, 1975 in Lomé. Married and the mother of two children, she works in selling cosmetic products in Lomé. She began this activity in 1999 and is the first to open this type of store in her neighborhood. She welcomes many clients throughout the day and generates large revenues. She has previously benefited from one loan through WAGES and promptly reimbursed it. This second loan that she is requesting will allow her to go to Accra, Ghana’s capital, in order to purchase cosmetic products such as 5 boxes of lotion and 3 boxes of perfume.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame D. Kayi Afi est née le 14 novembre 1975 à Lomé. Mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants, elle exerce le commerce de produits cosmétiques à Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1999 et est la première à ouvrir ce genre de magasin dans son quartier. Elle accueille beaucoup de clients à longueur de journée et réalise de gros chiffre d’affaires. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et a fait un prompt remboursement. Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’aller à Accra la capitale de Ghana pour faire l’approvisionnement des produits cosmétiques tels que 5 cartons de lait et 3 cartons de parfum.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Nakama D 2013-3 Group

texts.en:
This small group's leader is Susan P.. She currently sells charcoal and bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Susan is 35 years old and is married to a teacher. She has two children in school, aged five and fifteen years old. Each week Susan makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits. With her loan, Susan hopes to expand her inventory.

Susan is joined in her small group by Nartisio A., Amal H., Rose L., and Mary L.. Nartisio A. sells sweets at a shop and wants to expand the shop. Amal H. sells meat and rice at a hotel and wants a loan to expand her business. Rose L. sells bread and tea and wants to increase her inventory. Mary L. sells text books at a book shop and is requesting a loan to help increase her sales.

loans.use: Increase inventory to expand their respective businesses

loans.name: Nosir.

texts.ru:
Nosir B. lives in the area of Khuroson, in the settlement Pakhtaobod. He works as a teacher at the high school. He also rent land, which he uses to sow cereal cultures. He sells the crop a the local market. He plans to receive a loan, which he plans to use for agriculture to buy seed and fertilizer. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Бобоев Носир житель районеа Хуросон , поселка Пахтаобод. Работает учителем в средней школе . Кроме того арендует землю , которую использует для посева злаковых культур. Получаемый урожай реализует на рынке. Планирует получить кредит , который хочет использовать в сельском хозяйстве , для приобретения семян и удобрений. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Yawa Kafui

texts.fr:
Born on October 13, 1982 in Agou Nyogbo, a village situated 110km from Lomé, Miss Yawa Kafui A. is single with one child in her care. She is trained as a nurse but has become a salesperson of hardware supplies in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in Lomé. She gets her supplies at the large stores of the Adawlato market and displays hardware items in her store. This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 7 boxes of paint cans, 10 packets of nails and the rest of the loan will help her arrange her store.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 13 octobre 1982 à Agou Nyogbo, village situé à 110 Km de la ville de Lomé, Demoiselle A. Yawa Kafui est célibataire avec un enfant en charge. Elle est infirmière de formation mais est devenu revendeuse des articles de quincaillerie dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grands magasins du marché d’Adawlato et expose des articles de quincaillerie dans son magasin. Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 7 cartons de boite de peinture, 10 sachets de cloues et le reste du crédit lui permettra d’aménager son magasin.

loans.use: Purchase of hardware supplies

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.ru:
Ahmadjon R. lives in the area of Khuroson. He is involved in agricultural business. He buys and resells large-horned cattle. He has been involved in this type of business for five years. He wants to increase his commodity circulation and wants to receive a loan. This will help him receive more revenue which is vital for his large family of eight children. He plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Рабиев Ахмаджон проживает в районе Хуросон. Занимается бизнесом в сфере животноводства. Покупает и перепродает крупно-рогатый скот.Занимается данным видом бизнеса уже 5 лет.Хочет увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита . Это поможет получить дополнительную прибыль необходимую для его большой семьи. Ведь у него 8 детей. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of KPC

loans.name: Kodzovi Mawuena

texts.fr: Kodzovi Mawuena A. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants.  Il habite et travaille dans son propre atelier de soudure à Avétonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise.  Avec ce crédit, il souhaite aménéger son atelier et acquérir des outils de travail. Les profits qui se dégageront de son activité lui permettront de supporter les besoins de ses enfants et améliorer les conditions de la vie.  Monsieur Mawuena est un bon client puisqu’il a déjà bénéficié de plus de trois crédits et les remboursements ont été réguliers.

loans.use: Aménager son atelier et acheter des outils de travail

loans.name: Abdurahmon.

texts.ru:
Abdurahmon Q. lives in the area of Khuroson. He is married and has six children. He has a very big family and therefore he has to work a lot so that he can support them. he works as a teacher at the high school, other than that he works in agriculture. He plans to get ready for the fall sowing season, and therefore he plans to receive a loan so that he can buy seed and fertilizer. This will help him grow a good crop, which he can than sell. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Курбоназаров Абдурахмон житель района Хуросон. Женат имеет шестерых детей. Очень большая семья , поэтому ему приходится много работать для того , чтобы прокормить семью. Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того занимается земледелием. Планирует подготовиться к осеннему посевному сезону, поэтому решил получить кредит для покупки семян и удобрений. Это поможет ему получить качественный урожай , который затем он сможет незамедлительно продать. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi M. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and one son in Thecho, Lalitpur. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Both Mrs. M. and her husband Cheri Babu M. are engaged in wood craft work. They make different types of wood craft according to the orders they receive.

Now Mrs. M. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 15000.00 loan to buy timbers and tools for their woodcraft work. Mrs. M. is saving her income to provide a good education for her son because the educational cost is very high in Nepal.

loans.use: To buy timber and tools

loans.name: Rahmatullo.

texts.ru:
Rahmatullo N. lives in the area of Abdurahmon Jomi, and is involved in agriculture. He owns a piece of land on which he sows wheat, flax and other grains. The second growing season is about to arrive, and it is vital to ready the land for the seeds. Therefore Rahmatullo plans to take out a loan so that he can buy seed and fertilizer. He then sells the crop at the market. He is 46 years old, married and has six children. He also works on a construction site, which helps him feed his family. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Назаров Рахматулло житель района Абдурахмони Джоми . Занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли . Сеет пшеницу , лен и различные кльтуры. Наступает сезон повторного посева , поэтому необходимо подготовить землю и семена. Поэтому он планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить семена и удобрения. Получаемый урожай реализует на рынке. Возраст 46 лет , Женат и имеет шестерых детей. Кроме земледелия работает на стройке, что позволяет прокормить семью. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kodzovi Mawuena

texts.fr:
Kodzovi Mawuena A. is 39 years old, married and the father of five (5) children. He occupies and works in his welding workshop in Avetonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this loan, he would like to reorganize his workshop and acquire work tools. The profit that he earns from this business allows him to support the needs of his children and improve the conditions of their lives. Mawuena is a good client as he has made more than three (3) previous loans and repaid them regularly. Mawuena is wearing a blue shirt (in the photo). The other persons are his apprentices.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer.

Kodzovi Mawuena A. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants. Il habite et travaille dans son propre atelier de soudure à Avétonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec ce crédit, il souhaite aménéger son atelier et acquérir des outils de travail. Les profits qui se dégageront de son activité lui permettront de supporter les besoins de ses enfants et améliorer les conditions de la vie. Monsieur Mawuena est un bon client puisqu’il a déjà bénéficié de plus de trois crédits et les remboursements ont été réguliers. Mawuane est celui habillé en chemise bleue. Les autres personnes sont ses apprentis

loans.use: To reorganize his workshop and purchase work tools

loans.name: Sanu Devi

texts.en:
Sanu Devi M., a resident of Thecho, lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two children. Her husband Mr. Sanjay M. is a carpenter. He opened his own furniture shop two years ago. He makes various kinds of furniture such as beds, chairs, tables, and drawers in his shop, according to the orders he receives from customers.

The demand for this furniture is increasing, so to meet the demand of the customers, he needs to purchase timbers but due to lack of funds, he is unable to purchase the timber. So Mrs. Sanu Devi is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 25000.00 to help her husband to purchase timber for his work because her husband's is the only source of income in her family.

Mrs. Sanu Devi has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 8 and her son is in grade 2.

loans.use: To buy timber for furniture-making

loans.name: Juma

texts.ru:
Juma Quamov is a farmer and is involved in the buying and selling of KPC. He brings in bulls, fattens them and then sells them to the meat market. He has been involved in this type of business for 15 years. Currently the price for livestock has increased, thus generating less revenue for Juma. He wants to secure his business and plans to receive a loan. His business provides the local market with meat, and with fresh livestock. Other than that Juma is the sole provider for his large family of his wife and their five children. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Каюмов Джума –фермер. Занимается купле-продажей КРС . Привозит бычков , откармливает и продает мясникам. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 15 лет. В связи с тем , что цены на животных поднялись , его оборотная сумма уменьшилась. Поэтому для того , чтобы восстановить дело он планирует получить кредит. Его бизнес позволяет обеспечить рынки мясом и здоровым скотом. Кроме того Джума один обеспечивает свою большую семью. Он женат и имеет пятерых детей.Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of КРС

loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
Mrs. Anju G. lives in Bagdol. Bagdol is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in running small businesses like grocery stores, small hotels, and stationery stores.

Mrs. G. has a five-member family, including her, her husband and three children. Her husband's name is Gopal G.. He is a retired army officer. Her daughter is studying in grade 7. Her older son is studying in grade 4 and her younger son is in primary school.

Mrs. G. opened her small restaurant 3 years ago. She sells different types of food items in her cafe. Especially, she sells Nepali food, but she also serves tea and coffee. Now Mrs. G. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 10000.00 to expand her business by purchasing necessary food ingredients for her business.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients for her cafe

loans.name: Attiogbe

texts.fr:
Mr Attiogbe D. was born in 1968 in Lomé. He is married and the father of three (3) children. He is a machinist and repairs sewing machines with replacement parts that he buys from the larger stores in Lomé. He is well known in his district as there are few people in Lomé that provide this service. He earns considerable revenue as he has a monopoly in his district. He also sells sewing machines. Presently, his stock has nearly run out and he must increase it. He is requesting his first loan to purchase ten (10) sewing machines and some replacement parts.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur D. Attiogbe est né en 1968 à Lomé. Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il est machiste et répare les machines à coudre avec les pièces de rechange qu’il achète dans les grands magasins de Lomé. Il est reconnu dans son quartier car c’est une activité qui est rarement exercé par les gens à Lomé. Il gagne assez de revenu car il détient le monopole dans son quartier. Il vend aussi des machines à coudre. Actuellement son stock est presque épuisé et il désire le refaire. A cet effet, avec ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite il désire acheter 10 machines à coudre et quelques pièces de rechange.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing machines and replacement parts

loans.name: Amonillo

texts.ru:
Amonillo B. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 42 years old, is married, and has six children. He has a shop in the center of his village. He is the only purveyor of food stuffs in his area. He has been doing this work for almost one year. The business produces an income which is only enough to feed his family since the margin on the goods is small. This helps to maintain customers, but to develop the business he must increase sales. This is possible only if he receives a loan. In this way, he can develop and strengthen his business. He plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Бекназаров Амонилло житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 42 года , женат и имеет шестерых детей. Имеет магазин в центре кишлака. Является единственным поставщиком продуктов питания в своей местности. Занимается данным видом бизнеса около одного года. Бизнес приносит доход , который хватает лишь на питание семьи, так как сверху товара он ставит небольшую наценку. Это помогает сохранить клиентов , но для развития бизнеса нужно увеличить товарооборот, что возможно лишь после получения кредита. Таким образом он сможет развивать и укрепить свое дело. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchasing goods

loans.name: Angèle Afi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Angele D. was born in 1964 and is originally from the city of Aneho. She is married and the mother of three (3) children. Her husband, Marc Hafia is a mason. Her principle business is the sale of plastic bins and ice coolers in the Adidogome district of Lomé. She started this business in 2004 and at that time did not have a store. Her business has evolved to where she now sells from her store and has acquired many clients during this time. She is requesting this first loan to increase her stock with 40 plastic bins and 15 ice coolers.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer.

Originaire de la ville d’Aného, dame D. Angèle Afi s’est marié à monsieur HAFIA Marc qui est un maçon. Elle est née en 1964 et est mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de plastique et de glacière dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle a commence cette activité depuis 2004 et n’avait pas de magasin en ce moment. Actuellement son activité évolue et elle vend dans son magasin et accueille beaucoup de client à longueur d’une journée. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock de plastique de 40 bassines et de 15 glacières.

loans.use: Purchase of Plastic Bins and Ice Coolers

loans.name: Radojka

texts.en: Radojka is a married woman living in the town of Doboj.  She has 2 children.  Her husband works for a construction firm, while Radojka helps support the family by working at a restaurant in town.  She is requesting her first loan from Žene za Žene in the amount of 1000 KM. She will use this money to buy materials and food ingredients to support her baking business. Radojka bakes cookies at home and sells these to her neighbors as well as the regular customers at the restaurant. She also may use part of the loan to help with repairs to her home.  Radojka hopes that she will earn enough from the cookie sales so she can help with her family’s expenses and pay off this loan on time.

loans.use: To buy materials and food ingredients to bake cookies

loans.name: Setha

texts.en:
Mrs. Setha P., 38, is a widow with four children; one son and three daughters. All of her children study in the local school. Setha and her children live with her old mother in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh.
 
Mrs. Setha has been selling beauty products since 1993. She buys them from a market in Phnom Penh for resale at her shop in the village market. Her business is doing very well because a lot of villagers come to her shop to buy her products. They don't want to spend a lot of time traveling to the market in Phnom Penh. 

Setha wants to purchase more beauty products to serve her customer's need and to repair a part of her shop. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $1000 USD to expand her business and repair her shop.

loans.use: To buy beauty product for resale and to repair her shop.

loans.name: Guy

texts.fr:
