Guy A. is 35 years old, married and the father of two children. It is with increasing difficulty that he is meeting the needs of his family due to the fact that he is a farmer and land suitable for cultivation is becoming rarer and less fertile. To earn more money to support his family, he is planning on changing businesses and becoming a motorcycle taxi driver in Avetonou, a village located 85 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this FECECAV loan, Mr. A. hopes to purchase his own motorcycle to start his business. With this opportunity from Kiva, he can begin to increase the quality of life for himself and for his family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Guy A. est âgé de 35ans, marié et père de deux enfants. Il subvient difficilement aux besoins de la famille parce qu’il travaille avec les cultivateurs et les terres cultivables deviennent de plus en plus rares et moins fertiles. Pour gagner plus de l’argent pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il prévoit changer d’activité pour conduire un taxi moto à Avétonou, un village situé à 85 km de Lomé la capitale du Togo. Avec ce crédit de FECECAV, Monsieur Guy espère acheter sa propre moto pour commencer son entreprise. Avec cette chance de Kiva, il peut commencer à tellement augmenter la qualité de sa vie et celle de sa famille.

loans.use: The purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Chhengkea

texts.en:
Mr. Chheng C., 45, and his wife, Mrs. Chan Sman, 44, who live along National Road Number One about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1983 and have nine children: five sons and four daughters. Four of their children study in the local school, while three others help their parents in the fishing and farming business.

Mr. C. and his wife have been fishing and farming since 1983. He does the fishing while Mrs. Sman sells his catch in the village. The couple also grows many types of vegetables for sale.  Currently they are in the process of building their new house (shown in the picture) but lack the money to finish it, so Mr. C. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase the materials needed to complete the construction.

loans.use: To complete the construction of a house for his family.

loans.name: Dorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Dorn Choen, 39, and her husband, Mr. Sam-at Vak, were married in 1990 and have one daughter who attends the local school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Dorn has been a silk weaver since 1987, a skill she learned from the villagers. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been building wooden houses since 2000. He does his work in their village and nearby village. The couple lacks the money to build their own house, so Mrs. Dorn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase materials to build her house.

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a house for her family.

loans.name: Rukia's Wache Waseme Group

texts.en:
Rukia H. is 30 years old and married with four children ages 17, 16, 10 and 8. She began selling food in 2006. Every day she works from 7a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $550.

Rukia now hopes for a loan to buy more food items like rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables, and bananas for her business. She will share this $1000 loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses selling clothing, food, and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mr. Leang L., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Dy Choen, 35, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1990 and have six sons. One of their sons is a wooden house worker. Three of their sons are in local school.

Leang is a truck driver. He carries goods and other materials from one province to another province. His wife has been selling grocery items for ten years. She buys them from a market in Phnom Penh for resale at her shop in the village. Recently Leang's truck broke and they lack the money to fix it so that he can continue his business. So, Leang is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to repair his truck.

loans.use: To repair his truck.

loans.name: Subira's Wache Waseme Group

texts.en:
Subira O. is 26 years old and married, with a 1-year-old child. She owns a small beauty salon and also sells clothing. Subira started doing business in 2004. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. in the salon.

Subira now hopes for a loan of $975 to buy more salon items and more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in tailoring, clothing sales, chicken, and food sales.

loans.use: To buy more salon items and more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en: Mr. Sophoin S. and his wife, Mrs. Nary Chem, who live in a Phnom Penh suburb, were married in 2000 and have one daughter who is in school. Sophoin has been an electrician for 18 years, a skill he learned from technical school. He currently works for a company in Phnom Penh, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for 13 years. Sophoin travels to work by motor taxi, which is somewhat expensive, so he is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting purposes.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Mr. Norn N., 42, and his wife, Mrs. Sophal Keo, 42, who live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1987 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. One of their children is a construction worker while the other three attend the local school.

Mr. Norn has been a farmer and mason for over 10 years, growing vegetables and doing construction work in the village. His wife has been a construction worker for over 10 years as well. The couple is repairing the family home but lacks the money to complete the project, so Mr. N. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase materials for that purpose.

loans.use: To finish repairing his house.

loans.name: Kossi Sotowou

texts.fr:
Mr Kossi Sotowou G. was born on March 4th, 1978 in Lomé. He is married and the father of one child. He is a miller and has maintained his own business since 2004. This business provides considerable revenue as cornmeal is a basic food in Togo and is consumed by most of the population. He is planning to give his old grinding machine to his younger brother and purchase a new one. For this plan to succeed Mr. Kossi Sotowou G. is requesting his first loan to purchase a grinding machine and will then locate himself in a new area to serve the local population.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur G. Kossi Sotowou est né le 4 mars 1978 à Lomé. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Il est meunier et travaille pour son propre compte depuis 2004. Cette activité lui procure beaucoup de revenu car la pâte du maïs qui est un aliment de base au Togo est consommée par la plupart de la population. Son projet est de céder son ancien moulin à son petit frère et d’acheter un nouveau. Pour pouvoir réaliser ce projet, monsieur G. Kossi Sotowou sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter un moulin afin de s’implanter dans une nouvelle zone et de pouvoir servir la population.

loans.use: Purchase of a Grinding Machine

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma A. is 35 years old and married with two children, ages 16 and 10.  She has been selling cosmetics, clothing, and coconuts since 2005. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales. Salma would like a loan of $275 to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics items and clothing for her business

loans.name: Semeni's Wache Waseme Group

texts.en:
Semeni M. is 35 years old and married. She has been selling food and snacks since 2007. She works every day from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Semeni would like a loan of $1050 to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses selling clothes, charcoal, shoes, snacks, and firewood.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Arafa's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Arafa K. is 40 years and married with two children, ages 14 and 12. She began selling clothes in 2005. Every day she works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business, and earns a monthly profit of about $90 from sales.

In the past, Arafa has received a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and bed sheets for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwanampate and Fatma, who also have businesses in clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to increase her inventory

loans.name: Kichama's Tusichukiane Group

texts.en:
Kichama is 32 years old, married, and has three children, ages 12, 10, and 5. She became a bites (bread and cake) and coconut seller in 2008. Every day, she works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Kichama now hopes for a loan to buy more bites products and coconuts for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in clothing sales, tailoring, bites sales, and charcoal and firewood sales.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Arafa's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Arafa is 40 years,She is a married woman with 2 children ages 14 and 12. She is a clothes seller since in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

In the past, Arafa has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business.Evelyne now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (bedsheet) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwanampate and Fatma, who also have businesses dealing with clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to increase her inventory

loans.name: Kichama's Tusichukiane Group

texts.en:
Kichama is 32 years,She is a married woman with 3 children ages 12, 10 and 5. She is a bites and coconuts seller since in 2008. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Kichama now hopes for a loan to buy more bites products and coconuts for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with clothes sales,tailoring, bites sales, charcoal and firewood sales.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is 26 years old and married with two children -- one 4 years old and the other 3 months old. She became a soup seller in 2005 and works every day from 12:00 to 5:00 p.m. at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Zawadi now hopes for a loan to buy more meat for her soup business.

loans.use: To buy meat for her soup business.

loans.name: Khadija's Mungu Tusaidie Group

texts.en:
Khadija is 26 years old and married. She has four children -- ages 4, 6, and 14 years old and an infant. She became a chicken seller in 1993 and works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Khadija now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens to sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Khadija and Nadhifa, who have businesses in clothing sales and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell in her business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 45 years old and married. She has three children between 21 and 25 years old. She became a fish seller in 2003 and works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Halima now hopes for a loan to buy more fish to sell for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell in her business.

loans.name: Zendia C 2017-4 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Martina L.. She sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Martina is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has two children, ages 13 and 20, who go to school. Each week, Martina makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. 

Martina is joined in her small group by Margret K., Nadia J., Jackline J., and Fasia J.. Margret K. sells clothes and wants to expand her shop. Nadia J. sells charcoal and bread and wants a loan to expand her business. Jackline J. sells groundnuts at the market and wants to expand her busines. Fasia J. sells HP printers and is requesting a loan to open an Internet café.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is 40 years old and married with five children -- ages 16, 12, 10, 9, and 6. She is a clothes seller and works every day at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Zakia now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (vitenge) for her business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 45 years,She is a married woman with 3 children ages ranging 25 and 21.She became a fish seller in 2003. Every day, she works from 6am to 2pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Halima now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Dragana

texts.en: Dragana is a married woman living in the village of Kotorsko, outside of Doboj.  Her husband works full-time, and Dragana does some small-scale farming.  She is requesting this first loan from Zene za Zene in the amount of 1500 KM.  With this money she will buy some more pigs and feed for these pigs.  She wants to fatten them, and then sell them for a profit once they are fully grown.  Dragana has some pigs now but wants to take this business up a notch.  With her husband working, she wants to have a real steady job of her own, and needs to invest in her business in order to get there.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Fatma's Subira Ni Njema Group

texts.en:
Fatma is 25 years old and divorced with one six-year-old child. She also takes care of another child who is three years old. She became a clothes seller in 2008 and works from 9:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. every day at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (khanga) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mariam, who also has a business selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell in her business.

loans.name: Sasha

texts.en:
Sasha is married with four children. He lives in Novomoskovsk and owns a small store next to the local central market and bus station. Sasha sells imported plastic windows at affordable prices. He has been in this business for 3 years. Currently, he is making about $1200 of income each month.

Sasha is hoping to develop his business which will allow him increase his sales. That is why he is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas. Sasha is very enterprising and strong-willed and has learned to tackle all sorts of problems. He knows how to rise above failure and go on bravely. Sasha is determined to get more profit which would not only help him support his family but keep his business moving forward as well.

loans.use: To purchase assorted plastic windows and accessories

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a 22-year-old married mother of 3 children. She lives in Nyalenda, Kisumu, Kenya. She used the funds from her own savings to start a small corner shop adjacent to her home, where she sells daily necessities, like bread, flour, cooking oil, soap, and fresh milk. She has since increased her daily income by 90% and managed to save a bit of her profits. She plans to move her business into a larger space and a more lucrative location with the US$500 loan she has applied for. She will use this money to pay rent for a larger shop, to increase her stock, and to obtain supplies that are in high demand within her community.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To pay rent and add stock and supplies

loans.name: Sasha

texts.en:
Sasha is single. He lives with his parents and supports them financially as their retirement pay is not enough to meet even the most basic needs. He runs a car workshop where he offers car repair services for potential customers in Novomoskovsk and neighboring areas. He has been in business for two years and gained some experience. He is well-known among other entrepreneurs as a businessman of integrity and commitment. His monthly net profit is about $800.

Sasha is a people person which is why it’s easy for him to build and maintain relationships with the circle of people all around him and his business. Moreover, Sasha is a persistent hard-worker. He is very committed to his venture and invests much energy and effort in it. Presently, Sasha is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to purchase assorted instruments for his little workshop. He believes additional financing will help his venture expand and blossom into a successful profitable business one day.

loans.use: To purchase assorted instruments

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is an entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk. He is a single gentleman that lives with his mother and willingly supports the expenses of his family. His primary goal has always been to give his family a better standard of living. Alexei is very hard-working and enterprising. He works in his car repair workshop day and night. He always says his work is something that gives him enthusiasm and inspiration. As a good manager, Alexei has succeeded in managing his loans in "Nadiya Ukraine" and repaid all of them without any delinquencies.

Alexei has been in business for 15 years. He is eager to access the above amount to buy good quality modern tools that he can use fixing vehicles in his shop. Alexei will benefit from more consistent financial support because it will strengthen his trade and provide an important profit margin to improve his business.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: To purchase modern tools

loans.name: Schola

texts.en:
Schola is a 21-year-old entrepreneur who lives in Kisumu, Kenya, with her husband and 1 child. She has also been trained as a community health worker to provide home-based care to people living with HIV/AIDS in her area. She runs a cereal-selling business that she initiated in 2006. Her hard work, determination, and excellent skills have led to her success. Her profits pay her household expenses. Schola plans to use the funds from her next loan of US$500 to buy 10 sacks of grains, particularly maize. As the price of this staple food is currently low, she hopes to sell at a higher price later.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To buy a large stock of cereals

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov M. is divorced with one child. She lives in Ordzhonikidze, Ukraine. Lubov sells clothing in the local market. She offers affordable merchandise at reasonable prices and invests much time developing her business. She has already been in this trade for 3 years. Lubov currently has about $5000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit amounts to $800.

Lubov is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to increase restock her inventory and increase her sales and profit. She is hoping to invest the generated profits in the further expansion of her venture and open one more vending facility. We believe her responsible approach to business and current financial assistance will be beneficial for Lubov's business by keeping it competitive and promoting growth so that it will continue to provide necessary income for her and the family.

Note: This is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory

loans.name: Damacus 2025-1 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hellen K.. She is currently in the business of selling tea at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to construct storage for sugar. Hellen is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 2 children, 11 and 20, and her children go to school. Each week, Hellen makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profit and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct storage for her sugar.

Hellen is joined in her small group by Susan S., Joice K., Colorina P., and Roda J.. Susan S. has a business selling groundnut paste at the market and wants to buy more groundnuts for re-sale. Joice K. is currently operating a business selling selling air time for Sudani and wants a loan to expand her business. Colorina P. operates a business selling fruits such as mangoes, avocados, and tomatoes and wants to expand the business. Roda J. is requesting a loan to build a shop.

loans.use: construct storage for sugar

loans.name: Rosa Hortensia

texts.es:
Hortensia is a member of the communal bank “Nobleza”.

She is partnered, is 46 years old, and has five children. Hortensia sells construction supplies such as sand, ground stone, and bricks among other things. She makes her own bricks and she counts on the assistance of laborers who cut them. She carries out her activities in the community of Compañía. She sells her products from her house, based on orders. In addition, Hortensia and her husband have a truck that they use for contractual work. They also have a car and provide transportation within the city of Ayacucho, for which they have a driver.

Hortensia needs a loan of 1,000 soles that she will invest into her brick-making business.

Hortensia’s dreams include seeing children become professionals with better prospects than she herself has, to finish building her house and to have a large store of groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Hortensia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.

Hortensia es conviviente, tiene 46 años y 5 hijos, Hortensia vende materiales de construcción como arena, piedra chancada, ladrillos entre otros, los ladrillos son fabricados por ella de manera artesanal para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de peones que labran los ladrillos, actividad que realiza en la comunidad de Compañía, la venta de sus productos los realiza a domicilio dependiendo de sus pedidos. Además Hortensia junto a su esposo tienen un volquete, que trabaja en obras por contratas. También Tiene un carro que realiza transporte publico en la ciudad de Ayacucho para lo cual cuenta con un chofer.

Hortensia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que sera invertido en el labrado y quemado de ladrillos.

Hortensia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales mejores a ella, terminar de construir su casa y tener una tienda grande de abarrotes.

loans.use: Hortensia needs a loan of 1,000 soles, funds that she will invest into her brick-making enterprise.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is a member of the communal bank “Nobleza”.

Julia is partnered, is 23 years old, and has an 8-month old son. Julia lives in the Santa Elena neighborhood at her parents’ home. Julia has a stand at the market in her neighborhood where, with the help of her sister-in-law, she sells groceries, cereals and a variety of candy. In addition, Julia sells natural products such as medicines and nutritional supplements by catalog and offers them for sale to friends and neighbors.

Julia needs a loan of 2,600 soles, funds that she will invest into the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, barley, wheat and garbanzo.

Julia’s dreams include having her own home, buying a car, expanding her grocery stand and providing a good education for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.

Julia es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo pequeño de 8 meses, Julia vive en el barrio de Santa Elena en la casa de sus padres, Julia tiene un puesto en el mercado de su barrio en donde vende abarrotes, cereales, golosinas variadas, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su cuñada. Además Julia vende productos naturales como medicinas, nutrientes que vende por catalogo que ofrece a sus amigos, vecinos.

Julia necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite, leche, cebada, trigo y garbanzo.

Los sueños des Julia son tener casa propia, comprar un carro , ampliar su kiosco y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.

loans.use: Julia needs a loan of 2,600 soles, funds that she will invest into the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, barley, wheat and garbanzo.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia is a member of the communal bank “Nobleza”.

Eulalia is partnered, is 32 years old, and has a 15-year old son. Eulalia lives in her parents’ house, which is located in the district of Carmen Alto. She sells potatoes from a stand at the market in her neighborhood. Eulalia travels to different towns to buy potatoes from producers, which she later sells at the market in Ayacucho at wholesale. The potatoes that she is not able to sell at wholesale, she sells at retail from her stand. In addition, Eulalia dedicates to farming potatoes on her lands in Tambocucho.

Eulalia needs a loan of 1,600 soles, funds that she will invest into the purchase of a variety of potatoes.

Eulalia’s dreams incluD. having her own home, running a well-stocked store, and that her children study at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Eulalia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.

Eulalia es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo D. 15 años, Eulalia vive en casa D. sus padres ubicado en el distrito D. Carmen Alto, venD. papa en un puesto del mercado D. su distrito. Eulalia viaja a los diferentes pueblos para comprar papa D. los productores, luego lo venD. en el mercado D. abastos D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho al por mayor y L. papa que no llega vender al por mayor lo venD. al por menor en su puesto. Además Eulalia se dedica a L. agricultura D. papa en sus terrenos D. Tambocucho.

Eulalia necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. papa variada.

Los sueños D. Eulalia son tener casa propia, una bodega surtida y que sus hijos estudien en L. universidad.

loans.use: Eulalia needs a loan of 1,600 soles, funds that she will invest into the purchase of a variety of potatoes.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
MarieL. is a member of the communal bank “Nobleza”.

MarieL. mentions that, through training, she learned how to invest her money and how to educate her children.

MarieL. is partnered, is 23-years old, and has one child. MarieL. lives with her parents. MarieL. sells meat from a stand in the Central market in the city of Ayacucho. She buys the animals at the markets in the region, where her husband travels to three times per week. They rent transportation and sell their meats in the municipality.

MarieL. needs a loan of 1,000 soles, funds that she will invest into the purchase of pigs and goats.

MarieL. dreams of buying land on which to build a house, of her son becoming a professional, and of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

MarieL. Es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza,

MarieL. menciona que a través D. las capacitaciones aprendió a como invertir su dinero y como educar a sus hijos.

MarieL. es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, MarieL. vive en L. casa D. sus padres. MarieL. venD. carne en un puesto del mercado Central D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, los animales los compra en las ferias D. L. región a donD. viaja su esposo 3 veces por semana, el transporte lo realiza en carros alquilados, los animales los beneficia en el camal municipal.

MarieL. necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. ganado porcino y caprino.

MarieL. sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casa, que su hijo sea profesional y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Mariela needs a loan of 1,000 soles, funds that she will invest into the purchase of pigs and goats.

loans.name: Yovana Zenaida

texts.es:
Yovana lives with her partner, is 22 years old and has 1 daughter. Yovana has a general store in her home, located on a main avenue in the San Juan Bautista district. She sells groceries, liquor, drinks, vegetables, fruits, meats, medicines, and has been doing so for 2 years. Yovana is planning to make the store bigger with the loan she will receive. Yovana and her husband also have a car, which her husband drives as a taxi in the city of Ayacucho.

Yovana needs a 2000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which will be invested in make the store larger and buying scaffolding, and a display case.

Yovana hopes to buy more cars, improve her business and home, and give her child the best.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.

Yovana es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hija, Yovana tiene una bodega en su casa ubicada en una avenida principal del distrito de San Juan Bautista, en donde vende abarrotes, licores, bebidas, verduras, frutas, carnes, medicamentos, actividad que realiza hace 2 años. Yovana tiene proyectado ampliar su tienda con el préstamo que recibirá. Además Yovana junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el cual su esposo realiza taxi en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Yovana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la ampliación de su tienda y en la compra de andamios, mostrador.

Los sueños de Yovana son comprar mas carros, mejorar su negocio, mejorar su vivienda y brindarle lo mejor a su hijo.

loans.use: Yovana needs a 2000 soles (Peruvian currency) which will be invested in making her store larrger and to purchase scaffolding and a display case.

loans.name: Progressive 2018-2 Group

texts.en:
This small group's leader is Rose K.. She currently sells flour and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory. Rose is 40 years old and is married to a business man. She has three children in school, ranging in age from twelve to twenty six years old. Each week Rose makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits. With her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more flour to sell.

Rose is joined in her small group by Agnes Y., Rose O., Flora P., and Bojo A.. Agnes Y. sells clothing and wants to increase her inventory. Rose O. sells wholesale bread and wants a loan to expand her business. Flora P. sells charcoal and wants to expand her business. Bojo A. sells local brew and is requesting a loan to construct a new bar.

loans.use: Buy more flour for sale and increase inventory in respective businesses.

loans.name: Rodolfa

texts.es:
Rodolfa lives with her husband and 2 children ages 7 and 4. Sewing has always been a source of income for Rodolfa to support her family, besides, it has been her favorite activity since she was a young girl.

She makes pants, sweaters, hats and gloves to sell them in the Sunday market. She makes them at home, which allows her to work all day. She has been doing this for eight years. Sewing has always been easy and fun for her, the problem is getting material of good quality and at good prices to make the clothing.

Rodolfa works hard for a better future for her family. With the loan Rodolfa will buy material and if possible a sewing machine to produce much more, in the future with the profits earned, she would like to own a general store and have it located in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Rodolfa vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 7 y 4 años. El tejer siempre ha significado para Rodolfa una fuente de ingresos económicos para mantener a su familia, además de su actividad favorita desde que era niña.

Ella elabora pantaloncitos, chompas, chullos, gorritos y guantes para venderlos en la feria dominical, elaborándolas en su casa, lo que le permite trabajar todo el día, desde hace ya ocho años atrás. Tejer siempre se le ha hecho fácil y agradable, lo problemático es poder conseguir material de buen precio y calidad para elaborar sus prendas.

Rodolfa trabaja incansablemente por un mejor futuro para su familia. Con el préstamo Rodolfa piensa comprar material y si es posible una máquina de tejer para producir mucho más, en un futuro con el dinero ganado le gustaría poner una tienda de abarrotes en su propia casa.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine and material to make beautiful clothing.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela lives with her husband and three children, Brandom, Yohan and Jorge Luis. Time has taught her that working is not easy. She buys and sells merchandise that varies with the season, during national day season she sells flags, pins; during Christmas season decoration, lights and others. Now she is selling hardware, locks, knifes, nail clippers, merchandise that she brings from the City of Desaguadero to sell in the City of Cuzco, where she goes twice a week.

Graciela is used to working, she likes it a lot, there are always difficult things to deal with such as keeping the merchandise in good condition, because sometimes because of the trip she loses some of it. Graciela works hard to support herself, pay the bills, but above all, to give her family a good future. With the loan requested Graciela will buy more merchandise to bring to Cuzco, she wants to work hard to buy a small house where she can also have her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Graciela vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos Brandom, Yohan y Jorge Luis. Los años le han enseñado que el trabajo no es fácil, ella tiene un negocio ambulante de compra y venta de mercadería que varia de acuerdo a la época, en fiestas patrias vende banderitas, escarapelas; en navidad, adornos navideños, lucecitas, entre otros. Actualmente está dedicada a la venta de artículos de ferretería, candados, cuchillos, corta uñas, mercadería que trae desde la ciudad de Desaguadero para vender en la ciudad del Cuzco, a la cual viaja dos veces a la semana.

Graciela esta acostumbrada al trabajo, el cual le gusta mucho, habiendo siempre cosas difíciles, como el de mantener su mercadería en buen estado, ya que con el viaje a veces se llega a perder parte de ella. Graciela trabaja duro para poder sostenerse, pagar las cuentas de la casa, pero sobre todo para brindarle a su familia un mejor porvenir. Con el préstamo solicitado Graciela comprara más mercadería para llevar a la ciudad del Cuzco, ella quiere trabajar duro para comprarse una casita donde pueda poner un pequeño negocio.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal merchandise for her business

loans.name: María Santosa

texts.es:
Maria lives with her 10 children, her husband left her when she was younger and she had to figure it out on her own for all of them. Since she has been alone, Maria has been working on different activities to support her 10 children, the situation was not easy back then, but now thanks to the hard work, she acquired a truck, which she uses to provide freight services. Making a good use of her time, she also sells second hand clothing on Sundays and Mondays, the rest of the week she works with her truck.

Maria has always liked working, the only difficulty that she finds in selling second hand clothing is transporting the merchandise and set it up properly. Maria has always worked for the wellbeing of the children, although they are older now, she wants to give as much as she can to them. With the money from the loan, she will buy more clothing to generate more income and in the near future be able to purchase another truck to expand her freight business.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

María vive con sus 10 hijos, su esposo la abandonó cuando era más joven y tuvo que encargarse sola de todos ellos. Desde que se quedó sola María ha venido trabajando duramente en diferentes actividades para sostener a sus 10 hijos, la situación no era fácil en ese entonces, pero hoy gracias a su arduo esfuerzo, pudo adquirir un camión, el cual lo emplea en brindar servicio de carga, aprovechando el tiempo, también se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano los domingos y lunes, el resto de días trabaja en su camión.

A ella siempre le ha gustado trabajar, la única dificultad que encuentra en la venta de ropa de segunda mano, es tener que trasladar la mercadería y acomodarla debidamente. María siempre ha trabajado por el bienestar de sus hijos, aunque ahora están más grandes ella desea brindarles lo mejor hasta que las fuerzas se lo permitan. Con el dinero que se le facilite, comprará más ropa de segunda mano para generar más ganancias y en un futuro cercano poder comprarse otro camioncito para poder expandir su empresa de servicio de carga.

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell, and use the profit to purchase a truck for freight services

loans.name: Laura Elba

texts.es:
Elba is 34, lives with her parents who she loves very much and helps with expenses of their home. For 2 years she has been selling pottery vases at the Friday’s market of Moquagua, in addition, she sells food outside of her house to generate more income and help her family. She has always been very enthusiastic and friendly, this is why it’s easy for her to talk to people and she enjoys it very much. Just like any job, it has a difficult side, which is transporting the vases to the City of Moquagua because there is the risk that they can break during transportation. She wants a better situation for her and her family. In the future, Elba wants to establish her own store, she would like to have a general store and she plans to work really hard with the money from the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Elba tiene 34 años, vive con sus padres a los cuales ama mucho y ayuda en la economía del hogar. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a vender jarrones de cerámica los viernes, en el mercado de la ciudad de Moquegua, además, también se dedica al negocio de venta de anticuchos fuera de su casa, para generar más ganancias y poder ayudar a la economía de su familia. Siempre ha sido una mujer muy animosa, habladora, así que relacionarse con la gente se le hace muy fácil y lo disfruta mucho, pero como en todo trabajo también existe la parte difícil, en el caso de Elba es trasladar los jarrones de cerámica hasta la ciudad de Moquegua ya que con el trajín del viaje se suelen romper gran parte de ellos. Ella quiere forjarse un mejor futuro y ayudar a sus padres a mejorar su situación económica. En el futuro, Elba quiere montar su propio negocio, le gustaría poner una tienda de abarrotes, es así que piensa trabajar muy duro con el dinero del préstamo.

loans.use: Working capital for pottery business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is 50 years old. She married 18 years ago, but after many years separated from her husband. Since then she supported her children, but now she lives alone as her three sons are living independently.

Ana has always been dedicated to her work, but since she separated from her husband she had to work even harder in order to support her children. First, she started a business selling food. She rented a small place and set up a restaurant. As time passed and she was not able to meet the demands of the restaurant, Ana decided to change her business to something a little quieter, and set up a small grocery store which she named 'Anita'. She works almost all day long, opening at 8 in the morning and often closing at 2 in the morning. Ana likes to treat her clients well, and considers them her friends. The difficulty is that she is very tired at the end of the day and if she wants her business to run well she has to open seven days a week.

She has educated her children and they are independent, now Ana wants to make sure she is provided for in her old age.

With the money from this loan Ana will open a branch of her little shop 'Anita' which she hopes will generate more profits. She feels that with a lot of effort she will achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Ana tiene 50 años, se casó a los 18 años, pero luego de muchos años, se separó de su esposo, desde entonces tuvo que mantener a sus hijos, pero actualmente vive sola ya que sus tres hijos se independizaron.

Ana siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar, pero desde que se separó de su esposo tuvo que dedicarse mucho más, para poner mantener a sus tres hijos, primero incursionó en el negocio de la venta de comida, alquiló un pequeño local y puso un pequeño restaurante, al pasar el tiempo y no abasteciéndose para atender el restaurante Ana se decidió a cambiar de negocio por algo más tranquilo y poner una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, a la cual le puso de nombre “Anita”, le dedica casi todo el día, abriendo desde las 8 de la mañana y muchas veces cerrando a las 2 de la mañana, debido a la concurrencia de su negocio por los vecinos, a Ana le gusta tratar bien a sus clientes, a quienes considera sus amigos, lo difícil, es que termina muy cansada y si quiere que su negocio produzca debe atender de lunes a domingo. Al encontrarse sola, habiendo educado a sus hijos, siendo ellos ahora independientes quiere asegurar su vejez.

Con el dinero del préstamo Ana pondrá una sucursal de su tiendita “Anita” la cual espera genera mayores ganancias, se siente con muchas ganas y mucha fuerza para cumplir sus metas.

loans.use: To open another branch of her grocery store.

loans.name: Dina 2010-3 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Nehina N.. She is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to buy oil for sale. Nehina is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 2 children, 12 and 26, and her children go to school. Each week, Nehina makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profit and with the extra money from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy oil for sale.

Nehina is joined in her small group by Marbaba J., Mary M., Leila H., and Unex G.. Marbaba J. has a business selling clothes and wants to stock more clothes. Mary M. is currently operating a business selling cold water from the fridge and wants a loan to expand her business. Leila H. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to expand the business. Unex G. is currently in the business of selling fried chicken and is requesting a loan to construct a cafe.

loans.use: buy oil for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth is single, 32 years old, and lives with her mother in the city of Juliaca. She works in the business of buying and selling secondhand American clothes and belts. She travels frequently to buy and sell her merchandise in the cities of Puno on Saturdays, in Juliaca on Sundays, and sporadically in Ayaviri. All the cities she visits are more than two hours from her own city. She likes her business as it allows her to survive and to help her mother, but transporting her merchandise is very complicated. With her loan Ruth will buy merchandise and in this way can save in order to buy a small car to transport her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Ruth es soltera, tiene 32 años vive con su madre, en la ciudad de Juliaca. Se dedica al negocio de la compra y venta de ropa y correas americanas de segunda mano, viaja con mucha frecuencia comprando y vendiendo su mercadería en las ciudades de Puno los sábados, en Juliaca los domingos y de manera esporádica a Ayaviri, todas estas ciudades se encuentran a más de dos horas de su ciudad. Le gusta el negocio de la venta ya que le permite subsistir y ayudar a su mamá, pero el transportar la mercadería se le hace muy complicado. Con el dinero del préstamo Ruth comprará mercadería, y así poder ahorrar y comprar un carrI. para transportar su mercadería.

loans.use: To increase the merchandise for her business in order to,  with the profits, buy a car to transport the clothes she sells.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena is 29 years old and lives with her three month old baby and her husband, who works in filming. Magdalena is a native of the Azangaro province, but really settled in the Mina “La Rinconada”, where she has a business selling CDs and videos in a place rented with her husband Edgar, who is not at home a lot as he also has his filming business, which means that he travels a great deal. Magdalena started her business a year ago, struggling in the evenings with the harsh, cold weather of this part of the country. Doing this allowed her to do both her duties; as a businesswoman and as a mother. Her reason for her efforts was to succeed in building her business, so that her husband will not have to travel as much and to guarantee a good future for their little Dilmar. The loan she is looking for is to add to her merchandise and expand her business. Magdalena is a great businesswoman, generating more income for the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Magdalena tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo quien trabaja en filmaciones y con su bebe de tres meses de nacido. Magdalena es natural de la provincia de Azangaro, pero radica actualmente en la Mina “La Rinconada”, donde tiene un negocio de venta de discos de música y video en un local alquilado con su Esposo Edgar, quien no está mucho en casa ya que se dedica también al negocio de las filmaciones, lo cual hace que esté en constantes viajes. Magdalena realiza este trabajo desde hace un año atrás, luchando por las tardes con el inclemente frió de esta zona del país; haciendo que esto le permita cumplir actualmente con sus dos labores; su función de negociante y su función de madre. En motivo de su esfuerzo es conseguir que su negocio crezca, para que su esposo Edgar no tenga que viajar tanto y asegurar el futuro del pequeño Dilmar. El dinero del préstamo solicitado es para aumentar su mercadería y expandir su negocio, Magdalena se ve como una gran empresaria generando más ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: To add to the merchandise of her business(CDs and videos)

loans.name: Yaneth Roxana

texts.es:
Yaneth is 23 years old, and makes sweaters, little caps and everything else her hands can create, an activity thet helps her to support herself, as she lives alone. Yaneth has been passionate about knitting since she was 19, beginning at first with crochet, she now creates garments with a knitting machine, an activity that she does from home with much happiness and pleasure. She produces about four sweaters a day, which she makes with much creativity, inventing new shapes, models and colours. She doesn't find her work difficult as she has a passion for working with textiles. The only problem is that sometimes she has not budgetted for the cost of materials. Yaneth only thinks of her future and works very hard to create a better future for herself. With her loan she will buy material to produce many more garments of better quality and original designs, and to grow her business little by little until she can open her own textile workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Yaneth, con sus 23 años, se dedica al tejido de chompas, gorritos, chullos y todo lo que sus manos puedan crear, actividad que la ayuda a mantenerse, ya que vive sola. A Yaneth le ha apasionado el tejer desde los 19 años, comenzando en ese entonces con tejidos a crochet, hoy se dedica a la creación de prendas tejidas a máquina, actividad que realiza dentro de su casa con gran alegría y placer.Al día, produce un aproximado de cuatro chompas, las cuales elabora siguiendo su gran creatividad, inventando nuevas formas, modelos y colores, su trabajo no se le hace difícil ya que a ella le apasiona el tejido, la única deficiencia es que algunas veces no cuenta con presupuesto para poder adquirir material y realizar sus nuevas creaciones. Yaneth al encontrarse sola piensa en su futuro y trabaja arduamente para forjarse un mejor porvenir. Con el dinero que obtenga, adquirirá material para producir mucho más, con mejor calidad, modelos más novedosos e ir creciendo poco a poco hasta poder montar su propio taller de tejidos.

loans.use: To buy materials of high quality for the Compra de materia prima para la production of her fabrics

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is 29 years old and lives with her husband Enrique, who works as a motorcycle taxi driver, and her little one year old daughter. The textile business always has been a very important part of her life, as her family depends on this activity to support themselves. She has knitted garments on her machine for 5 years, during which time she has lived in the city of Juliaca. Beatriz enjoys her work and for her the best part is that she can do her work from home and be with her young daughter Heidi. The problems never end, and the demand for Beatriz's items are great. Sometimes she cannot produce enough of her products, as she has only one machine. Beatriz works tirelessly to give her family better financial stability. With the loan she is asking for, she would acquire much more material in order to increase her production and to improve her finances, as well as to get a workshop to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Beatriz tiene 29 años vive con su esposo Enrique, quien se desempeña como moto taxista y su pequeña hija de 1 año de edad. El negocio textil siempre ha significado para Beatriz una parte muy importante en su vida, ya que de esta actividad depende que su familia pueda sostenerse, ella teje prendas de vestir en su máquina tejedora desde hace 5 años, tiempo desde el cual reside en la ciudad de Juliaca. A Beatriz le gusta lo que hace y lo mejor es que puede hacerlo desde su casa y estar con su pequeña hija Heidi. Los problemas nunca faltan y en el negocio de Beatriz la demanda es grande y a veces no se abastece para producir en grandes cantidades, ya que cuenta con una sola máquina. Beatriz trabaja incansablemente para brindarle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica. Con el dinero que solicita en préstamo, adquirirá mucho más material para incrementar la producción y mejorar su economía además de hacer crecer su negocio poniendo un taller.

loans.use: To acquire material in order to increase her production of garments

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar is 36 years old, lives with his wife Alejandrina and their two sons Fran and Rodrigo, who are five and 3 years old. He travels to different provinces of the city of Juliaca, in his work as the driver of a interprovincial delivery vehicle. Due to his job, he is not able to be with his family full time, as most of the time he only arrives at lunchtime or, in the worst cases, at night. Despite this, Edgar likes his job, as he always visits new places. He has been working for the delivery service for six months, and in this time has worked very hard, for the well-being of his family and to buy his children what they need. Edgar wants to give his wife and two small children a better future that is filled with possiblities. With the money from the loan he will have enough to buy a small truck and set up his own business, as well as buying merchandise for his wife's business and in these ways increase their income.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Edgar tiene 36 años, vive con su esposa Alejandrina y sus dos hijos varones Fran de 5 y Rodrigo de 3. Realiza constantes viajes a diferentes provincias de la ciudad de Juliaca, por su trabajo de conductor de un vehículo de carga interprovincial, actividad que no le permite disfrutar a su familia a tiempo completo, ya que la mayoría de las veces sólo llega para la hora del almuerzo o en el peor de los casos en la noche, a pesar de eso, a Edgar le gusta su trabajo, ya que siempre conoce nuevos lugares, ha venido trabajando en el servicio de carga interprovincial desde hace seis meses, tiempo en el cual se ha esforzado mucho, por el bienestar de su esposa la cual es negociante y sus hijos a los cuales quiere demasiado. Edgar quiere darle a su esposa Alejandrina y a sus dos pequeños un mejor futuro lleno de posibilidades. Con el dinero del préstamo incrementará el monto para comprarse un camioncito y poner su propio negocio, además le comprará a su esposa Alejandrina mercadería y así poder mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.use: To buy a small truck in the furute and to buy merchandise for his wife's business.

loans.name: Nivia

texts.es:
Nivia lives with her three male sons: Julio, Joaquin and Jorge whom she adores. For eight years she has dedicated herself to selling knitting machines and supplies which she sells from a stall in the city on Sundays and Mondays and from her home during the rest of the week. She has always liked being in business and like a good worker she likes what she does even though as a woman it is sometimes difficult to transport the machines to her small stall. The work is hard as she works all day so that she misses her children. She does not want her children to work but rather to go to school so that they can become honorable professionals so that they can care for her in her old age. She will invest the money she receives from this loan in purchasing merchandise to expand her business so that in the future she can import and export knitting machines.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Nivia vive con sus tres hijos varones Julio, Joaquín y Jorge los cuales son su adoración. Se ha dedicado durante ocho años a vender máquinas y repuestos de tejer los domingos y lunes en su puesto en una calle de su ciudad, los demás días desde su casa, siempre le ha gustado el comercio y como buena trabajadora le gusta lo que hace, aunque en su posición de mujer a veces le resulta difícil transportar sus máquinas hasta su pequeño puesto.El trabajo es duro ya que lo hace durante todo el día, lo cual la hace extrañar a sus hijos a los cuales no quiere verlos trabajar, si no estudiar, para ser profesionales íntegros y que velen por ella en su vejez. El dinero que se le facilite lo invertirá en comprar mercadería para expandir su negocio y en un futuro poder importar y exportar máquinas de tejer.

loans.use: Increase in the machines that she sells so that in the future she can export.

loans.name: Aparicia

texts.es:
Aparicia is 49 years old and currently lives in the city of Huancayo with her husband and her two small children. She is originally from Huancavelica and came from a farming family. This is where her dedication to livestock farming stems from. Her work consists of purchasing and reselling the livestock she acquires with her husband and every weekend she moves her working capital. What is usually the most difficult part her work is acquiring cheap animals so that she can obtain a profit and increase her profits. She is asking for this loan to purchase more livestock. Her hope is to have more animals so that she can have greater options in selling them.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Aparicia tiene 49 años y vive actualmente junto a su esposo y dos menores hijos. Es natural D. Huancavelica y nació en una familia netamente agricultora, D. ahí su dedicación a la ganadería al venir a radicar en la ciudad D. Huancayo, su trabajo consiste en comprar y revender los animales que adquiere junto a su esposo y cada fin D. semana mueve su capital D. trabajo, a veces lo difícil es conseguir animales más baratos para conseguir las ganancias esperadas para así poder mejorar sus ganancias. Solicita este préstamo para la compra D. más ganado, su deseo a futuro es tener más animales para poder tener mayores opciones D. venta.

loans.use: Increase in the quantity of her livestock.

loans.name: Irma Karina

texts.en:
Karina is not a typical Kiva client, but like almost all Kiva clients, she faces many challenges and is fighting to develop a business and improve her life. Karina is a prisoner at the Santa Teresa Preventative Center for Rehabilitation in Guatemala City. She says that she has committed errors in her life but is now working to change and improve her life and her future. The Guatemalan government provides food and the most basic necessities for prisoners, but the food amount is small and of very bad quality. Therefore, prisoners usually need a little of their own money to supplement what they receive from the prison. As a result, many prisoners in the Santa Teresa women’s prison have businesses within the jail, as is common in much of the developing world.

Karina is very entrepreneurial and already has two businesses. She works making arts and crafts to sell within the prison and is trying to set up a way to sell them outside as well. Additionally she sells juices within the jail. In the past she had access to another prisoner’s freezer to cool the juice, but that prisoner left and took the freezer with her. Obviously Karina can sell much more juice if it is cold, so she is requesting this loan to purchase a refrigerator. She has already researched her options for refrigerators and has found a high quality used refrigerator and has also already gotten permission from the prison administration to bring it into the jail. The refrigerator will cost 3,000 Guatemala Quetzals (approximately USD $400) and she will use the rest of her loan to buy more juice to sell. She tries to maintain a stock of high quality juice and a good variety, such as pineapple, peach, and pear juice in addition to orange juice, apple juice, and Gatorade. Karina also works to find the best prices for the juices and can currently buy many of the juices for 1.90 Quetzals each and sell them for 4 Quetzals each, a good return.

Karina has many dreams of how to improve her life and what she can do when she is able to leave jail. She has already studied to be a secretary, but she wants to continue studying to specialize in computers and would also like to study English. She wants to start a business selling clothes and has already though a lot about various strategies that she could implement to develop and improve this business. She would also like to have a kiosk to sell the arts and crafts that she already makes.

FAPE has just gotten permission from the Guatemalan government to loan money to prisoners in Santa Teresa and is also working with the government to provide training for starting a business. They also are hoping to offer more training to improve businesses in the future. Although these clients are not typical microfinance clients, like all FAPE clients, they can only receive loans if they have a business or have the desire to start a business and a good plan to do it.

Karina is extremely appreciative to have the opportunity to receive a loan to invest in her business. When she leaves prison, she is going to face many challenges trying to reestablish her life. She says that she is trying to start to save and plan now to be able to be successful when she is able to leave. FAPE’s training and her business that she is going to expand with the help of this loan are going to help her a lot to have more knowledge, experience, and maybe even a little money to help her get her new life started. Furthermore, she will be able to take the refrigerator with her when she leaves jail. Karina is very committed to reintegrating into society and never returning to prison. Additionally, she says that she is very grateful to FAPE and to Kiva for giving her opportunities to rise above her mistakes and that these opportunities are like a light and a great blessing.

To learn a little more about Santa Teresa and FAPE’s program there, you can go to this blog to read some observations from a Kiva Fellow: A Day in Prison

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Karina no es una clienta Kiva típica, pero como casi todos los clientes Kiva tiene varios desafíos y está luchando de desarrollar un negocio y mejorar su vida. Karina es una presa en el Centro Preventivo de Rehabilitación Santa Teresa en la ciudad capital de Guatemala. Ella dice que ha cometido errores en su vida, pero ahora está trabajando para cambiar y mejorar su vida y su futura. El gobierno Guatemalteco provee comida y la necesidades más básicos para los presos, pero la comida es poco y de muy mala calidad. Entonces, las presas suelen necesitar un poco de su propio dinero para complementar lo que reciben de la cárcel. Por lo tanto, muchas de las presas en la cárcel de mujeres en Santa Teresa tienen negocios dentro de la cárcel, como es común en mucho del mundo en desarrollo.

Karina es muy emprendedora y ya tiene dos negocios. Trabaja en hacer manualidades que vende dentro de la cárcel y esta tratando de arreglar una manera de venderlas afuera también. Además, tiene una venta de jugos dentro de la cárcel. En el pasado, tenía acceso a un congelador de otra presa para enfriarlos, pero ella se fue y llevó su congelador con ella. Obviamente Karina puede vender mucho más jugo si está frio, entonces está pidiendo este préstamo para comprar un refrigerador. Ella ya ha investigado sus opciones para refrigeradores y ha encontrado un refrigerador usado pero de buena calidad y ya ha conseguido el permiso de la administración de la cárcel para traerlo en la cárcel. El refrigerador costará 3.000 Quetzales Guatemaltecos (aproximadamente USD $400) y utilizará el resto de su préstamo para comprar más jugos para vender. Ella trata de mantener una reserva de jugos de buena calidad y variedad, como de piña, melocotón, y pera, además de jugos de naranja, manzana y Gatorades. Karina también trabaja para encontrar los mejores precios para los jugos, y ahora puede comprar muchos de los jugos por 1.90 Quetzales y los puede vender por 4 Quetzales, un rendimiento bueno.

Karina tiene muchos sueños de cómo puede mejorar su vida y que puede hace cuando puede salir de la cárcel. Ella ya es secretaria, pero quiere estudiar la computación para especializar y también le gustaría estudiar el inglés. Quiere iniciar un negocio de venta de ropa y ya ha pensado mucho en varias estrategias que se puede implementar para desarrollar y mejorar este negocio. También quiere tener un quiosco para vender las manualidades como las que ya produce.

FAPE acaba de conseguir el permiso del gobierno Guatemalteco para poder prestar dinero a las presas de Santa Teresa y también está trabajando con el gobierno para ofrecer capacitaciones de cómo iniciar un negocio, y tiene ganas de ofrecer más capacitaciones de cómo mejorar un negocio en el futuro. Aunque estos clientes no son clientes de microfinanzas típicos, a la misma vez solamente se puede recibir préstamos si tiene un negocio o tiene ganas de empezar un negocio y un buen plan para hacerlo.

Karina está extremadamente agradecida de tener la oportunidad de recibir crédito para invertir en su negocio. Cuando sale de la cárcel, va a tener muchas desafíos en tratando de restablecer su vida. Dice que está tratando de empezar a ahorrar y planear ahora para poder tener éxito cuando puede salir. Las capacitaciones de FAPE y su negocio que va a aumentar con la ayuda de este préstamo van a ayudarle muchísimo en tener más conocimiento, experiencia, y quizás un poco de dinero para ayudarle en empezando su vida nueva. Además, podrá sido llevar el refrigerador con ella cuando sale de la cárcel. Karina dice que es muy cometida de reintegrar en la sociedad y nunca regresar a la cárcel. Además, dice que le agradece a FAPE y a Kiva por darle oportunidades de superarse de sus errores y sirven como una luz y una gran bendición.

Para aprender up poco más de Santa Teresa y el programa de FAPE allá, se puede ir a este blog para leer algunas observaciones de una Kiva Fellow: Un Día en la Cárcel

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and juice to sell

loans.name: Mbène

texts.fr:
Mbène S. is a married woman raising 4 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Santhiaba Mosquée for 6 and a half years. Her business consists in buying and re-selling beads, costume jewelry, and small “pagnes” (lengths of African print cloth). She wants to bolster her business to improve the living conditions and health of her family. The loan she is requesting will be reimbursed in one single payment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mbène S. est une femme mariée avec 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Santhiaba Mosquée depuis 6 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des perles, des bijoux et de petits pagnes. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
Buying and re-selling beads, costume jewelry, and small "pagnes"

Acheter et revendre des perles, bijoux et petits pagnes

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Fatoumata H., 58, is a widow with 6 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Santhiaba Mosquée for 5 years. Fatoumata wants a loan for the sale of palm oil, honey, and myrrh oil. It’s a business that she has been engaged in for several years without major difficulties. It allows her to accomplish some goals and to participate in the support of her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Fatoumata H., 58 ans est veuve avec 06 enfants. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Santhiaba Mosquée depuis 5 ans. Fatoumata veut un prêt pour la vente de l’huile de palme, du miel et de l’huile de myrrhe. C’est une activité qu’elle mène depuis plusieurs années sans difficultés majeures et qui lui permet de faire des réalisations et de participer à l’entretient de sa famille. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
purchase and sale of honey, palm oil, and myrrh oil

Achat et revente de miel, huile de palme et huile de myrrhe

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel lives in his grandparent's house, in the area of Alto Sopocachi in the city of La Paz and helps his mother by working since he doesn't have a father and have younger siblings. He lives in a room that he shares with his siblings.

The loan will be used for the purchase of clothing garments (sweater, pants, shoes, etc.) and to be able to sell on credit in various places in the cities of La Paz and El Alto. This loan is very important for Angel, and will be of great help since it will increase his income, thus improving the quality of life for him and his siblings.

This is the first time that he has requested a loan and needs Kiva's help in order to make his dream of having his own business a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Angel vive en la casa de sus abuelos, en la zona de alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz y ayuda a su mama a trabajar ya que no tiene papa y si hermanos menores. Vive en un cuarto el cual lo comparte con sus hermanos El crédito será destinado para la compra de prendas de vestir (chompas, pantalones, zapatos, etc.) y poder vender al crédito en distintos lugares de las ciudades de La Paz y El Alto. Este crédito es muy importante para Angel pues será de gran ayuda ya que aumentara su nivel de ingresos mejorando su calidad de vida y el de sus hermanos. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito, y requiere la ayuda de Kiva para hacer realidad su sueño de tener su propio negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, sweaters, pants, shoes, etc, for his businesss

loans.name: Mame Yacine

texts.fr:
Mame Yacine S. is married with 6 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Santhiaba Mosquée for 5 years. Her business consists in buying and re-selling cloth, perfume, incense, and home-made soap. She wants to continue her business in order to improve the living conditions and health of her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Mame Yacine S. est mariée avec 06 enfants. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Santhiaba Mosquée depuis 5ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des tissus, des parfums, de l’encens et du savon artisanal. Elle veut poursuivre son commerce pour améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
Purchase and re-sale of cloth, perfume, incense, and soap

Achat et revente de tissus, parfums, encens et savon.

loans.name: Aissatou Illo

texts.fr:
Aissatou Illo N., 31, married and raising 4 children, has been a member of the Santhiaba Mosquée village bank for 7 years. Her business consists in buying and re-selling spare parts (motors, axles, chassis, etc.) It is a business that she has been active in for several years with the help of her husband who is also in this line of work. She wants to bolster her business to improve the living conditions and health of her family. Aissatou is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed in one single payment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Aissatou Illo N., 31 ans, mariée, 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Santhiaba Mosquée depuis 7 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des pièces détachées ( moteurs, ponts, sassy, croix et autres). C’est une activité qu’elle mène depuis plusieurs années avec l’aide de son mari qui évolue dans le même secteur. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Aissatou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
Spare parts sales

Commerce de pièces détachées

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam works as an employee in a store where she sells seasonal clothing. She is a student at the Universidad Pública de El Alto and lives with her parents, whom are senior citizens. Her salary, which is not much, contributes to the maintaining the family, whose house is located in the neighborhood of Villa Cooperativa Rio Seco in the city of El Alto.

The loan will serve to buy a computer, a tool that will help her with her work at the university.

This is her first loan with Kiva and the assessment favorably qualifies her to have her request fulfilled.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Miriam trabaja como empleada en un tienda donde se comercializa ropa por temporadas, es estudiante en la Universidad Pública de El Alto y vive con sus padres que son de la tercera edad. Su sueldo (que no es mucho) contribuye a la manutención de la familia, su vivienda esta ubicada en la Zona Villa Cooperativa Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito servirá para comprar una computadora, herramienta que le ayudará en la realización de sus trabajos en la universidad. Es su primer crédito con Kiva, la evaluación la califica favorablemente para aprobar su solicitud de préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer (for education)

loans.name: Gerbacio

texts.es:
Gerbacio is bricklayer and works in the city of El Alto; obtaining small contracts for construction and spare parts of small, typical houses is his specialty. This source of income allows him to support his 5 children, who are 12, 10, 8, 6 and 4 years of age. Gerbacio has been widowed for some time. He and his family have been living in the Villa Ingenio area of the city of El Alto.

The loan proceeds will be invested in construction materials. Gerbacio also needs to finish his own home, but with loan proceeds the well-being of his children will improve.

This is the second time Gerbacio is receiving the aid of Kiva. His conscientious re-payments allow him to be considered for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Gerbacio es albañil y trabaja en la ciudad de El Alto consiguiendo pequeños contratos (construcción y refacción de pequeñas viviendas familiares) en su especialidad. Dicha fuente de ingreso sirve para cubrir la manutención de sus 5 hijos de 12, 10, 8, 6 y 4 años de edad. Gervasio enviudó hace bastante tiempo, él y su familia viven en la Zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito será invertido en material de construcción, a eso añadimos que le falta concluir su vivienda pero con cada crédito el bienestar de sus hijos mejorará.

Es la segunda vez que recibe ayuda de Kiva, su buen comportamiento de pago le permite acceder a un nuevo préstamo.

loans.use:
Purchase of Spare Parts for Home Construction
REFACCIÓN DE VIVIENDA

loans.name: Olga Justina

texts.es:
Olga, at her 63 years of age, continues with her same vitality and even though she lives on her own she never gets depressed. She is a woman that dedicates herself to growing coffee, something she has done since she was a young girl. Her labor starts at the early hours of the day because her orchards are located far away and getting there takes a large part of the day. Even so, she likes growing coffee because it reminds of her of pleasant moments and most of all she likes her daily contact with nature. Some of the difficulties of the work come during the harvest and she has to have people to help her package her product and transport it to the city of Nazca where her children help her sell it. Her biggest motivation is her land; she wants to keep producing and does not want to abandon it. Olga wants to invest in the production of new coffee plantations and expand her land so that she can take more product to the city of Nazca and be recognized in the coffee market.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Olga a sus 63 años sigue con las misma vitalidad, y aunque vive sola nunca se deprime. Es una mujer dedicada al cultivo D. café, actividad que realiza desD. niña. Su labor es desD. muy tempranas horas, puesto que los terrenos D. cultivo que posee se encuentran el lugares muy alejados, a donD. tiene que trasladarse, lo cual le toma gran parte del día.Sin embargo, esta actividad le agrada, puesto que le recuerda momentos muy agradables, y sobre todo que el contacto con la naturaleza la reconforta día a día, algunas dificultades son cuando es el tiempo D. cosecha y tiene que contratar personas que la puedan ayudar, para luego empaquetar sus productos y llevarlos a la ciudad D. Nazca donD. sus hijos le ayudan a vender. Su mayor motivación, son sus tierras, desea seguir produciendo y no abandonarlas. Olga desea poder invertir en la producción D. nuevas plantaciones D. café, ampliar sus terrenos y así llevar mayor cantidad D. productos a la ciudad D. Nazca y ser reconocida en el mercado D. venta D. café.

loans.use: Expansion of her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Carmela Elena

texts.es:
Carmela is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She produces and sells fruits - an activity which she has done for ten years as her parents were farmers. Her parents showed her the occupational hazards and most importantly how to take care of the land. To do this, she works most of the day fertilizing and caring for her crops in order to improve the quality of her products. What she likes about her work is the harvest because harvesting the fruits of her efforts is very gratifying despite the hard work, the hours laboring in the sun and the long walk to the fields. Her motive for succeeding is the wellbeing of he family. Carmela wants to expand her store so that she can pick her products and pack them so that with time she can establish her store as one of the largest in her locality.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Carmela tiene 33 años de edad y vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Se ocupa en la producción y venta de frutas, actividad que realiza hace 10 años, puesto que sus padres fueron agricultores y le enseñaron los gajes del oficio, sobre todo por los cuidados que tiene que dar a sus terrenos, para ello, trabaja gran parte del día en abonar y cuidar sus cultivos, para así mejorar la calidad de sus productos.Lo que le agrada y le atrae de su trabajo es la cosecha, ya que cosechar el fruto de su esfuerzo es muy gratificante, a pesar lo cansado que es, las horas de trabajo bajo el sol y las caminatas que tiene que realizar para llegar a sus terrenos. Su motivo de salir adelante es lograr el bienestar de los suyos. Carmela desea ampliar su bodega, donde pueda seleccionar sus productos y encajonarlos, así con el tiempo poder consolidarse como una de las bodegas de fruta más grande dentro de su localidad.

loans.use: Expansion and improvement of her fruit stand.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora is 47 years old and lives with her husband. They both take care of their small granddaughter because their daughter works outside of the city. She sells all kinds of herbs at the markets in the city. She also sells them in the city of Huancayo where she can sell them at higher prices. She has been doing this for over 5 years and this activity occupies most of her day. What she likes about this job is that it is not heavy work and does not require great physical effort. Without a doubt though, what is difficult about it is finding medicinal herbs. This is why she has to visit various places to acquire them as these herbs are the most demanded at the markets. Flora wishes to acquire a greater quantity of herbs to take them to the capitol to be sold. Most of all, she wishes to become known in order to obtain more clients which will increase her income and strengthen her business in the capitol.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Flora tiene 47 años y vive en compañía de su esposo y ambos cuidan de su pequeña nieta porque su hija se encuentra trabajando fuera de la ciudad. Se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de yerbas, las cuales vende en los mercados de la ciudad, como también las lleva a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde las vende a mayores precios, está actividad la realiza por más de 5 años, ocupando casi todo el día. Lo que le agrada es que el trabajo es liviano y no requiere tanto de esfuerzo físico, pero sin duda lo que le resulta difícil de realizar es conseguir yerbas medicinales, por ello tiene que visitar diversos lugares para adquirirlos, ya que son estas las que más demanda rentabilidad tienen en los mercados. Flora desea adquirir mayor cantidad de yerbas y llevarlas a la capital para venderlas, sobre todo darse a conocer, para captar clientes que le ayuden a mejorar sus ingresos económicos y consolidar su negocio dentro de la capital..

loans.use: Increase the quanity of herbs that she sells.

loans.name: Yola Obdulia

texts.es:
Yola is 54 years old. She has lived with her five children since she separated from her husband. Her children are what drive her efforts and her want to succeed. Her business is selling groceries. She does this in a small store in her home which she obtained with great effort and which she was able to establish without neglecting her children.
