She has been in business for more than three years and since that time Yola works there all the time. She tries not only to sell but also to pay adequate attention to her clients. What she likes about her job is the bonds of friendship that she has formed with her neighbors who have become her best clients. The hard part of this business is that if she does not have the ability to acquire better products her sales and her income decline. She hopes to acquire better products for her clients and most of all to stock her store with a greater diversity of products so that it can become a sustainable store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Yola es una mujer de 54 años, quien desde que se separó vive con sus 5 hijos, quienes son el motor de su esfuerzo y superación. Su negocio, la venta de abarrotes, posee una pequeña tienda en su domicilio, la cual, con mucho esfuerzo, obtuvo y que gracias a Dios, nos dice, logró establecerse en el mercado sin descuidar su hogar y a sus cinco hijos. Su negocio tiene más de 3 años y desde entonces Yola se ocupa en él todo el tiempo, trata no sólo de vender, sino que también dar una adecuada atención a sus clientes. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo son los lazos de amistad que ha formado con sus vecinos, quienes se han convertido en sus mejores clientes. Lo difícil de esta actividad es que si no tiene la capacidad de adquirir mejores productos bajan las ventas y sus ingresos. Anhela adquirir mayores productos para sus clientes, sobre todo, surtir su tienda con gran diversidad de productos y convertirse en una tienda sostenible.

loans.use: Increase the products in her grocery store.

loans.name: Sara Ruth

texts.es:
Sara is 34 years old and lives with her parents, along with her two small children. She sells beauty products in a small store she was able to set up in her mother’s home, where she also sells other types of items. She can manage her activities without having to sacrifice caring for her kids. Her store has been operational for 4 years now, and she dedicates a great part of her day to selling her merchandise. She likes her work, because selling and negotiating are activities she enjoys doing especially because of the contact it allows her with other people. Despite all this, selling the beauty products is difficult without having demonstrations to help customers make their decisions. Having two young children motivates her and she wants to be able to provide good educations for them so that they can become professionals. Sara wants to invest in buying more beauty products at wholesale, and wants to use these both for demonstrations and also to sell them quickly without having to wait for the catalog orders to come in. She would like to designate an area in her store for only her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Sara tiene 34 años y vive en la casa de sus padres, junto a sus 2 hijos jóvenes. Ella vende productos de belleza en la pequeña tienda que logró instalar en la casa de su madre, donde también puede dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes, sin descuidar el cuidado que tiene que brindar a sus dos hijos. Su tienda viene funcionando ya 4 años, juntamente con sus productos de belleza, y en estas actividades dedica gran parte del día, lo cual le agrada, porque el vender y negociar es algo que le gusta realizar, sobre todo por el contacto que tiene con las personas. Sin embargo, lo dificultoso es poder ofrecer sus productos de belleza sin tener una muestra que ayude a las personas a tomar decisiones en sus pedidos. El tener dos hijos jóvenes la motiva a que poder ofrecerles la posibilidad de cursar estudios superiores y que logren ser profesionales. Sara desea invertir en la compra de productos de belleza al por mayor, y tener así la posibilidad de que no sólo le sirvan de mostrador a sus clientes, sino también venderlos rápidamente sin tener que esperar la llegada de los pedidos por catálogo y así poder instalar en su bodega un espacio solo para sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products at wholesale, so she can have them for demonstrations for her customers and also turn around and sell them quickly.

loans.name: Magda Rebeca

texts.es:
Magda is 37 years old and lives with her husband and her 4 year old son. She works growing fruit and also buys a large quantity of plots of cultivated land with fruit planted and grown by the previous owner. She then sells the harvest from the plots she has purchased. Her husband looks for the plots and she works selecting the marketable fruit, packaging it into boxes and taking care of the order contracts. She works all day, every day. She appreciates most the work that she is able to do inside her store because it is light work. The complicated part of her work is boxing the products. Since they will be shipped to many cities, she has to package them very carefully so that they do not spoil en route, and to ensure that they do not get destroyed on the way but arrrive at the client site in good condition.

Her small son is her greatest motivation; she wants to be able to offer him better quality of life.

Magda will invest the loan in the purchase of a large quantity of fruit and boxes, as way to increase her orders. In the near future she hopes to open a store in the center of her city in order to handle even more orders.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Magda tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de cuatro años. Se dedica al cultivo de fruta, las cuales también produce, compra gran cantidad de chacras ya cultivadas para solo vender los productos que se cosecharán, para ello, su esposo busca las chacras y Magda se dedica a la selección de las frutas, encajonarlas y realizar los contratos de pedidos. Esta actividad la realiza todos los días, durante todo el día.A Magda le agrada más el trabajo dentro de su bodega, porque es liviano, la parte complicada es encajonar los productos, puesto que estos serán trasladados a diversas ciudades y para que no se malogren tiene que encajonarlos debidamente para evitar que se estropeen y quedar bien con sus compradores.

Su pequeño hijo es el gran motivo de su trabajo, poder ofrecerle una vida de calidad es su deseo.

Magda invertirá el dinero en la compra de mayor cantidad de fruta y cajones, así incrementar sus pedidos. En un futuro cercano desea abrir una bodega en el centro de su cuidad para tener mayores pedidos.

loans.use: Buy large quantities of fruit and fruit boxes for her business.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita is 53 years old and lives with her 3 children, who are all studying in higher education (post high school) programs. She earns her living raising small animals, particularly guinea pigs. Guinea pigs are very profitable products in the capital and in the markets in her city. In order for the sales price of the animals to be profitable for Felicita, however, she has to invest in them, not only in the cost of their feed but also in time for their care. For Felicita the investment in time is not so difficult since she raises the animals in her house and generally cares for them during the mornings. What she appreciates about her work is that raising animals is not heavy work. In fact it is easy work, and even more so when you learn to love your animals. The hardest part of her work is improving the breeding of her animals, since buying new breeding stock is expensive.

Felicita wishes to see her children become professionals; this dream motivates her to continue working hard on her business.

With the loan that she is requesting she plans to buy some cages where she can breed her animals and improve the breeding of her guinea pigs, with the objective to be able to sell the animals outsiD. of Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Felicita tiene 53 años, vive con sus 3 hijos, quienes son jóvenes y cursan estudios superiores. Tiene como actividad la crianza D. animales menores, sobre todo D. cuyes, los cuales son muy rentables en la capital y en los mercados D. su ciudad, pero para que el precio D. sus animales sea rentable, tiene que invertir en ellos, no tan sólo dinero para su alimentación, sino tiempo para su cuidado, lo cual no es tan difícil, puesto que los cría dentro D. su casa donD. por lo general los atienD. por la mañana.Lo que le agrada D. este trabajo es que criar animales no es muy pesado, sino bastante fácil y aún más cuando se aprenD. a quererlos, sin embargo, lo difícil es mejorar la raza debido al costo D. estos. Felicita desea ver a sus hijos profesionales y este sueño la motiva en seguir esforzándose. Con el dinero que solicita tiene pensado adquirir algunas jaulas donD. pueda seleccionar a sus animales y mejorar la raza D. sus cuyes, con el fin D. que pueda vender sus animales fuera del país.

loans.use: Buy cages where she will breed her guinea pigs and improve the genetics of her stock in order to sell them in Peru and internationally.

loans.name: Marcia Melina

texts.es:
Melina is 29 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her 5 year old son.

She is a very hardworking woman, who makes her living selling groceries from her own tiny convenience store. She was able to open the store a year ago with a great deal of effort. She is now working on improving her business. She works all day, tending to her clients and offering products of the highest quality. What she most appreciates about her business is that she is able to share her working hours with her small son, who requires a lot of attention. Her store requires lots of her attention, and as well and she is determined not to neglect it. Lately, the prices she pays for her products have increased and she is not able to keep up with the increased costs, which has limited her ability to offer her clients the best.

As a result, Melina would like to invest in the the purchase of food products and merchandise in order to stock her store well. She wants her store to be a place where people come and find what they need.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Melina tiene 29 años, es madre soltera y vive con su pequeño hijo de 5 años.

Es una mujer muy trabajadora, dedicada a la venta de abarrotes dentro de su pequeña bodega, la cual pudo instalar con mucho esfuerzo hace 1 año, ahora trabaja en mejorarla, para ello le dedica todo el día, atendiendo a sus clientes y ofreciendo los mejores productos de calidad.Lo que más le agrada de su negocio es que puede compartir horas de trabajo junto a su pequeño hijo, quien requiere de muchas atenciones, al igual que su tienda la cual no puede descuidar.Pero es estas últimas temporadas, los productos subieron sus precios y Melina no puede lidiar con ello, limita su posibilidad de ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.

Es así, que Melina desea invertir en la compra de productos y mercadería, para así surtir su bodega y ser una tienda donde las personas recurran y encuentren lo necesario para sus necesidades.

loans.use: Invest in additional inventory in order to better stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Mercedes Esperanza

texts.es:
Mercedes is 21 years old and lives with her husband and her 5 children. She works selling prepared food at the entrances of the local schools and in the small storefront she owns. She works all morning long preparing the variety of dishes she will later sell. She offers products at prices that the local people can afford, and as a result has excellent sales and lots of traffic through her storefront and points of sale at the schools. Without doubt this work helps her not to neglect her role as mother. The difficult part of the business is carrying her food to the various points of sale only to later carry them all to her tiny storefront, where she finishes the day selling all that she has left.

Mercedes' 5 children are the motor that drives her to continue working in order to offer them a quality education.

She wishes to invest the loan by renting a storefront close to the school in her area where she could sell her food comfortably, in one location. She plans to later convert the storefront into a cafeteria.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Mercedes tiene 21 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos. Se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que realiza en las puertas de los colegios y el pequeño local que posee. Se ocupa toda la mañana en la preparación para luego vender sus diversos platillos, los cuales son de costos acorde a la posibilidad de las personas, lo que hace que su venta sea mayor y tenga más concurrencia. Sin duda este trabajo le ayuda a no descuidar su rol como madre dentro de su hogar, lo difícil es trasladar su comida a los diversos lugares para después llevarlos a su pequeño local donde termina de venderlos.

Mercedes tiene en sus cinco hijos, el motor que la impulsa a seguir trabajando, y así ofrecerles una educación de calidad.

Desea invertir el dinero que solicita en el alquiler de un local cercano al colegio de su localidad, donde pueda vender con tranquilidad sus platillos y convertirlo en un cafetín en el futuro.

loans.use: To rent a store close to the local school where she will be able to sell her prepared food more comfortably.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel is married to her husband, Jose Luis Martinez Navarrente, who is a musician. They have five children, three of which are married and two are single. Maria began her business two years ago making and selling tortillas in her house to help her husband pay for their children's educational expenses. Currently, things are going well for her business as it has grown in the past two years.

Maria needs a $450 loan which she will repay in 6 months to purchase an iron to make tortillas. With your help Maria will continue improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

María Isabel es casada, su esposo se llama José Luis Martínez Navarrete es músico, tienen cinco hijos 3 casados y dos solteros, el negocio lo inicio hace dos años elaborando y vendiendo tortillas en su casa, esto con el propósito de ayudarle a su marido a pagar los estudios de sus hijos. Actualmente le va muy bien con su negocio ya que poco a poco lo ha hecho crecer.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $450 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una plancha para hacer tortillas. Con tu ayuda Isabel seguirá progresando con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase an iron

loans.name: Rosa Guadalupe

texts.es:
Rosa is married with 3 children, Juan Roberto (5), Edga Oziel (9) and Jessica Berenice (14). Her husband works in construction. She began her business 1 year ago through a friend whom invited her to make tortillas in her house which they would later sell to a local store.

Rosa needs a $500 loan which she will repay in 6 months to remodel her business. With your support Rosa will finish on top.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa esta casada, su esposo trabaja en una constructora y tiene tres hijos de 5 , 9 y 14 años, que se llaman Juan Roberto, Edgar Oziel y Jessica Berenice. Inicio su negocio hace un año por una amiga que la invito a asociarse haciendo tortillas en su casa que después le vendían a una tienda cercana a su domicilio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su negocio, con tu apoyo Rosa saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Remodel her business

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #60279

loans.name: Vicenta Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Vicenta is a single mother, but now her children are all independent. She lives in the San Luis neighborhood in the city of Managua. Doña Vicenta is a woman who, aside from being a wage earner, she has a small business in her home. She sells school supplies and other seasonal items. She started this business with money from her past work, thinking about how to survive in case she was left without a job. Doña Vicenta is improving her home. She will use the loan to put ceramic on the floor of her living room and that way her home will be more confortable and she will see the fruits of her efforts reflected in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Vicenta es madre soltera, pero ya todos sus hijos son independientes a ella. Habita en el barrio San Luis de la ciudad de Managua. Doña Vicenta es una mujer que a parte de ser asalariada, tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa de habitación; se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares y otros artículos propios de una temporada determinada, este negocio lo inició con dinero de la liquidación de su trabajo pasado, lo hizo pensando en una manera de poder sostener en vista de que se había quedado sin empleo. Doña Vicenta está mejorando su casa de habitación, el préstamo lo usará para poner cerámica al piso de la sala de su vivienda, y así poder ir haciendo su casa más cómoda y ver el fruto de su esfuerzo reflejado en su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of Ceramic for the Floor of her Home

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a young, enterprising woman. She is 22 years old and is single. She began her business two years ago selling shoes mail-order to her friends so that she could pay for her educational expenses as her parents did not have the resources to fund her education. Currently, she has been able to increase her client base and revenues.

Yolanda needs a $450 loan that she will repay in 6 months to purchase a showcase to display her shoes and help increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer. Yolanda es una chica joven y emprendedora, tiene 22 años y es soltera. inicio su negocio hace dos años, vendiendo zapatos por catalogo a sus familiares, y lo hizo para poder solventar los gastos de sus estudios ya que ella se los pagaba, porque sus padres no tenían recursos para pagarle la escuela y ella deseaba seguir estudiando. Actualmente ha logrado incrementar su cartera de clientes y de igual manera sus ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $450 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un exhibidor donde poner sus zapatos y así lograr incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase showcase

loans.name: Rolando De Jesús

texts.es:
Don Rolando is 59 years of age. He lives in the Ducuali neighborhood, is married, and has four children who are now independent. His wife is a homemaker.

Don Rolando is an electrical technician and also sells hardware in the Roberto Huembes market. He has forty years of experience in sales and started as a construction assistant. The requested loan is to improve his home, to build a hygenic bathroom and that way give him comfort and a more decent home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Rolando tiene 59 años de edad, habita en el barrio Ducuali, es casado, tienen cuatro hijos que son ya independientes, su esposa es ama de casa.

Don Rolando es técnico electricista y también vende artículos ferreteros en el mercado Roberto Huembes, tiene cuarenta años de experiencia en las ventas e inició como ayudante de construcción. El préstamo solicitado es para mejorar su casa, construirá un servicio higiénico y así darle comodidad y una casa más digna a su familia.

loans.use: Construction of a Hygenic Bathroom

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es:
Imelda is a 51 year old woman who works as a domestic employee in a home. She also sells beauty and personal products in small quantities. She has two children who she has had to raise alone. Her children are 25 and 30 years old and are already married and do not live in Imelda's home. Because of how difficult her life has been, she has never been able to invest in her home as all of her income was used to maintain her children. It is for this reason that her children are independent from her. She would like to improve her home. It is for this that she requests a loan to buy construction materials and to make a room in her home and this way she will be able to enjoy greater comfort now that her chidlren are not with her.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Imelda es una mujer de 51 años de edad, que se dedica a trabajar como doméstica en una casa de habitación. También vende artículos de belleza y personales en pequeñas cantidades. Tiene 2 hijos a los que tuvo que criar sola, sus hijos tiene 25 y 30 años de edad y ya están casados y no habitan en la casa de Imelda. Debido a lo dura que fue su vida, nunca pudo invertir en su vivienda, ya que todos sus ingresos eran usados para la manutención de sus hijos. Es por eso que ya que sus hijos son independientes a ella, quiere mejorar su casa de habitación, por lo que solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y hacer una habitación en su casa, y así poder gozar de mayor comodidad ahora que ya sus hijos no están con ella.

loans.use: Construction of a Room in her Home

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin worked in the countryside for many years. Upon seeing that the economic situation was poor, he moved to Reynosa, Tamaulipas to look for a job, so that he would have more opportunities. He found work, and little by little saved money until he was able to begin a repair shop. Little by little he has increased his income until today he is able to meet his spending and pay for his children's education.

Martin is now asking for a $400 loan which he will repay in 6 months to purchase material. He is hopeful that with Kiva's support he will obtain it.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Martín trabajo en el campo por mucho tiempo, al ver que la situación económica era muy carente, emigro a Reynosa, Tamaulipas, en cuanto llego empezó a buscar trabajo ya que así tenía más posibilidades de solventar sus gastos. Encontró trabajo, poco a poco se fue haciendo de sus ahorros, hasta que decidió poner una vulcanizadora. Poco a poco le ha ido dejando buenos ingresos, que hasta hoy en día a podido solventar todos los gastos económicos y la educación de sus hijos.

Hoy en día esta solicitando de un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses, para la compra de material, tiene todas las esperanzas que con el apoyo de Kiva lo obtendrá.

loans.use: Purchase work materials

loans.name: Celerina

texts.es:
Celerina started this business to support her family. Because her husband was unemployed for some time, they did not see another way to continue forward. One of Celerina's friends invited her to go to a meeting where she learned to cook medical products, and eventually the two started selling the products because the initial investment was small. Celerina took the opportunity because it interested her and provided her with a good income. At that time, she did not have an income, so she worked as her friend's saleswoman. Little by little she attracted new clients and sold many products, but her earnings were not that high because she was only the saleswoman. Later, Celerina became an independent seller, and today she has many clients and high earnings.

Celerina needs a $400 loan which she will repay in 6 months to purchase products. She is hopeful that with Kiva's support she will obtain them.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Celerina se decidió a iniciar este negocio por la necesidad económica en su familia. Ya que por un tiempo su esposo estuvo desempleado, y no veían la manera de poder salir adelante, entonces una de sus amigas la invito a que fueran a una reunión de para que conociera los productos medicinales y si le interesaba para que formara parte del grupo de ventas, ya que la inversión era mínima. Entonces ella decidió asistir y le intereso la forma de trabajo y que le iba a dejar buenas ganancias para poder solventar los gastos. En ese momento ella no contaba con ingresos, entonces le dijo a su amiga que por mientras le podía ayudar como su vendedora, entonces su amiga acepto y por unos meses le ayuda a vender productos. Poco a poco pues se fue haciendo de clientes y de buenas ventas, auque pues para ella la ganancia era menos por que era vendedora de su amiga. Entonces posteriormente ella entro directa como vendedora independiente, hasta hoy en día tiene muchos clientes y buenas ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses, para la compra de productos, tiene todas las esperanzas que con el apoyo de Kiva lo obtendrá.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Carmen Amalia

texts.es:
Carmen started this business to pay for her sons' education and to provide for her family. Later, her family began to have financial problems when her husband lost his job. Fortunately, with her business Carmen was able to support her family. Thirteen years ago she began selling groceries out of her house, and little by little invested in her business and expanded her offerings.

Carmen needs a $1,000 loan which she will repay in 6 months to purchase merchandise and promotional banner to hang outside her business, which will make her business more reputable.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen inicio con este negocio debido a que necesitaba dinero para pagar los estudios de sus hijos y para que no les faltara nada en su casa, en aquel entonces su necesidad fue que pasaron por una crisis económica muy difícil por que su esposo no tenia trabajo pero afortunadamente con el negocio logro sacar adelante a su familia. Empezó hace 13 años vendiendo ahí mismo en su casa abarrotes y mercería, comenzó con muy poca mercancía y poco a poco le a ido invirtiendo a su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $1,000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y mandar hacer unas lonas promocionales para poner a fuera de su negocio y así que su negocio sea mas redituable.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Señora Agripina is 29 years of age, is married, and is the mother of two daughters. She completed her second year of secondary school. She lives in the city of Caritamaya, sector Marquiri, Acora district, Puno province and region.

She is a member of the communal bank "Nuevo Horizonte" from which she received her first loan of 500 New Soles. She invested this money in the purchase of 300 kilos of metal like car springs to make tools like picks, rakes, posts, etc.

With this loan of 700 New Soles ($250) that she will repay in four months, she will buy 500 kilos of metal, old springs, electrodes, along with other necessary things for the making of tools for agriculture and livestock raising.

She started her business 8 years ago, when she got together with her husband. She learned this business from her grandparents and relatives. She is very happy now that with the loans she has acquired more capital, merchandise, and income.

Her greatest dream is to have a shop where she makes tools in the city of Ilave and that her daughters become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Agripina tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, madres de dos hijas y logró estudiar hasta segundo de secundaria, vive en el Centro Poblado de Caritamaya sector Marquiri, del distrito de Acora, Provincia y Región de Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Horizonte, en el cual obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.500.00 nuevos soles. Este dinero lo invirtió en compra de 300 kilos de fieros como muelles de carro para elaborar herramientas como picos, rastrillos, estacas, etc.

Con este préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 500 kilos de fierros, muelles viejos, electrodo entres otras cosas necesarios para elaboración de herramientas de trabajo agrícola y pecuaria.

El negocio inicio hace 8 años, cuando se junto con su esposo, este negocio aprendió de sus abuelos y padres herederos. Ella esta muy feliz ya que con los préstamos que adquirió incremento más su capital, mercadería e ingresos económicos.

Su mayor sueño es tener un taller de elaboración de herramientas en la ciudad de Ilave y sus hijas sean profesionales.

loans.use: Wholesale Purchase of Metal and Other Materials

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina is 58 years of age. She studied through the first graD., is the mother of 5 children (2 sons and 3 daughters), is married, and lives in M., in the center of Camicachi, the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, in the Region of Puno.

She raises sheep and cattle. With her first loan of 300 New Soles, she purchased two sheep to raise. With the next loans, she acquired cattle, pigs, and sheep to raise.

With this loan of 1,000 New Soles ($350), she will buy three black-faced sheep to raise and plans to increase her income. This loan will be repaid in four payments.

She is content now that she has increased her sheep and improved her income. In this way, she has succeeded in covering her food expenses. Her dream is to carry out the raising of pigs and to live happily.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Angelina tiene 58 años D. edad, estudió hasta primer grado D. primaria, es madre D. 5 hijos (2 varones y 3 mujer), es casada y vive en la parcialidad D. M., del Centro Poblado D. Camicachi, del distrito D. Ilave, provincia El Collao y en la Región D. Puno.

Ella se dedica a la actividad económica D. engorD. D. ovinos y vacunos, ya que con el primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró dos ovejas mejorados, con los siguientes préstamos adquirió ganado vacuno para el engorD., chanchos y ovejas.

Con este crédito D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará 3 ovejas D. cara negra para el engorD. y piensa incrementar más sus ingresos económicos, este préstamo será pagado en 04 cuotas.

Ella está contenta, ya que incrementó su ganado ovino y mejoró sus ingresos económicos, D. esa manera logró cubrir sus gastos D. alimentación. Su sueño más granD. realizar actividad D. engorD. D. cerdos y vivir feliz.

loans.use: Purchase of Sheep

loans.name: Chany

texts.en: Mrs. Chany L. lives in Tie Muoy Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  She is a middleman who buys sugarcane to resell.  Because her business is going well, she wants to expand it.  She decided to ask for a loan to buy more sugarcane to sell.  Her husband, Mr. Hoeurn Chhay, is a taxi driver who can earn a small income for their family.  Mrs. Chany L. is 50 years old and the mother of three children, who are all attending high school.  Mrs. Chany L. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more sugarcane to resell

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
"I own a small plot of land on which I have a partially constructed home. I want to complete the construction since the house in which I am currently living was loaned to me for one year. I need to finish the construction in order to settle in the home with my family. The people who loaned me the house where we now live are asking me to leave it. I am requesting a loan of 1000 dollars to complete the construction."

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Cuento con un pequeño terreno semiconstruido, el cual quiero terminar D. construir ya que la casa en la que vivo es una vivienda que me han prestado durante 1 año. Tengo la necesidad D. terminar la construcción, para al término D. ella establecerme con mi familia, pues como comento la casa en la que resido es prestada y me la están pidiendo. La cantidad que Solicito es D. 1,000.00 dlls.

loans.use: Finish construction if his home

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Chhum S., 50, works with her husband selling Khmer palm cake in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. The cake is made from palm fruit and it is a favorite cake among Cambodian people, especially people who live in Kampong Chhnang. Both of them can earn approximately up to US$ 8 in profit a day. This couple has five children and all of them are students and sometimes when they are free from school, they help their parents selling the cake as well.

Mrs. Chhum would like to take out a loan from Kiva via "Credit", Kiva's local partner, in the amount of US$ 1000 to invest in her business, purchasing more rice, beans, palm fruits and other things to increase the number of palm cakes they can make for sale. This couple also told a loan officer that they want all their children to complete at least high school and if they need to study more, they would love to push their education further as well.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, beans, palm fruits and other things for making palm cake for sale

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong K., age 51, is a true entrepreneur and lives in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. In the morning, she sells rice in front of the garment factory and in the evening she sells various kinds of dessert. Between the two businesses, she can make up to US$ 15 in revenue a day. Her husband earns around US$ 7 in profit a day as well, working as a painter. This couple has three children, one of whom, the oldest daughter, helps her mother selling rice and desserts and the other two are students.

To earn more profit, Hong has requested a loan from Kiva via "Credit", Kiva's local partner, of US$ 1200 to purchase a generator, television, DVD player, speaker and other things to run a Karaoke business. Any remainder of the loan money is to be used to fix up the little restaurant. In the future, Hong wants to diversify her products to meet her customers' demand. (Hong is pictured with her oldest daughter by her little restaurant.)

loans.use: To purchase a generator, television, DVD player, speaker and other things to run a Karaoke business

loans.name: Tuk

texts.en:
Tuk Y., 58, is a widow with two children and makes around US$ 2.50 in profit from selling a variety of vegetables in the market. One of her children has a business running a motor-taxi and makes approximately $3 in profit a day.

Tuk has requested a loan from Kiva via "Credit", Kiva's local partner, to replace their old and unreliable motorbike so her son can be more effective in running his business. The old motorbike uses a lot of gas and has been fixed many times.

In the future, if she has enough money, she will build a cage and raise animal such as pigs. (Tuk is pictured with her son when she was about to bring her vegetables to sell at the market.)

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike used as a motor-taxi

loans.name: Loa

texts.en:
Loa S., 24, is the mother of one little child and lives with her husband in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She is a tailor, working out of her home and earns approximately US$ 2 in profit each day. Her husband, Phal Chamroeun, 28, is a staff member in a micro-finance institution in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

Loa would like to borrow from Kiva via "Credit", Kiva's local partner, US$ 200 to purchase feed for their pigs.

loans.use: To purchase feed for pigs

loans.name: Born

texts.en:
Born S., 50, is a widow and earns approximately US$ 6 in profit per day from selling groceries in front of her house. She has six children, three of whom are employed as garment factory workers with a salary of US$ 70 each per month. The others are students and help their mother with housework and selling products.

Born has requested a loan from Kiva to add grocery inventory to meet her customer demand.

loans.use: To add grocery inventory to meet her customer demand

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Mrs. Hem S. is a 48-year-old tailor, earning US$ 9.40 per day. She lives in Pranet Preah Village, Banteay Meanchey Province. She is a widow and has four children, two of whom are married. One daughter is a garment worker who earns $50 per month, and one son is a bricklayer who earns $100 per month. Their income helps to support Hem S. and allows her to make her loan repayments.

Hem S. is now requesting a loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase cloth to make clothes for sale such as shirts, shorts, and pants. She plans to use the remainder of the loan to purchase piglets to raise and also to make a small pigpen that will provide supplemental income for the family. This loan will expand her capital for her business and increase her income. Hem S. appears in the photo.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase cloth to make clothes for sale

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en:
Murodjon B. is 25 years old. He is married with two kids. Murodjon is a market vendor. He sells men’s jeans, shirts, shoes and other clothes for men in the famous local market called “Panjshanbe”. Over 5 years of working at the market, Murodjon has already got enough experience to do his work successfully and has clients who always come to him.

Murodjon is trying to satisfy the needs of all his customers, whatever their tastes and income levels. Murodjon’s kids are small now but already today, he is working hard in order to give them a good education and to make them happy. Today Murodjon is planning to increase his working capital in order to purchase new goods for re-sale. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 600 USD for a term of 3 months. Murodjon promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting him. Your generosity can change his and his family's lives. Be an important part of the growth of Murodjon’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for re-sale

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Problems and money shortages have never defeated Mahbuba, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. Mahbuba is an extremely hard-working and energetic woman. She is 45 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Her husband is an electrician.

Mahbuba started her own business because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family expenses. For more than eleven years, she has operated a store where she sells girl’s and women’s clothing. As a rule she travels to the neighboring town, Istaravshan, to get new garments at very cheap prices. Her store is well known, and people love to visit because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful.

Mahbuba hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her family, especially for her four children. To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan that she will use to buy more clothing to sell. With this purpose in mind, Mahbuba is requesting 1150 USD for the term of 10 months. She promises to repay the loan with accuracy as she has done with previous loans. Mahbuba is counting on your help. Be an important of the growth of Mahbuba’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for girls and women for re-sale

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Sreng S., 43, is a housewife and lives with four of her children in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. To support the family, her husband, Bich Huy, 46, works as a motor-taxi driver, making around US$ 2.50 in profit a day. Two of their children are employed as waiters in Siem Reap province with a salary of US$ 120 each per month.

Mrs. Sreng would like to borrow from Kiva via "Credit", Kiva's local partner, to purchase a motorbike for her children who work at Siem Reap to use to commute to work. This will reduce the price that her children pay every day for a motor-taxi. (Mr. Bich Huy is pictured because his wife was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to use to commute to work

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok S., 26, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. Every day, to support her family, she works selling charcoal in the village, earning around US$ 15 in revenue per day. Her husband is a taxi-driver and makes approximately US$ 4 each day.

Mrs. Sok would like to borrow from Kiva via "Credit", Kiva's local partner, to purchase more wood to convert to charcoal for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to convert to charcoal for sale

loans.name: Thi Hong's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs N. Thi Hong (ID Number 13010043), 43 years old, sells confectionery and fruits at home. Her husband works as a carpenter, thus her family's daily income is stable at 150,000VND (about 10USD). Mrs. Hong joined the Fund so as to expand her inventory for her business. To her, it is very convenient to repay on an installment basis, so this time she would like to borrow 3,186,000VND to invest in her business. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. V. Thi Ty (ID Number 13010044), borrows 3,186,000VND to sell general goods.
  • Mrs. C. Thi Hoan (ID Number 13010045), borrows 3,186,000VND to sell general goods.
  • Mrs. Luu Thi Thom (ID Number 13010046), borrows 3,186,000VND to sell construction supplies.
  • Mrs. V. Thi Hang (ID Number 13010047), borrows 2,006,000VND to raise livestock.
  • Mrs. V. Thi Bac (ID Number 13010048), borrows 3,186,000VND to raise livestock and do business.
  • The total amount requested is 1,100.00USD.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    Chị Nguyễn thi Hồng năm nay 43 tuổi MS 13010043, hiện tại chị Hồng kinh doanh bánh kẹo, hoa quả tại nhà. Còn chồng chị làm nghề thợ mộc. Nên mức thu nhập cũng khá ổn định từ 150.000 VND/ ngày. Chị tham gia vay vốn của chương trình để thêm vốn vào hoạt động kinh doanh của gia đình, đồng thời Chị thấy hình thức vay trả rất thuận tiện, nên lần này Chị đăng ký vay ở mức 3.186.000 VND lấy vốn kinh doanh,các thành viên trong nhóm Chị :

  • chi Vũ thị Tý MS 13010044 đăng ký vay mức 3.186.000VND để buôn bán
  • chị C. thị Hoàn MS 13010045 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để đi chợ
  • chị L. thị Thơm MS13010046 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để kinh doanh vật liệu xây dựng
  • chị Vũ thị Hằng MS 13010047 vay mức 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi
  • chị Vũ thị Bắc MS 13010048 vay mức 3.186.000 VND về chăn nuôi và kinh doanh

loans.use: Selling fruits and retailing

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarorn M. is a widow with seven children: four daughters and three sons. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. Three of her children are garment factory workers and two other children study in a local school. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sarorn M. has been farming for many years. She grows tomatoes and bananas near her house. Besides farming, she also sells porridge in the morning in front of her house. However, the main income of the family is from her children who work in a garment factory.

Sarorn M. is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase materials to repair some parts of her house.

loans.use: To repair some parts of her house.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun S. is a widow with three children: one daughter and two sons. Her two sons have employment in Phnom Penh. Her daughter has been a factory worker for four years. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Saroeun has been a brick kiln worker for ten years. Currently her sons have to pay to travel to work by motor taxi and she lacks the money to purchase a motorbike for her sons to use to ride to work. So, she is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a motorcycle for her two sons.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to work

loans.name: Vech

texts.en:
Mr. Vech M. is a 45-year-old farmer who also does fishing fishing and who lives with his wife, Mrs.Nem Seng, 42, and four children. M. grows rice on his farmland. The farming business is the main income-generating activity in their family so he has to improve and desires to expand in the future. M. and his family live in Srork Commune, Kampong Cham Province. M. has been farming for eighteen years and earns approximately $1.50 per day.

In order to grow his farming business, he is now requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 150 to purchase fertilizer to increase his rice yield. The remainder of loan will be used to purchase some fishing implements for his supplemental business. The picture shows Mr. M., his wife, and children.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and some fishing implements

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Mrs. Somaly S., 39, and her husband, Mr. Bunna Saum, 41, who live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1991 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of their children study in a local school and the youngest is still young and stays at home.

Mrs. Somaly S. has been selling fruit for five years. She buys some fruit from villagers and some from the market to sell to tourists at the village riverside. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for seven years. Now he wants to change his business from motor taxi to Tuk Tuk driver because that way, he can carry more passengers than he can as a motor taxi. The couple lacks the money to buy a Tuk Tuk. Therefore, Mrs. Somly S. is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to add to her own money to buy a Tuk Tuk for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motor trailer (TUk TUk) for her husband

loans.name: Sokvun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokvun V., 21, and her husband, Mr. Nak Nheb, married in 2003 and have two sons. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Since she was thirteen years old, Sokvun V. has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for three years. He does his work in their village and nearby villages. Sokvun V. is requesting a loan of US$ 100 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Thi Ly's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo Thi Ly (ID Number 09050102), 34 years old, has three small children. She has a store selling animal feeds and silk. She also rears pigs, thus her family's daily income is stable. Seeing that the loans here are very convenient as she can repay them on an installment basis, Mrs. Ly decides to join the SEDA Fund. It is also very suitable for her kind of business. Therefore, she would like to borrow 3,186,000VND to invest in raising pigs. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. Ngo Thi Nhung (ID Number 09050103), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase pig feeds.
  • Mrs. Tran Thi Huong (ID Number 09050104), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase silk worms.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Tan (ID Number 09050105), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase chickens to breed.
  • Mrs. Ngo Thi Hang (ID Number 09050106), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase pig feeds.
  • Mrs. Ngo Thi Thin (ID Number 09050107), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase pig feeds.
  • The total amount requested is 1,175.00USD.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    chị Ngô thị Lý năm nay 34 tuổi MS 09050102 gia đình chị có 3 con nhỏ. Chị và chồng chị mở cửa hàng đại lý thức ăn gia súc, buôn tơ, chăn nuôi rất nhiều lợn. Vì vậy mức thu nhập hàng ngày của gia đình cũng khá ổn định, khi có vốn vay trả dần Chị đăng ký tham gia, bởi chị thấy rất thuận tiện và phù hợp với mục đích kinh doanh của gia đình. Chị đăng ký vay ở mức 3.186.000 VND để chăn nuôi. Nhóm Chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Ngô thị Nhung MS 09050103 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • chị Trần thị Hương MS 09050104 vay mức 3.186.000 VND mua kén về kéo tơ
  • chị Nguyễn thị Tần MS 09050105 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua gà giống
  • chị Ngô thị Hằng MS 09050106 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • chị Ngô thị Thìn MS 09050107 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua cám lợn

loans.use: Rearing pigs

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad Y. is 55 and married. He is a father of seven children and one of the residents of the Ningarhar province. Y. and his family have been living in the Shewa district for about 20 years; it's an agricultural area isolated from the city. His three sons and a daughter are studying in a public school in their village, and Y. has been teaching there since 2001.

Muhammad Y. is an active man. Besides teaching, he has a small animal husbandry business. Through it he attempts to cover his family expenditures. His monthly salary is just 3,000 Afghanis ($60), and it's too difficult to feed his family with this amount. His wife also helps him in his work. She brings grass for the cows and makes yogurt from their milk. Y. sells the yogurt in the bazaar.

Muhammad Y. has 300 Afghanis ($6) daily income, but it's not enough for him. There are 11 members in his family, and the costs are going to be increasing day by day. Besides these problems, his father has a serious illness and Y. must treat him because he doesn't have other brothers to take this responsibility. These hard problems definitely made a big headache for him, and he didn’t know how to find solution for it. After thinking deeply, he decided to buy more livestock and increase his income through them. He hopes that this decision may give a positive result. He has applied for a loan of 50,000 Afghanis from AFSG for 24 months.

Y. hopes to eradicate the barriers of the problems as soon as possible and then treat his sick father. Also he dreams of a bright and full future for his children as doctors and engineers in the future. He thanks the lenders so much.

loans.use: To buy stocks

loans.name: Thi Mai's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo Thi Mai (ID Number 09050095), 36 years old, lives with her husband and her two small children. Everyday, she cooks rice wine and takes care of the pigs, while her husband works as a construction project bidder. Therefore, her family's income is frequent and stable. The average daily income is about 120,000VND (8USD) to 150,000VND (10USD). This time, she would like to borrow 3,186,000VND to purchase more pigs to breed. Her group also consists of:
  • Nguyen Thi Trinh (ID Number 09050096), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase pig feeds and duck feeds.
  • Mrs. Ngo Thi Hien(ID Number 09050097), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase silk worms.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Ha (ID Number 09050098), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase pigs to breed.
  • Mrs. Ngo Thi Hien (ID Number 09050099), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase pigs to breed.
  • Mrs. C. Thi Thom (ID Number 09050100), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase pigs and silk worms.
  • Ngo Thi Lien (ID Number 09050101), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase animal feeds.
  • The total amount requested is 1,375.00USD.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    chị Ngô thị Mai năm nay 36 tuổi MS 09050095 chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ.Hằng ngày chị nấu rượu, chăn nuôi nhiều lợn, chồng chị là chủ thầu xây dựng. vì vậy gia đình chị thu nhập khá thường xuyên và ổn định, mức thu nhập bình quân mỗi ngày từ 120.000 VND đến 150.000 VND/ ngày. Lần này chị đăng ký tham gia ở mức 3.186.000 VND để bổ sung vốn mua lợn giống. các thành viên trong nhóm Chị như sau :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Trình MS 09050096 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua cám lợn, cám vịt
  • chị Ngô thị Hiền MS 09050097 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để làm tơ kén
  • chị Nguyễn thị Hà MS 09050098 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua lợn giống
  • chị Ngô thị Hiển MS 09050099 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua lợn giống
  • chị C. thị Thơm MS 09050100 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua lợn, làm tơ kén
  • chị Ngô thi Liên MS 09050101 vay mức 3.186.000 VND dể mua thức ăn chăn nuôi

loans.use: Breeding pigs

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Mrs. Pok V., 50, and her husband Mr. Chin Khut, 60, married in 1979 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of their children are married and live outside the family home. The couple live with their grand-daughter along National Road Number Five about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Pok V. has been in the business of selling food for many years. She sells beef soup in the village. Beef soup is one kind of famous food in Cambodia. We take the soup with beef and meat balls and put it in a hot pot until it boils; after that, we put vegetables into the pot and eat it.

Pok V.'s husband is a motor taxi driver. Now he wants to change from motor taxi to Motor Remorque taxi (a motorcycle with a trailer at the back) but lacks the money. Therefore, Pok V. is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to buy a Motor Remorque taxi for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a Motor Remorque taxi for her husband

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Choeun C. (not in the picture) and her husband, Mr. Bory Ban (shown in the picture), who live in a small village off of National Road Two about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh, married in 2001 and have one daughter.

Choeun has been working in a garment factory for thirteen years, while Bory has been a garment factory worker for two years as well. Now Choeun wants to create her own business selling fruit and needs the money to start her fruit-selling. So, she is requesting a loan of US$ 200 to purchase fruit for resale at the village market.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for re-sale

loans.name: Leakhena

texts.en:
Mrs. Leakhena D. is a widow with two daughters. Both of her daughters are garment factory workers. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Leakhena was a Chinese noodle seller for many years but now she has stopped her selling because a few months ago she had an accident that caused her right hand to be broken so she could not work. She will continue her business again when her hand gets well. Now her main income is from her daughters. Leakhena is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to build a bedroom for her daughter.

loans.use: To build a bedroom for her daughter

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Mr. Thouk M., 41, and his wife Mrs. Sokhan Kong, 43, married in 1994 and have two daughters who study in a local school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Thouk has been farming for twenty-two years. He grows vegetables and fruit near his house. His wife has been a silk weaver for twenty-five years. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Thouk M. is requesting a loan of US$ 100 to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for growing vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide for growing vegetables

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 27-year-old entrepreneur who lives in Kisumu, Kenya, with her husband and 4 children. She initiated her cereal and vegetable stall in 2000. Her hard work, determination, and excellent people skills have led to her success. Her profits pay for her household expenses. Elizabeth plans to use the funds from her next loan of US$350 to expand her current business and also to buy a stock of cereals in order to generate more income.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand her current business and buy stock of cereals

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru:
Mohira I. has been taking out loans with MicroInvest for almost five years. She is married and has two children. Mohira graduated from the university with a teacher's degree in mathematics, but was not able to find a job in her field, got married, had children, and got stuck in family life. Her husband would not let her go to work - instead, she had to help her mother-in-law run the household. After the civil war her husband was left without a job, and they had to borrow from everybody. Their children were growing - they had to feed them, clothe them, educate them. Some of Mohira's girlfriends sold goods at the market. She also went with them several times. Eventually she earned their trust and they gave her some goods for sale. She started selling women's clothes in a women's clothing store. Later she found out about MicroInvest, talked it over with her husband and took out a loan. Now her business is growing.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva translator.

Икрамова Мохира кредитуется в Микроинвесте почти 5 лет, она замужем имеет двоих детей. Мохира окончила математический (педагог) факультет, но по специальности устроиться не смогла, вышла замуж, появились дети - застряла в семейном круговороте. Муж не пускал на работу, надо было помогать свекрови вести домашнее хозяйство. После гражданской войны муж остался без работы, приходилось занимать у всех. Дети росли, надо было их кормить, одевать, обучать… Подруги Мохиры торговали на рынке, она несколько раз ходила с ними на рынок. Со временем вошла в доверие подруг, и они давали ей немного товара под реализацию. Она торгует в магазине женской одеждой. Позже узнала о Микроинвесте, посоветовалась с мужем, и получила кредит от Микроинвест. На данный момент ее бизнес расширяется.

loans.use: Expand line of products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is a 29-year-old married mother of 4 living children. She lives with her husband in Kisumu, Kenya. She initiated her retail shop business in 2006. She sells essential items such as bread, rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc. Her hard work, perseverance, good reputation, and 2 years in business, coupled with a well established client base, ensure that her business will continue to grow. She has applied for a loan of US$350 to help her purchase additional stock of essential commodities for sale.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To add stock of essential commodities

loans.name: Sobe 2023-4 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Flora Juan. She is currently in the business of selling rice, meat, and bread at the hotel and is requesting a loan to expand the hotel. She is 35 years old and married to a builder. She has two children, age 11 and 15, who are both in school. Each week, Flora makes approximately 70 Sudanese pounds in profit. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the hotel.

Flora is joined in her small group by G. P., Sarafina J., Suzi P., and Jenifa A.. G. has a business selling tea and cakes at the restaurant and wants to expand the restaurant. Sarafina is currently operating a business selling fried fish and bread at the restaurant on the market premises and wants a loan to expand her business. Susi operates a business of selling charcoal and wants to expand the business. Jenifa is currently in the business of selling local brew and is requesting a loan to open up bar.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yem D. is 43 years old. She is a housewife and cares for two children and cooks rice and other food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Chin On, is 45 years old. He runs a small private business providing house building in his village and other areas, and he earns $2.00 per day. They live in Tonle Bet Commune, Kampong Cham Province. They have four children in their family, two of whom are married.

Yem D. is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 500 for her husband's business to purchase construction material. They hope that the loan will help to improve their business and that that will increase the family's income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her husband's business

loans.name: Erali

texts.ru:
Erlai H. is 53 years old. He has 6 children. Each of them works, either helping out around the farm, or working in Russia. Erlai took out a loan to pay for livestock feed. Breeding livestock has a lot of expenses, and on top of that, to support his large family Erlai works on the fields from morning till night. His children help him here as well. He cultivates various vegetables: tomatoes, cucumbers, and corn. The income from his vegetables helps the family survive from spring till autumn, and then he earns money with his livestock. Sis months ago he took out a loan for animal feed, now he's paying back with money earned from selling his livestock. Currently he is taking out another loan in order to buy affordable livestock with the intent of selling it later.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva translator.

Хайдаралиев Эрали 53 года, у него шестеро детей. Каждый из них работает, где ни будь по хозяйству или находятся на заработке в России. Эрали получил кредит для откорма скота. Животноводство требует больших затрат, кроме того что бы прокормить свою большую семью, он работает на поле с утра то ночи, в этом ему помогают дети. На поле выращивает овощи: помидоры, огурцы и кукурузы. Реализация овощей помогает ему выжить с весны по осени, дальше он реализует свой скот. Пол года назад он получал кредит на откорм скота, сейчас расплачивается кредитом от продажи своего скота, на данный момент он приобретает по очередному займу дешевый скот , для того чтобы продать позже.

loans.use: Feeding livestock

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorm C. is a 40-year-old who makes about $2 per day selling cooked rice and porridge. Her husband, Mr. Yoem Saron, is a teacher who earns about $0.80 per day. They live with four children in Baray Commune, Kampong Thom province. One of their children is married, and another one who is a worker in a Korean company earns about US$ 50 per month that can help to cover the family's expenses.

C. is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a second motorcycle to use transporting cooked rice and porridge to sell. She will use the remainder of the loan to purchase fertilizer for their rice crop. The loan will allow her to reduce transport expenses, thus increasing the family's income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a second motorcycle to use transporting cooked rice and porridge to sell

loans.name: Freedom 2030-5 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Santuke D.. She is currently in the business of selling bread from home and is requesting a loan to expand the business. She is 40 years old and her husband is a businessman. She has three children, ranging from age 9 to 17, who are all in school. Each week, Santuke makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profit. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Santuke is joined in her group by Mary A., Rose A., Anite P., and Rose N.. Mary has a business selling local brew and wants to open a bar. Rose operates a business selling bread and wants a loan to expand the business. Anite operates a business of selling beans and rice at the hotel and also wants to expand the business. Rose sells local brew at the bar and is requesting a loan to expand the bar.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Choeun P., 26, operates a motor-taxi service while his wife, Lim Sok Iai, runs a small fruit stand. They live in Kampong Cham with three young children, and they typically make US$ 3 each per day in their respective jobs.

Choeun P. has asked to take out a loan to help his wife's fruit business grow. He has asked for US$ 1000 to purchase more fruits to expand her inventory and provide more options for customers. The family believes that this can increase her customer base and also increase their income, so the whole family will benefit.

With any money that is left over, Choeun P. would like to purchase a new motorbike to improve his own business. A better motorbike will use less gasoline and provide a more attractive option for customers.

loans.use: Purchase more fruit for his wife's business

loans.name: Nesi's Yatakuwa Group

texts.en:
Nesi is 23 years old. She is married woman and has two children, one 3 years old and the other 4 months old. She has been a clothes seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Nesi has had another successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Sikudhani, Rehema, Zainab, Salama, and Zaina.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Bich

texts.en:
Bich S., 27, is a married mother of a young child living in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She earns about $1 U.S. dollar every day working in the fields as a farmer, while her husband, Chea Sary, operates a taxi service. He can typically bring in about US$5 a day.

Bich and Chea depend largely on his salary. Unfortunately, his taxi cab is broken, and they lack the funds to repair it. That's why Bich has applied for a loan of US$1,000 to repair her husband's car and help support her family. She looks forward to the return of a steady source of income and is optimistic about their investment.

loans.use: To pay for repairs for a taxi cab

loans.name: Lystra 2021-6 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Loice A.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business. She is 35 years old and married to a builder. She has four children who all go to school. Each week, Loice makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profit. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Loice is joined in her group by Mary W., Viola A., Grace J., and Rose U.. Mary has a business making tea and wants to open a restaurant. Viola is currently operating a business selling beans at the market and wants a loan to expand her business. Grace operates a business of selling clothes and wants to expand the business. Rose is currently in the business of selling perfumes at the shop and is requesting a loan to expand her business as well.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Fatma's Yatakuwa Group

texts.en:
Fatma is 22 years old and married with two children, 4 and 8 years old. She became a bites (bread and cake) seller in 2007. Every day, she works from 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Fatma took another successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more bites for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mboni.

loans.use: To improve her business by buying more bread and cake (bites) to sell

loans.name: Time's Tusivunjane Moyo Group

texts.en:
Time is 28 years old and married with four children, ages 12, 10, 7, and 2 years old. She has been a firewood seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Time took another successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes to buy more firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Maua, Nasra, Asia, and Mwajine

loans.use: To buy more firewood to increase her inventory

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov T., 38, is a married mother of four living in Kandal, Cambodia. Her whole family works to earn a living: Nov earns about $5 U.S. dollars a day raising pigs and other animals at home, while her husband, Pal Ry, sells the vegetables he grows for roughly $7 a day. Finally, one of their daughters works in a garment factory for $70 a month.

To grow her business, Nov is requesting a loan of $1,200 U.S. dollars to purchase pigs to breed. This expansion to her business will ensure that her future is secure and can increase her income. With any money that is left over, the family would like to purchase some vegetable seeds for Pal's business and a water pump for the vegetable field. The field is currently poorly irrigated and a water pump would be very beneficial to his business. The family is optimistic about all the possibilities of this loan and looks forward to seeing the results of their investments.

loans.use: Purchase sows to breed pigs; buy seeds and a water pump for a small farm

loans.name: Hon

texts.en: Mr. Hon O. is 24 years old, and he is a firewood seller and pig breeder in Tang Tbeng Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  His wife, Mrs. Mao Sum, is a farmer who cultivates rice and vegetables.  On her plantation, she faces a problem because she does not have enough animals to plow her rice field.  Thus, her husband decided to ask for a loan which they will use, along with his savings, to buy an additional cow to help plow.  Mr. Hon O. has two children who are both too young to work or study.  Previously, Mr. Hon O. obtained a loan from AMK (Kiva’s Field Partner) to start breeding pigs, and he paid it back in full.

loans.use: To help purchase an additional cow to plow

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 39 years,She is a married woman with 2 children aged 18 and 12. She became a bites seller in 2008. Every day, she works from 6am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Farida has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business.Farida now hopes for a loan to buy and to makes more bites products for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Amina's Subira Huleta Kheri Group

texts.en:
Amina is a 36-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 3 and 16. She has been a charcoal seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 6:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $33 from her sales.

In the past, Amina has had two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She will use this loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatuma.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akoko A. was born in 1970 in Togo, a country that borders Benin. She's married to Mr. Jean SEMEK, a trained furniture maker. To help her husband with the family expenses, she sells staples and other products in a shop located near her home, so that her neighbors do not need to travel long distances to get these products. The daily revenue of her business amounts to $30 (12'000 XOF). To better meet customer demand, she wants to bolster her business, and to do so, she's seeking her second loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame A. Akoko est née vers 1970 au Togo, pays frontalier au Bénin. Elle est mariée à Monsieur SEME K Jean, menuisier de profession. Pour aider son mari dans les charges familiales, elle vend dans une boutique située non loin de son domicile, des produits vivriers et des produits de grande consommation avec un objectif de proximité pour ses voisins qui n'auront plus à faire de longue distance pour s'approvisionner. Pour donner entière satisfaction à sa clientèle qui lui permet de réaliser en moyenne un chiffre d'affaire journalier de 12000F CFA, elle désir renforcer son activité et vient solliciter pour la cause son deuxième crédit.

loans.use: To buy one sack of corn, 3 boxes of soap and 3 cans of peanut oil

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 39 years,She is a married woman with 2 children ages 18 and 12. She is a bites seller since in february 2008. Every day, she works from 6am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Farida has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business.Farida now hopes for a loan to buy and to makes more bites products for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Kosar Muhammd Saleem Group

texts.en:
Kosar Parveen is the wife of M. S.. She lives in Multan, Pakistan. Kosar baji owns a two room brick house. She is the mother of four children, two sons and two daughters.

Kosar baji has a business making and selling decorative embroidered scarves. Her daughters help her in this business. Kosar baji's husband sells vegetables. He has been in this profession for the last 5 years. Kosar baji has successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). With the profit from these two loans, she renovated the house and improved the family's financial condition. Now she is applying for a loan to expand her scarf-making business. She will use the loan to buy materials like cloth and colored thread.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine for her iron business. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy more material (rice, cooking oil, and lentils) for her grocery shop. Kanwal baji wants a loan to buy more spices to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Chom

texts.en: Mrs. Chom N. is a farmer in Tang Tbeng Village in Kampong Chhang Province.  Her husband, Mr. Hoeurn Huon, is a firewood seller and a cow breeder. His two businesses generate a small income, which he uses to support the family.  They have six children, three of whom are attending school while two others are staying home and looking after cows.  The remaining one is too young to work or study.  The cow breeding business is going well, and Mr. and Mrs. Huon want to expand it. Mrs. Chom N. is asking for a loan to buy calves for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To combine with her savings and use to buy calves for breeding

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 39 years,She is a married woman with 2 children ages 18 and 12. She has been a bites seller since in february 2008. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Farida has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business.Farida now hopes for a loan to buy and to makes more bites products for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 39 years,She is a married with 2 children ages 18 and 12. She has been a bites seller since in february 2008. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Farida has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business.Farida now hopes for a loan to buy and to makes more bites products for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Yong

texts.en:
Mrs. Yong P. is a 39-year-old farmer who also raises pigs and makes around $3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Torung Thoeun, is a motorcycle taxi driver who makes about $3 per day. They live with their five children in Chhouk Khsach Commune, Kampong Thom Province. One of their children is married, and one works in a garment factory in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. P. is now seeking a US$ 300 loan to purchase small pigs to raise. The remainder of the loan will be used to add to her saved cash to purchase an ox to use for plowing and such farming work. The loan will expand their business and increase their income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs to raise and to add to her saved cash to purchase an ox

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un C. is a 38-year-old mother of six living in the Siem Reap province in northern Cambodia. She and her husband, Sean Teung, make a living by selling a traditional Khmer noodle dish from a food stand. To grow her business, Un has applied for a loan of $850 to buy a noodle-making machine. She believes that the machine will be an investment and will help her reach more customers. She hopes to use the additional profit to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a noodle-making machine for a food stand

loans.name: Gezira 2015-7 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Elizerbeth P.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to expand the business. She is 35 years old and her husband is a businessman. She has two children, age two and six, who are both in school. Each week, Elizerbeth makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profit. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Elizerbeth is joined in her small group by Monika L., Rose P., Teresa W., and Jackline N.. Monika has a business selling clothes at the market and wants to open a shop.
