Rose is currently operating a business selling bread and wants a loan to expand her business. Teresa operates a business selling booklets at her book shop and wants to expand the shop. Jackline is currently in the business of selling charcoal brew and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Bahati's Tusonge Mbele Group

texts.en:
Bahati is 25 years old and married with two children -- one is two years old and the other is six months old. She has been a charcoal and ice cream seller since 2007. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $23 from her sales.

In the past, Bahati has had another successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She plans to buy more charcoal to sell for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Halima, Aziza, Asma, Mwanahamisi and Fatma, who also have businesses.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell in her business

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia baji is the wife of M. T. D.. She lives in Multan, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 5 years. She is the mother of one daughter and one son. Her daughter is 3 months old and her son is one year old. Shazia baji completed her education until the 10th standard grade. She runs a boutique independently. Her husband makes decorative scarves and sells them in the market. This is a very profitable business because Multan City is famous for its handmade items. Shazia baji successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (thread, needles) to help expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy material for her decorative embroidery business. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy more supplies (lentils, cooking oil) for her grocery shop. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Hussan Bano baji wants a loan to buy material for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Medehouekon Nazaire

texts.fr:
Born circa 1970 in Dangbo (Ouémé Department, Southern Benin), Mr. Medehouekon Nazaire L. is married and the father of three children, who are all living with their mother in the village. A trained mason, he started a while ago a business of retailing cement. He also makes bricks that he delivers to the reseller. Due to the price increase of cement, Mr. Medehouekon Nazaire L. experiences huge difficulties in getting supplies. At the same time, demand remains very high due to his geographic situation. In order to get out of this problematic situation, he's seeking a second loan to meet customer demand and also to strengthen his business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Né vers les années 1970 à Dangbo dans le département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin, Monsieur L. Medehouekon Nazaire est marié et père de trois enfants vivant tous avec leur mère au village. Maçon de profession, il s'est lancé depuis un moment dans la vente de ciment en détail et aussi dans la fabrication des bornes qu'il livre au revendeur. Suite à l'inflation du prix de ciment, monsieur L. Medehouekon Nazaire s'est retrouvé face à d'énormes difficultés pour s'approvisionner en ciment. Dans le même temps la demande est restée très forte en raison de sa situation géographique. Pour éviter de s'éterniser dans cette situation combien fâcheuse pour les clients, il vient solliciter son deuxième crédit afin de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle et aussi pour le renforcement de son activité.

loans.use: To buy 4.5 tons of cement

loans.name: Hadia's Tusonge Mbele Group

texts.en:
Hadia is 29 years old and married with two children ages 9 and 6. She also takes care of another person who is 82 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 2005. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. every day at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $23 from her sales.

In the past, Hadia successfully repaid another loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She will use this loan to buy more clothes for her business and will share this loan with her subgroup member Asha.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell in her business.

loans.name: Tasleem M.abid Khan Group

texts.en:
Tasleem baji is the wife of M. A. K.. She lives in Multan, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 15 years. Tasleem baji is the mother of four children, one son and three daughters. Her son is in the 6th standard grade. Her elder daughter is in the 7th standard grade. Her husband makes decoratively embroidered dresses. He has been in this profession for the last 5 years. Tasleem baji successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy embroidery material (thread, needles, and clothes) for her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sugran Mai baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy more fruit to resell. Shagufta baji wants a loan to buy oil for her power loom machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Hija's Shida Hula Maarifa Group

texts.en:
Hija is 25 years old and married with three children, ages three years, two years, and seven months. She also takes care of another child who is 10 years old. She has been a firewood seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 6:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Hija has successfully repaid one loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Fatma, Amina, Mwanakombo, and Jina.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her business

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida baji is the wife of G. A.. She lives in Multan, Pakistan. Rashida baji is a housewife and takes care of her children. She also makes clothing sheets and sells them in the market to earn good profit. She is the mother of one daughter and one son. Her husband makes cloth and sells cloth in a big market to earn a good profit. Their monthly earning is $131.22. Rashida baji is applying for a loan to buy material (cloth) to make clothing sheets.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shabnam baji wants a loan to buy more scrap for her scrap business. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy material (thread and needles) for her decorative embroidery business. Habibia baji wants a loan to buy new bicycles to resell. Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell in her neighboring area for burning in stoves, since gas is not available.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Aliye

texts.en:
Aliye M. is 25 years old and married with a three-year-old child. She has owned and run a small salon since 2007. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her business.

In the past, Aliye has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more stock for her salon business.

loans.use: To buy more items to improve her salon business.

loans.name: Slobodanka

texts.en:
Slobodanka is a woman from the town of Doboj in northern Bosnia and Herzegovina. She is married with one child. Her husband found a full-time job in Slovenia, while Slobodanka farms at home, mainly growing fruits and vegetables.

This is Slobodanka's first loan from ZŽene za ŽZene, which she has requested in the amount of 1500 KM (US$1150). She will use some of the money to buy pesticide to protect the fruits and vegetables she is currently growing. She will use the rest to buy more fruits and vegetables from a wholesaler. Slobodanka plans to resell this food in town and hopes that this income will help her meet expenses until the rest of her crops are ready to be harvested and sold.

loans.use: To by pesticide and more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jane Nanyonga's Group

texts.en:
Jane works six days a week in Kalerwe market outside Kampala, where she rents a space to sell second-hand clothes and shoes, a trade she has handled for over 9 years. She travels by taxi to buy the clothes from Owino Market, one of the biggest markets downtown. There is an available market for her merchandise, and she serves all kinds of people.

Her main challenge is the rainy season, which makes movement difficult and wets the ground onto which the shoes and clothes are spread for clients to view and buy. After being with MCDT for 10 years and repaying 12 loans, Jane boasts of improved standards of living and expanded business and income. She would like to put up a commercial building so that she can stop paying rent and instead collect income from tenants.

Jane is the leader of a 5-member group. She is 56 years old and married with 9 children. They are aged between 34 and 10 years. Three of them are in school. She is also looking after 2 children for her deceased siblings. Jane rents a three-roomed house in which she lives with 4 people. There is piped water and electricity. She resides and works in a semi-urban and slum area in the outskirts of Kampala.

loans.use: To invest more in her business

loans.name: Chon

texts.en:
Mrs. Chon C. is a farmer who lives in Baray Commune, Kampong Thom Province. Mrs. C. earns approximately US$ 2 per day growing rice and her husband earns about US$ 1.40 per day as a construction worker. They both work hard every day to earn income to cover the family's expenses, and they live with two children, both of whom are young.

Because of desiring to expand her farming business, Mrs. C. is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase farmland for growing rice. The loan will help to improve their income and living conditions. The picture shows Mrs. C. and her husband.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Wahida's Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.en:
Wahida J. M. is 41 years old and divorced with two children aged 16 and 11. She also takes care of a 75-year-old person. She became a computer teacher in 1997. Every day, she works from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50.

In the past, Wahida has successfully repaid one loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan in order to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatma J..

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Lidija

texts.en:
Lidija is a young woman from the village of Tekucici, near the town of Doboj in northern Bosnia and Herzegovina. She is married and her husband is a military officer. Lidija opened a small hair salon a few months ago and is very busy with it now.

Lidija is asking for this loan because she needs to buy more supplies and equipment for her salon. It is her goal to help build up her business by attracting more customers and offering more types of services to her current clients.

loans.use: To buy more beauty supplies and inventory

loans.name: Amina's Tuwe Na Umoja Group

texts.en:
Amina K. is 42 years old and married with five children between the ages of 22 and 30. She has been selling bread and beans since 1983. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Amina has had one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more bread and beans for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Rukia S., Salama J., Farida S., and Safia J..

loans.use: To buy more bread and beans for her business

loans.name: Wisdom 2015-8 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Amuna M.. She is currently in the business of selling tea. She is 30 years old and married to a businessman. She has two children, age 10 and 16, who are both in school. Each week, Amuna makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profit. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more sugar to sell.

Amuna is joined in her small group by Mary A., Madellina K., Regina M., and Anna P.. Mary has a business selling bread and wants to construct a house. Madellina is currently operating a business selling charcoal at the market and wants a loan to buy more charcoal to sell. Rejina operates a business selling beer at the bar and wants to start a poultry business. Anna is currently in the business of selling local brew and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar to sell.

loans.name: Izveta

texts.en:
Izveta is a young woman from the town of Tesanj in northern Bosnia and Herzegovina. She is not married and currently lives with her parents. Izveta has been looking for a job but, as in many places in Bosnia, unemployment rates are high in her town. Her grandmother has been sharing part of her pension with Izveta in order to help her get by for now.

While she keeps looking for a permanent job, Izveta wants to start selling cosmetics. She will use this loan to order an inventory of cosmetics from a wholesaler, and she will go on to sell the items to friends and around town. Izveta hopes from this business she can start earning and saving her own money.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Salama's Riziki Popote Group

texts.en:
Salama is 25 years,She is a married woman with 3 children aged 6, 4 and 1. Also take care of 1 other person aged 40 years old. She own a small shop since in february 2008. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Salama has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business.Salama now hopes for a loan to buy more rice, flour, beans, and soap for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwajuma and Fadhila.

loans.use: To buy more food items and soap to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira A. is 25 years old and married with a two-year-old child. She has been a bread seller since 2006 and works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. She can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Subira has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more bread for her business.

loans.use: To improve her business by buying more bread to sell

loans.name: New Canada 2013-9 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Susan M.. She is currently in the business of selling bread. She is 30 years old and married to a peasant. She has two children who are both in school. Each week, Susan makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits. With the extra capital from her loan she hopes to be able to buy flour for home consumption.

Susan is joined in her group by Lucia K., Agnes Y., Sunday S., and Siama J.. Lucia has a business selling local brew and wants to construct a house. Agnes is currently operating a business selling fried chicken at the hotel in the market and wants a loan to expand the hotel. Sunday operates a business selling green vegetables and fried fish at the hotel and wants to open up a photo studio. Siama is currently in the business of selling clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Amela

texts.en:
Amela is from the town of Tesanj in northern Bosnia and Herzegovina. She is married and her husband works a full time job. Amela has started her own business in which she buys bedroom furnishings (including embroidered pillowcases, sheets, linens, and bedspreads) to then resell in and around her town. She is able to make about 400KM (US$305) a month through her sales.

With this 1200 KM (US$925) loan from Zene za Zene, Amela plans to order more inventory for her business. She hopes that she can buy some different types of linens this time, to have some more variety to offer her customers. She also hopes to earn more money by increasing the amount of items she sells monthly.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom H. is a villager in Chhouk Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetable. On the plantation, Mrs. Mom H. has to hire an outside laborer with a cow to plow her rice field. Mrs. Mom H. decided to request a loan to purchase two cows so that she plow the rice field herself and save  money by doing so. Her husband, Mr. Son Sam, owns a kiln where he produces coal to resell. Mrs. Mom H. is 45 years old and the mother of five children. Two children  are employed in a garment factory, two are attending school and  help with the housework and the youngest child is too young to work or enroll in school. Mrs. Mom H. had previously obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cart to transport the fertilizer to support the field.

loans.use: To purchase two cows to plow the rice field.

loans.name: Salama's Riziki Popote Group

texts.en:
Salama M. is 25 years old and married with three children aged six, four, and one. She also takes care of another person who is 40 years old. She has owned and run a small shop since February 2008. Every day, she works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Salama has successfully repaid one loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more rice, flour, beans, and soap for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwajuma N. and Fadhila A..

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her inventory

loans.name: Fadila

texts.en:
Fadila is a 38-year-old woman from the town of Tesanj in northern Bosnia and Herzegovina. She is married and her husband works full time. Fadila has started a tailoring business, which she reports is going very well. She alters clothes and makes new outfits as well, and has found herself very busy this summer with requests for all kinds of services.

Fadila is asking for her first loan from ZŽene za ZŽene in the amount of 650KM (US$500) to buy more materials for sewing, including different kinds of cloth she can use for making new clothing. She wants to make more dresses and suits to sell and believes that this will be the best way to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring supplies

loans.name: Sirojiddin

texts.ru:
Sirojiddin H. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 34 years old, is married, and has four children. For the past eight years, he has worked in the service industry. He has a car wash. He plans to take out a loan to buy hoses and vacuum cleaners. This is necessary to improve the quality this service. He plans to pay off the loan in 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Хайдаров Сироджиддин житель города Яван .Возраст 34 года , женат и имеет четверых детей. Уже восемь лет как он работает в сфере услуг. Имеет мойку . Планирует получить кредит для приобретения шлангов , пылесосов. Это необходима для улучшения качества обслуживания. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchasing necessary supplies

loans.name: Sampuli's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Sampuli F. is 35 years old and married with four children between the ages of 4 and 13. She has been a clothes seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 6:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

In the past, Sampuli has successfully repaid two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Asma O..

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell in her business

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.ru:
Faizullo H. lives in the city of Yavan. He works in sales. He has a shop in the Mekhrgon market in Yavan. He sells clothes for men. Now rent for his shop is due, and for that he needs 1,200 US dollars. He has decided not to take the money out of his business, but to take out a loan to help pay the rent. He plans to pay off the loan within 6 months. Faizullo is 29 years old, is married, and has three children.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Хасанов Файзулло проживает вгороде Яван. Занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке «Мехргон» города Яван. Торгует одеждой для мужчин. Сечас пришло время оплатить аренду торговой точки , но для этого нужно 1200 долл. США. Поэтому он решил не изымать деньги из оборота , а получить кредт , который поможет ему оплатить аренду. Погасить кредит он планирует в течение 6 месяцев. Файзулло 29 лет, он женат и имеет троих детей.

loans.use: Pay rent

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en:
Amna baji is the wife of M. A. and lives in Multan, Pakistan.

She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 4 years. She is the mother of seven children, five sons and two daughters. Amna baji is a housewife. She takes care of her children and sews clothes for her neighbors. None of her children go to school. Her husband has had a thread-making business for the last 10 years. Amna baji is applying for a loan for her husband. He wants to buy a thread-making machine, which will allow him to increase his stock with less effort.

Amna is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Tasleem baji wants a loan to buy more flour for her bread business. Razia baji wants a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Roukiyatou Alakè Row

texts.fr:
Born on May 18, 1983 in Cotonou (Littoral Department, Southern Benin), Mrs. Roukiyatou Alakè Rowoshola M. is married and the mother of one child. She's a reseller of electrical sundries and woodworking tools. She gets her supplies from department stores in Cotonou. Currently, she's experiencing difficulties in getting her supplies due to lack of financial means. For this reason, she's seeking her first loan of $350.00 (150000.00 XOF) to buy stock and meet customer demand. She also intends to expand her area of business to other types of products such as home appliances.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 18 Mai 1983 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au Sud du Bénin, dame M. Roukiyatou Alakè Rowoshola est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est une revendeuse des matériaux d'électricité et de menuiserie. Elle s'approvisionne dans les grands magasins de Cotonou. Actuellement, elle éprouve quelques difficultés d'approvisionnement faute de moyens financiers. Pour cette raison elle sollicite pour son premier crédit une somme de 150 000 francs afin de s'approvisionner, de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et aussi d'élargir le champ de son activité à d'autres types de produits tels que des appareils électroménagers.

loans.use:
To buy 
Achat d'équipements de menuiserie et d'électricité.

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru:
Nuriddin G. lives in the city of Yavan. He is married and has five children. He has been working in animal husbandry for two years. He buys young calves, fattens them up, and resells them at the market. This business produces an income, but additional financing is necessary to develop the business further. Therefore, he has decided to take out a loan for 12 months. Once he receives the loan, he can buy two more young calves for fattening and sell them in autumn.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Гафуров Нуриддин житель города Яван. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Уже два года занимается животноводством. Скупает молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает на базаре.Бизнес дает доход , но для того , чтобы развивать бизнес ему необходимо дополнительное финансирование . Поэтому он решил получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Получив кредит он сможет купить еще двух молодых телят для откормки и к осени их продать.

loans.use: Purchasing livestock

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil was born in 1947. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan and is settled in the town of Khirdalan. This man is married, with 4 children. Kamil has been selling produce for 11 years. Now he needs a loan of $875 to buy vegetables and fruits to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Bunavsha

texts.ru:
Bunavsha K. lives in Shahrinav. She is 37 years of age, married, and has four children. She works as a nurse in a district clinic. In addition, she works in agriculture. She sows various types of vegetables and sells the crop in the market to wholesalers. She wants to take out a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is scheduled to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Кахорова Бунавша проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 37 лет , замужем и имеет четверых детей. Работает медсестрой в районной поликлинике. Дополнительно занимается земледелием. Сеет различного вида овощи,получаемый урожай продает на рынке , сдавая оптовикам. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить семена и удобрения. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Buying seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tanveer M. Anwar's Group

texts.en:
Tanveer baji is divorced from Mr. M. A.. She has been living in a city named Multan, Pakistan, for the last 5 years. She is the mother of three sons. Her elder son works in a factory. The next eldest is in the 7th standard grade. Her younger son is in the 6th standard grade. Tanveer baji has a cloth-selling business. She chose this profession because there is strong demand for her cloth in the market. She collects good profits from this business. She successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more cloth to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy more milk for her milk business. Another group member named Parveen baji wants a loan to buy animals for her meat business. Shameem baji wants a loan to buy spicy nimko to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Umarali

texts.ru:
Umarali B. lives in the Shahrinav region of Tajikistan. He is a translator by trade but because it is difficult to find a job, for the part fifteen years he has been engaged in agriculture. For sowing wheat in the fall, he plans to obtain a loan that would allow him to purchase seeds and fertilizers. He would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Бобохонов Умарали проживает в районе Шахринау. Учился на переводчика английского языка , но в связи с тем, что на данный момент найти работу очень сложно он занимается земледелием. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 15 лет. Для посева пшеницы к осеннему сезону, планирует получить кредит и закупить семена и удобрения. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr:
Born circa 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Mrs. Louise K. is married to Mr. Barthélémy HOUSSOU and the mother of three children she has to support. She's a trained seamstress and has a sewing workshop in which she sells sewing sundries. Mrs. K. specializes in sewing women's clothing. She's very well regarded by her customers and she faces an increasing demand that she has problems meeting. To safeguard the trust reposed in her by her customers and to meet their demands, she's seeking this loan of $250.00 (100000.00 XOF) to increase her stock of sewing sundries.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1973 à Cotonou dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame K. Louise est mariée à monsieur HOUSSOU Barthélémy et mère de 3 enfants tous à charge. Elle est Couturière de profession disposant d'un salon de couture dans lequel elle vend des articles de mercerie. Dame K. Louise est spécialisée dans la confection des tenues dames. Très appréciée par sa clientèle, elle reçoit de plus en plus une forte demande ce qui justifie les difficultés qu'elle éprouve actuellement à satisfaire sa clientèle. Dans le but de préserver la confiance que sa clientèle a placé en elle et de satisfaire à leur demande, elle sollicite ce prêt de 100 000 francs qui va aussi l'aider à augmenter son stock de produits de mercerie.

loans.use: To buy 2 rolls of fabric, 10 small rolls of trim and 3 boxes of sewing thread

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alidé - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru:
Rajabali B. lives in the Shahrinav region of Tajikistan. He lives with his family. Rajabali has four children. He works as a cab driver and is engaged in agriculture. He grows vegetables. Since the time of the second crop is approaching, he needs to prepare soil. Due to the increase of prices for fertilizers, seeds and tractor rent, Rajabali needs additional money. Therefore he would like to get a loan for a period of 12 months. This would help him sow the crop in time and grow a quality crop.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Бобохонов Раджабали проживает в районе Шахринау. Живет со своей семьей. Имеет четверых детей. Работает таксистом. Кроме того занимается земледелием. Сажает различного вида овощи. Наступает время повторгного посева и для этого ему необходимо подготовить почву. В связи с подоражанием цен на удобрения . семена и аренду трактора ему необходимы дополнительные средства . Поэтому Раджабали планирует получить кредит, сроком на 12 месяцев. Это поможет ему своевременно засеить землю и получить качественный урожай.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kikelomo

texts.en: Kikelomo M. is 48 years old, is married, and has six children. Kikelomo sells kerosene and has been in business for over twenty years. She learned this business from her mother and she started her own business when she got married. She started by selling door-to-door around her community until the business grew to what it is now. She has lots of customers. She needs a loan of $700 to buy more kerosene to sell.

loans.use: Purchase of more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Haleema Abdul Razaaq Group

texts.en:
Haleema baji is the wife of Mr. A. R.. She lives in an area of Multan called Shah Rukn-e-Alam. It is famous for its beautiful handmade things. Haleema baji has been living in this area for the last 25 years. She has one son. Her husband is a street-side medic. Her son is a medical rep in a clinic. She is a housewife and prefers to do household works. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now, she is applying for a loan for her son who wants to buy medicines to start his own medical shop.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rashida baji wants a loan to buy more cloth to resell. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies for her electric shop. Nazia baji wants a loan to buy milk for her milk-selling business. Saddaqat Begum baji wants a loan to buy cloth for her cloth business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy medicines for medical store

loans.name: Mais

texts.en: Mais is married, with 3 children. He was born in 1977. Mais is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Beylagan region, Gahramanli village.  He has now settled in the Absheron region, Masazir village. Mais has transported  loads for  5 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts for his track.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his track

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji is the wife of T. H.. She has been living in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Multan City is famous for its sweets and shoes.

Sugran baji's husband runs a grocery shop. She helps him in this business. She has no children. Her husband chose this profession because there is no other grocery shop in the colony. She collects good profits from this business. She successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to diversify the goods she sells in her grocery shop by adding more goods such as lentils, cooking oil and rice.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rani baji wants a loan to buy more clothes for her cloth business. Anwari baji wants a loan to buy more garments for her garment business. Sultana baji wants a loan to buy spices for her nimko business. Saira baji wants a loan to buy more clothes for her cloth business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Saeeda's Group

texts.en:
Saeeda bibi is the wife of M. A.. She has been living in Multan, Pakistan for the last one and a half years. Her husband makes and sells furniture. She is a housewife, but she sews clothes for her neighbors. Saeeda bibi collects good profits from this business. She has a son who is just 8 months old. Her husband's furniture business is also a profitable business. She successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy wood to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nighat Seema baji wants a loan to buy more fruits to resell. Yasmeen baji wants a loan for her husband who makes and sells handmade items. She will use the loan to buy a molding machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Marame

texts.fr:
Marame M. is a young unmarried woman born in 1979. She works in a non-governmental organization in Thiès. In parallel with this job, she also raises poultry. Her business consists of buying chicks, which she raises over several weeks before re-selling them to her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Marame M. est une jeune célibataire née en 1979.elle travaille dans une organisation non gouvernementale à THIES ;parallèlement elle fait de l'aviculture .son activité consiste à acheter des poussins qu'elle élève pendant quelques semaines avant de les revendre à ses clients.

loans.use: To raise poultry

loans.name: Ahliman

texts.en: Ahliman was born in 1955. He is married with 2 children, one of whom is in the picture. Ahliman is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory in the Kalbadjar region of Azerbaijan. He settled in the town of Khirdalan. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy the necessary things for improving his café and to provide clients with good service.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things for improving his cafe and service

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en:
Adesuwa I. is lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 37 years old and is married with 5 children. She runs a clothing business. She has been in this business since 2004. She learned this business from her mother. 

Adesuwa needs the loan for $775 to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sreylot's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreylot K. (shown in picture on the left, with her group member) was selected by her co-members to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima (Kiva’s Field Partner). In the group there are two families including hers. All the group members live on an island in the MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. Sreylot K. (age 27) and her husband, Mr. Chansokha Sam, 28, were married in 2002 and have one son. Sreylot has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old, employing a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband has been a silk weaver for ten years as well. Now Sreylot is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to purchase silk material for weaving.

2-Mrs. Sokkhen K. (age 29) and her husband, Mr. Thol Pho, 32, were married in 2001 and have one daughter. Sokkhen has been a silk weaver for eleven years, also using a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband has been a silk weaver for ten years as well. Now Sokkhen is requesting a loan in the amount of $250 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Pheakny

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheakny C., 28, and her husband, Mr. Sokkea Leng, 27, live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2005 and have one daughter.

Mrs. Pheakny has been a silk weaver for over ten years. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a security guard for a company in Phnom Penh for four years. He does not have a vehicle for traveling to work so he wants to buy a motorbike for commuting.

Pheakny is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase silk materials for weaving and to buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and buy a motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Miss Sophea, 26, is single and lives with her widowed mother on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has two sisters.

Sophea has been a hairdresser for one year, a skill she learned in Phnom Penh City. After finishing her skill training early last year, she rented a shop to operate a beauty service in a suburb of Phnom Penh. Currently her business is doing very well, so she needs to buy her own shop but lacks the money. Therefore Sophea is requesting a loan of $800 to add to her own money to buy a beauty shop for her business.

loans.use: To buy a beauty shop.

loans.name: Ndeye Fatma

texts.fr:
Ndeye Fatma D. was born in 1971 and is mother to three children. She lives in the Cité Lamy neighborhood of Thies and that is where she conducts her business activities. She stocks up in Mauritania and sells her goods to neighbors in order to provide for her needs.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

ndeye fatma D. est une femme née en 1971 et mère de trois enfants .son domicile se trouve au quartier cité lamy de THIES et elle y mène des activités commerciales .elle fait ses approvisionnements en MAURITANIE et revend ses marchandises au détail à ses voisins dans le but subvenir à ses besoins.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Mr. Thea L., 40, and his second wife, Mrs. Sim Srey, 44, were married in 1996. He has one son with his first wife, and Mrs. Sim has one daughter with her first husband. Both of their children are married and live outside the family home. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb with three of their grandchildren.

Mr. Thea has been a worker in a warehouse in Phnom Penh for three years. His wife has been a cleaner for a company for four years. Now Thea wants to buy a motorbike to drive a motor taxi when he finishes work, but lacks the money to do so. Thus, he is requesting a loan of US$600 to buy a motorcycle he can drive as a motor taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for driving as a motor taxi

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 30 years old. She is married with four children aged between 1 and 14.

Mwajuma began selling clothes in 2004. She works daily from 6AM to 4PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 (US Dollars) in sales.

Mwajuma has successfully taken out two previous loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She hopes for a new loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Naren

texts.en:
Mrs. Naren S., 36, and her husband Mr. Sovan Tuy, 38, live in a small village off of National Road Two about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 2004 and have no children.

Mrs. Naren has been selling dessert for twelve years. She cooks many types of dessert to sell at Olympic Market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has full-time employment in Phnom Penh as well. The couple wants to buy a motorbike to drive to work and sell dessert. Naren is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr:
Lamine L. is a young man, born in 1968 in Thies, Senegal. He is married and he runs a shop that he opened with the help of one of his brothers in Italy. He is requesting this loan with the goal of increasing his stock of commodities.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

lamine L. est un jeune homme né en 1968 à THIES .IL est marié et gère une boutique qu'il a ouverte avec l'aide d'un de ses frères qui est en ITALIE .C'est dans le but de renforcer son stock de marchandises qu'il sollicite ce pret.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Vurgun

texts.en: Vurgun is married, with 3 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory in the Kalbadjar region of Azerbaijan. He is now settled in the town of Khirdalan. Vurgun uses an excavator to dig ground for house foundations.  He has been in this business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Thouk K., 54, is a widow with two daughters. One of her daughters is married and lives outside the family home, and the other one is a garment factory worker. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Thouk is a cook for workers in a construction company that operates near her village. Her daughter doesn't have a vehicle to get to work in Phnom Penh. Therefore Thouk is requesting a loan of US$300 to add to her own money and use to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To help buy a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia S. is twenty-eight years old and is married with two children. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. Lydia is very skillful and talented hairdresser. Lydia also has four apprentices who help her. 

She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, so she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products to serve her customers.  

She is a member of the Progress Trust community group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide support to one another to repay the loans. Lydia appears in the photo with her apprentices. She is holding one of her children.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products

loans.name: Warda's Jitahidini Group

texts.en:
Warda is 23 years old. She is a married and sells ladies' clothes for a living. She works daily from 6AM to 4PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $23 (US Dollars) in sales.

Warda has successfully taken out one previously loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She hopes for a new loan to buy more ladies' clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members: Fatma, Mwanayam, Khadija, Patima, and Maryam.

loans.use: To buy more ladies' clothes for her business.

loans.name: Salorn

texts.en:
Mr. Salorn C. (not in the picture), 57, and his wife, Mrs. Kimhak Un (shown in the picture with their child and grandchild) were married in 1979 and have seven children: one son and six daughters. Three of their daughters are married and live outside the family home. Another two daughters are garment factory workers, and their only son is a mason. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Salorn has been a school principal for five years. He has been teaching after the Pol Pot regime. His wife does house work and takes care of children. He lacks the money to buy a machine for cutting tiles, needed for his son’s construction work. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase construction materials for his son.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his son.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia A. is 48 years old. She is a wife and the mother of seven children, six of whom are stepchildren, and all of whom are currently in school. 

Patricia has been selling rice and soft drinks at a bus stop in Obuasi, Ghana for the past seven years. She has been very resourceful and support her husband in taking care of the family. She believes in hard work.

Patricia wants to use the loan to buy more rice and soft drinks to serve her customers and to earn her more income. She is a member of the "Nyame na aye" trust group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mr. Ly H., 46, and his wife, Mrs. Rohimas Meo, 40, live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. The children all study in a local school.

Mr. Ly and his wife have been fishing since they were young. They fish from the Mekong River and sell at the village market. Currently their fishing net is broken, and they need to buy a new one to replace it. So, Ly is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase fishing nets to continue his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Mame Penda

texts.fr:
Mame Penda T. was born in 1970. She is married and lives in the Grand Thies neighborhood in Senegal. She has been in business for over five years. She sells cloths, fabrics for women's clothes and cosmetic goods that she buys in Mauritania and the Ivory Coast. She is requesting this loan with the goal of increasing her profit margin.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

mame penda T. est une femme mariée née en 1970 et vit au quartier grand thies .elle fait du commerce depuis plus de cinq ans .elle vend des draps ;des tissus pour femme et des produits cosmétiques qu'elle achète en MAURITANIE ou en COTE D'IVOIRE . c'est dans le but d'augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire qu'elle sollicite ce pret.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is 31 years old and a married mother of three children. Her children are currently in school. Yaa sells frozen foods in the local market to support her family.  She says that demand for fish is high, but she does not have the capital required to meet such demands. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more frozen foods. This will enable her to earn enough income to support her children's education. She is a member of the group called Partners. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc

loans.name: Mgeni's Harakati Group

texts.en:
Mgeni is 33 years old. She is married with six children aged between 7 and 19. She has owned and run a small food vendor store since 2001. She works at her business each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 (US Dollars) in sales.

Mgeni hopes for a loan to buy more food items (such as rice, maize flour, beans, vegetables, and bananas) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members: Mwanabaraka, Fatma, Patima, and Hafsa.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa S. trades in yams in the community market of Obuasi in Ghana. She treks to farming communities to buy yams from the farmers and sells them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more yams to serve her customers. 

She dreams of expanding her business to include additional items, like plantains and cassava, to meet the needs of her customers and increase her income. 

Yaa is married with eight children and is a member of the community group called "Aseda wura". Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide peer support to repay the loans on time.

loans.use: To buy yams, cassava and plantain to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama K. is 38 years old and a married woman with four children. All of her children are currently in school. 

Ama treks to the farming communities to purchase her products and then sells them in the town market. She says that the price of commodities is on the rise and, therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy more yams and rice to avoid price hikes and frequent travels. She hopes to increase her savings to support her husband and pay her children's school fees. 

She is a member of the group called "Aseda wura." Members agree to guarantee for one other as social collateral and assist each other to repay their loans. Ama appears in the photo with two of her kids.

loans.use: To buy more yams and rice.

loans.name: Hanka

texts.en:
Hanka is a 48-year-old woman from the town of Tesanj in northern Bosnia and Herzegovina. She is married and her husband is currently employed. Hanka works as a tailor, repairing and altering clothes and also making new clothes that she sells to neighbors and around town. She has been in business for a while now, working mostly from home, and in a good month can earn up to 700 KM (US$550) for her work.

It is Hanka's plan to take this 1500 KM (US$1150) loan from Zene za Zene to buy material and other tailoring supplies for her business. Hanka wants to experiment with buying some new types of cloth and thread that she can use to make outfits, and she hopes these will be received well by her customers.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring supplies

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi A. is 50 years old. She is married with three children who are currently in school. She works very hard her passion is providing a brighter future with opportunities for her children. At the moment, two of children are in junior high school and the other is in primary school. 

She has been selling yams for nine years. She buys her yams from a town called Atebubu, which is 134 kilometers away, and resells them to her customers for a profit. She wants to use the loan to buy more yams wholesale to store and then sell them later in small lots to avoid price hikes that result from the current food crisis in the country. 

She belongs to the "Aseda wura" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more yams

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr:
Mama D. is a young married woman, born in 1982 and mother of twins. She trades in a wide variety of products. She started her business activities by selling seafood, but at the same time she also sells fabrics and cosmetic goods.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

mama D. est une jeune femme mariée née en 1982 et mère de deux jumelles .elle fait du commerce de produits diversifiés:elle a commencé ses activités commerciales par la vente de fruits de mer ;parallèlement elle vend des tissus et des produits cosmétiques.

loans.use: For a small retail business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. N. is 40 years old. She is married with four children who are currently in school. She sells babies clothes, pampers, powder, napkins, detergents, feeding bottles, and plastic chairs in the local market. She wants to use the loan to buy more baby items in order to earn more income to provide her children with good education. 

She is a member of the Jesus and Mary Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of baby clothes, napkins, pampers, baby oil, and detergents.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael Kechegwa is a married Tanzanian man with two children. His residence is in Buguruni in Dar-es-Salaam. He runs a cosmetics shop at Gongo la Mboto  He sells a variety of cosmetics-shop items to customers. He purchases his inventory from the wholesellers in the Kariakoo shopping center. His family's daily demands depend on his business. His business plan is to run a wholesale shop. He is requesting a loan to expand his business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Jasminka

texts.en:
Jasminka is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Tesanj in northern Bosnia and Herzegovina. She is married and has a full-time job selling clothes. She currently buys new clothes from a wholesaler and sells them from her home. Even though she doesn't have a store, Jasminka has not been kept from getting far with her business. In fact, the lack of a store has helped keep her cost of doing business low. Jasminka now has many loyal customers from her town, and when sales have been good, she has earned up to 1500 KM (US$1130) a month.

Jasminka is requesting her first loan from Zene za Zene in the amount of 1000 KM (US$775). She would like to buy a large order of clothes that she can sell for the fall and early winter, and she thinks it will be a good idea to stock up on these items now.

loans.use: To buy more clothing inventory

loans.name: Haitham's Harakati Group

texts.en:
Haitham is married with four children, aged 3, 5, 9, and 13. She has owned and run a school since 2004. She works at her business each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 (US Dollars) in sales.

Haitham hopes for a loan to buy more school items to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Zalhata, Sada, and Rabia who also have businesses.

loans.use: To buy more school items for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanaham....30 yea..old. She ..married with two children, ag..3 and 5. She h..been a soap and oil seller since 2007. She wor..at her busin.. each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 (..Dollars) in sales.

Mwanaham..hop..for a loan to buy more soap and oil for her busin...

loans.use: To buy more soap and oil for her business

loans.name: Maryam's Yarabi Tupe Salama(Delete This Business) Group

texts.en:
Maryam is 38 years,She is a married woman with 3 children aged 15, 7 and 3. She is a charcoal furniture and clothes seller since in 2005. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Maryam now hopes for a loan to buy morecharcoal and clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Hassanati and Arafa.

loans.use: To increase her inventory by buying more products.

loans.name: Bimkubwa's Aman Na Ushirikiano Group

texts.en:
Bimkubwa is 31 years old. She is a married with two children, ages 7 and 10. She has been a bites (chapati) seller since 2003. She works at her business each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 (US Dollars) in sales.

Bimkubwa hopes for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Asha.

loans.use: To expand her business by making more bites.

loans.name: Sabra's Kinamama (Delete This Business) Group

texts.en:
Sabra 29 years,She is a married woman with 5 children ages between 6 and 13. She own a small food vendor store. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Sabra now hopes for a loan to buy more food items like rice, maize flour and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Adila.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her  business.

loans.name: Sabra's Kinamama Group

texts.en:
Sabra is 29 years old. She is married with five children aged between 6 and 13. She owns and runs a small food vendor store. She works at her business each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 (US Dollars) in sales.

Sabra hopes for a loan to buy more rice, maize flour, and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Adila.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is 35 years old. She is married with two children aged 10 and 16. She has owned a small food vendor store since 2005. She works at her business each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 (US Dollars) in sales.

Hidaya hopes for a loan to buy more rice, maize flour, beans, and bananas for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: El Hadj Abdou Aziz

texts.fr:
Mr. Abdou Aziz G. is single with no children. He has worked as a tailor for over five years and specializes in making women's clothes. He has been a member of the Fund for more than four years and has always managed to pay back his loans. His goal in requesting this new loan is to purchase a small shop in the market.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

mr abdou aziz G. est un célibataire sans enfants .il est tailleur depuis plus de 05 ans et sa spécialité est la confection d'habits pour femme .il est membre de la caisse depuis plus de 4 ans et a toujours remboursé ses prets avec succés. c'est dans l'objectif d'acquérir une cantine au marché qu'il demande ce nouveau pret.

loans.use: To purchase a small shop in the market

loans.name: Apirial 2031-10 Group

texts.en:
Tamara M. is the group leader of this small group. She is currently in the business of selling local brew and is requesting a loan to buy a generator for home use. Tamara is 45 years old and is married to a farmer. She has three children in school ranging in age from nine to twenty one years old. Each week Tamara makes approximately 70 Sudanese pounds in profits from her business.

Tamara is joined in her small group by Annani A., Lucia A., Mamal D., and Jenty S.. Annani A. sells tea and bread in a restaurant and wants to increase her stock. Lucia A. currently sells soap and rings at the market and wants a loan to expand her business. Mamal D. sells fried eggs, meat, beans, fresh fish and other items at a hotel. She, too, wants to expand her business. Jenty S. sells charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy a generator for home use and expand retail inventory

loans.name: Celestina Juana

texts.es:
Celestina is a member of Confianza Communal Bank.

Celestina lives with her boyfriend, she is 27 years old and mother of 3 children, Celestina has a stand in the market Vivanco which is located in the center of the city of Ayacucho, where sells chickens, eggs, and other products. Celestina obtains the product from business that stop by her stand. Celestina has been doing this for about two years. Celestina works every day of the week from the 7 in the morning to 3 in the afternoon.

Celestina needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchasing more eggs and chickens.

Celestina’s dreams are to have a bigger business, with various stands, and to proviD. her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by AntonelL. Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Celestina es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza.

Celestina es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 3 hijos, Celestina tiene un puesto en el mercado Vivanco que se ubica en el centro D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, en donD. venD. pollo, embutidos y huevos, los cuales son adquiridos D. empresas que le traen a su puesto, actividad que realiza hace dos años, Celestina venD. todos los días D. L. semana desD. las 7 D. L. mañana hasta las 3 D. L. tarD..

Celestina necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. embutidos, huevo y pollo.

Los sueños D. Celestina son tener un negocio mas amplio, con sucursales y que sus hijos estudien en colegios particulares.

loans.use: Celestina needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchasing more  eggs and chickens

loans.name: Serigne Touba

texts.fr:
Mr. D. is a young married man, born in 1983 in Treichville. He has worked as a shoemaker for over five years and has a workshop in the market at Grand Thies. He is requesting this loan to increase his stock of raw materials in order to complete his orders on time and top up his income.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

mr D. est un jeune marié né en 1983 à TREICHVILLE .il fait de la coordonnerie depuis plus de cinq ans et son atelier se trouve au marché grand thies .il demande ce pret pour augmenter son stock de matières premières afin de terminer ses commandes à temps et d'améliorer ses revenus.

loans.use: To make shoes and sell shoemaking materials

loans.name: Elizabeth Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana is a member of Confianza Communal Bank.

Roxana lives with her boyfriend, she is 27 years old and mother of 2 children, Roxana lives in the traditional neighborhood of Santa Ana next to her parents. Roxana has a stand in the central market of the city of Huanta which is one hour from the city of Ayacucho where sells groceries to wholesalers and regular customers. Roxana has an employee who takes cares of the customers. Roxana travels every Saturday to make sure the business is running well. In addition, Roxana sells cheese at the market 12 of April, she buys the cheese in the fairs of Putaja. Roxana has a future business project in mind; she would like to offer Internet services in small booths.

Roxana needs a loan of 2000 soles, money that will be invested in purchasing computers.

Roxana dreams of improving her business, buying a home and save up for her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Roxana Es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza.

Roxana es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Roxana vive en el barrio tradicional de Santa Ana junto a sus padres, Roxana tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad de Huanta que se ubica a 1 hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende abarrotes al por mayor y menor, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de una empleada que se encarga de la atención al publico y Roxana viaja todo los días sábados a controlar las ventas de la semana. Además Roxana vende quesos que compra en las ferias de Putaja, actividad que realiza en el mercado 12 de abril. Roxana tiene proyectado implementar cabinas de Internet.

Roxana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de computadoras.

Roxana sueña con incrementar sus negocios, tener casa propia y ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Roxana needs a loan of 2000 soles, money that will be invested in purchasing computers

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is a member of Confianza Communal Bank .

Glory is married, she is 42 years old and mother of 2 children. Gloria works as a technical nurse at the health center of the city of Pampa Cangallo. In addition, Gloria has a small store at her in-laws’ house, where she sells groceries and medicines. Gloria counts with the help of her mother-in-law, especially when she travels to the city of Ayacucho where her children go to school.

Gloria needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested to purchase medicines.

Gloria’s dreams are to have a store in the city of Ayacucho, to improve her house and that help her children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by AntonelL. Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza.

Gloria es casada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Gloria trabaja en el centro D. salud D. L. ciudad D. Pampa Cangallo como técnica en enfermería, además Gloria tiene una tienda en L. casa D. sus suegros en donD. venD. abarrotes en general y medicinas, para lo cual cuenta con L. ayuda D. su suegra en especial cuando viaja a L. ciudad D. Ayacucho donD. están sus hijos porque estudian.

Gloria necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. medicinas en general.

Los sueños D. Gloria son tener una tienda en L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, mejorar su vivienda y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Gloria needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested to purchase medicines

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura is a member of the Communal Bank of Azucenas.

Maura is 48 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. On Saturdays and Sundays Maura sells food in the fair of the Americas and her daughter usually helps her out. On Fridays, Maura travels to the fair where sells fruits, vegetables and she also buys cereals which subsequently she grinds and sells at the markets of Ayacucho. Maura uses her car to transport all of her merchandise. In addition to this commercial activities, Ms Maura also has plantations in the community of Santa Bárbara, where she harvest the products and then sells them to other merchants.

Maura needs a loan of 1500 soles that will be invested in repairing her car and purchasing various vegetables and fruits.

Maura’s dreams are to offer her daughters a good education, expand her business and buy a newer car.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.

Maura es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Maura los días sábados y domingos vende comida típica en la feria de las Américas para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su hija, actividad que realiza ambulatoriamente. Además Maura días viernes viaja a la feria de donde vende frutas, verduras y de las ferias compra cereales que posteriormente lo manda moler y lo vende en los mercados de Ayacucho, el transporte de su mercadería lo realiza con su carro, También Maura tiene sus plantaciones de tara, tuna, molle en la comunidad de Santa Bárbara de donde cosechas los productos y lo comercializa a los intermediarios.

Maura necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación de su carro y también en la compra de verduras variadas y frutas.

Los sueños de Maura es brindar una buena educación a sus hijas, ampliar su negocios y comprar un carro mas moderno.

loans.use: Maura needs a loan of 1500 soles that will be invested in repairing her car and purchasing  various vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Silveria lives on Julian Apaza Street, north south of the Mejillones Port area in the city of El Alto. She lives with her children that are 23, 8 and 6 years old respectively. Her husband works in the interior of the department. She is dedicated to the sale of vegetables and meat that she transports to provinces in the department.

The loan will be allocated to purchase a printing press for her husband; he previously worked for an employer and will now work independently and will no longer be away from his family. It is her first loan with Impro, the evaluation that was conducted qualified her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Silveria vive en la calle Julian Apaza s/n de la zona puerto Mejillones en la ciudad de El Alto. Ella vive junto a sus hijos de 23, 8 y 6 años respectivamente ya que su esposo trabaja en el interior del departamento. Se dedica a la comercialización de verduras y carne que transporta a provincias del departamento. El crédito lo destinará en la compra de maquina de imprenta para su esposo ya que anteriormente él trabajaba de empleado y ahora lo hará independientemente y ya no estará lejos de su familia. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase a printing press for her husband so he can work and open his own printing business near their family.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta is a member of the Comunal Azucenas Bank.

Vicenta has a partner, is 26 years old and has 2 children. Vicenta has a hardware store in her home, located in the neighborhood of Santa Elena, where she sells construction materials. She relies on her car to transport most of the materials from the nearby riverside to her home. She buys the rest of the construction materials in Lima. Vicenta counts on the assistance of her brothers for the administration of her business.

Vicenta needs a loan of 3000soles (approximately 1050.00USD,) which she will invest in the purchase of cements.

Vicenta dreams to be able to construct more floors in her home, and to have a better assortment of products for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.

Vicenta es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Vicenta tiene una ferretería en su casa ubicada en el barrio de Santa Elena, donde vende materiales de construcción y agregados para lo cual cuenta con un carro que trae los agregados del río mas cercano y lo lleva a domicilio, los demás materiales de construcción lo compra en la ciudad de Lima. Vicenta cuenta con la ayuda de sus hermanos para la administración de su negocio.

Vicenta necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cementos.

Los sueños de Vicenta son construir más pisos en su vivienda, surtir con mas productos sus negocios.

loans.use: Vicenta needs a loan of 3000 soles (approximately 1050.00 US dollars) to invest in the purchase of cements.

loans.name: Lola Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes is a member of the Comunal Azucenas Bank.

Lourdes has a partner, is 26 years old and has 2 children. Lourdes lives with her parents in the neighborhood of Nahuimpuquio. She is studying nursing and currently working in a pharmacy in a university. Lourdes and her mother have a shop together selling assorted groceries, vegetables, and fruits. In her free time, Lourdes sells cosmetics from catalogues.

Lourdes needs a loan of 1050 PEN (approximately 375 US dollars) which she will invest in the purchase of sugar, rice, oil, soap, and shampoo.

Lourdes dreams of buying land in order to build her home, to grow professionally, and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Lourdes es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.

Lourdes es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Lourdes vive con sus padres en el barrio Ñahuimpuquio, Lourdes estudio enfermería técnica, actualmente esta trabajando en una botica y esta estudiando enfermería en una Universidad a distancia. Lourdes junto a su mama tienen una tienda surtida de abarrotes, verduras, frutas, además Lourdes en sus ratos libres vende cosméticos por catálogos.

Lourdes necesita un préstamo de 1050 dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite, jabón, champú.

Los sueños de Lourdes son comprar un terreno para construir su casa, crecer profesionalmente y mejorar sus negocios.

loans.use: Lourdes needs a loan of 1050 PEN (approximately 375 US dollars) that will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, oil, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana is a member of the Comunal Azucenas Bank.

Sebastiana is married, 48 years-old and has 5 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Santa Elena and sells vegetables wholesale and also by means of a moving cart which she uses to do business in the market in the city of Ayacucho. She buys the vegetables directly from the producers. In addition, Sebastiana has a grain mill in her home where she offers milling services. She buys cereals from the fair of the Americas and processes the flour which is later sold in the markets in Ayacucho city.

Sebastiana needs a loan of 1500 soles (approximately 525 US dollars) to invest in the purchase of wheat, barley, corn, and other grains.

Sebastiana dreams of being able to produce more products, to make further progress with her business, and to be able to provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Sebastiana es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.

Sebastiana es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Sebastiana vive en el barrio de Santa Elena y vende verduras al por mayor y menor de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, las verduras los compra de los productores. Además Sebastiana tiene un molino de granos en su casa donde brinda servicios de molienda. También compra cereales de la feria las Américas y luego lo procesa en harina que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Sebastiana necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, quinua, cebada, maíz.

Los sueños de Sebastián son ampliar sus negocios, que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y producir más productos.

loans.use: Sebastiana needs a loan of 1500 soles (approximately 525 US dollars) to invest in the purchase of wheat, barley, corn, and other grains.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionicia tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y la menor de sus hijas. Durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a la venta de ganado, vino a radicar a la ciudad de Huancayo para mejorar la situación de su familia, trajo consigo a algunos animales que tenía y con el tiempo pudo adquirir mayor cantidad, los cuales vende en las ferias de los fines de semana. Vende ovejas, llamas y alpacas, con ello, pudo sostener la educación de sus 7 hijos y ahora sólo le queda la menor que tiene 16 años, para ella, lo más difícil que suele suceder es cuando el clima es adverso (temperatura muy baja) la demanda de sus animales disminuye, pero eso no la detiene y sigue adelante. Dionicia desea incrementar su capital de trabajo, para lo cual solicita un crédito que le permitirá obtener mayor cantidad de animales. (Foto tomada en plena lluvia, debido a la lejanía del hogar de Dionicia, no se pudo encontrar un lugar con más iluminación)

Translated from Spanish Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Dionicio is 49 years old, lives with her husband and their young daughters. Throughout her life she has worked selling livestock; she began living in the city of Huancayo to improve the situation of her family. She brought with her some animals that she had and was eventually able to acquire several others which she sells in markets on weekends. She sells sheep, llamas and alpacas, and thus, was able to educate her 7 children, now there is only one who is less than 16 years old. It is very difficult for her when the climate dips very low and the demand for animals decreases; this does not stop her from continuing to work to get ahead. Dionicio wants to increase her working capital and thus is asking for a loan that would allow her to obtain a greater number of animals. (The photo was taking during a rainstorm due to the remoteness of Dionicio’s home and the inability to find a place with more lighting)

loans.use: Increase the number of cattle.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is 45 years old and is married with three kids who are currently in school. She is a petty trader who trades in yams. Her husband and kids are very proud of her because of the enormous contribution she makes in the home. Selling of yams has enabled her to rent accommodation for her family. She wants to use the loan to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children's education. She is member of the "Aseda wura" Trust Group, whose members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase her supply of yams

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn H. is 52 years old. She is a wife and mother of four children. Evelyn is resourceful mother and successful business woman. She works hard to support her children in school. At the moment, two children are in school. 

She trades in bread and bedspreads in her neighborhood. She has inadequate working capital to support her business growth. She believes that with a loan, she will be able to purchase more bread and bedspreads to increase her inventory. She hopes to save enough income to support her family. 

She belongs to the community group called Halleluya Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for one another and provide assistance to one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more loaves of bread and bale of bedspreads.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana M. is forty two years old. She has four children and is separated from her husband. The children are in school. 

Joana enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, and skimmed powdered milk. However, she is constrained from meaningful progress by a lack of capital. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, sugar, vegetable oil, and body and hair creams to increase her profits. She believes the loan will enable her to realize her dream. She is a member of the community group called Halleluya Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and assist one another to repay their loans. 

Joana appears in the photo with one of her children.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cristo Redentor Group

texts.en:
Juana V. is a creative and spirited woman who lives in the community of San Pedro de Macorís, a town on the southern coast of the Dominican Republic. Juana has a small business where she sells gasoline and oil. This business has proved to be very fruitful so far.
