There is not a lot of competition where she lives, and she finds that the large numbers of motorcyclists in the area makes for constant demand. She always uses her loans to invest in the expansion of her business.

Her goal is to continue growing and expanding her business so that, one day, she can own her own gas station where everyone in her community can come for affordable and high quality gasoline and oil. She also says her goal is to expand her business enough that the business is consistently stable. This helps her rest easily at night.

Juana and her story represent the Cristo Redentor Bank of Hope. She belongs to a group of 15 men and women who work hard to improve their lives with the help of their small loans. Each of these men and women has taken out a similar loan to that of Juana's. On behalf of all of them, and our team here at Esperanza, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To buy more gasoline and oil to resell.

loans.name: Hacia Adelante Group

texts.en:
Antonia M. belongs to the Hacia Adelante Bank of Hope and lives in a small community on the outskirts of San Pedro de Macorís. She lives in small home with her husband and five children, whose ages range from 6 to 16 years of age.

Antonia has a small 'fritura' business where she offers a variety of fried foods to her community. This most often includes fried plantain chips, fried pork, and other fried meats or starchy vegetables. She used her loan to buy a bigger variety of food to cook and to also buy her cooking oil in bulk to reduce costs.

Her dream is to have her own large food business where she owns her own location and building to sell it from. As she works towards that dream, she has created a goal to simply maintain a steady flow of business, to make sure that things are stable in her house, and to slowly grow her business.

Antonia and her story represent the Hacia Adelante Bank of Hope; she belongs to a group of 10 men and women who work hard to improve their lives through the help of their small loans.  Each of these men and women has taken out a similar loan to that of Antonia's. On behalf of all of them, and our team here at Esperanza, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To  invest in more merchandise such as vegetables and meats to fry and sell to her community members.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is 45 years old and a mother of five children. All of the children are in school now. She has been selling grocery products for seven years in the market to support her family. 

She says business is doing well and, therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy more products to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would enable her to save toward her children education.
Afia is a member of the group called Halleluya Trust Group. Members in this group agree in unison to guarantee for each other to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like canned fish and tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, body pomade, etc

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena D. is 39 years old and the mother of four children. Her children are currently in school. 

To support her household, she has been selling cereals, such as rice, wheat, beans, and groundnuts in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says that selling these products is very lucrative and, therefore, she wants to expand her inventory, so she can earn a good income and support her family. 

Helena is a member of the group called Anointing Ladies Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more cereals like rice, wheat, groundnut and beans.

loans.name: Adrián

texts.es:
Adrián tiene 47 años, vive junto a su esposa y a sus 5 hijos de 20,16,14,12 y 10 años. Es un hombre que desde muy joven se caracterizó por ser una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a sus chacras, y ahora a la crianza de cuyes, porque vio en esta actividad la forma de obtener ingresos adicionales, debido a la gran demanda de estos animalitos en los mercados.Esta labor no requiere de mucha atención, sólo se debe saber seleccionar a los animales y ubicarlos adecuadamente en sus jaulas, por lo general le toma parte de la mañana para limpiar, alimentar y seleccionar a sus cuyes. Lo difícil es mejorar la raza, para ello tendría que adquirir animales de raza y poder alimentarlos adecuadamente. Adrián tiene en sus hijos los mejores motores que le ayudan a seguir mejorando como padre y agricultor. Este padre anhela que su pequeño criadero de cuyes mejore y sea el más reconocido para cumplir los diversos pedidos de cuy para exportación. Para ello, requiere comprar animales de raza para mejorar la calidad de sus cuyes, por lo que solicita este préstamo.

Translated from Spanish Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Adrian is 47 years old and lives with his wife and their 5 sons who are 20,16,14,12 and 10 years old. He is a man who from an early age was characterized as a hard-worker who was very dedicated to his agricultural lands, and now works raising guinea pigs; he saw this as an activity that would enable him to have additional income due to the high demand for these animals in the markets. This type of work does not require a lot of attention, instead, you only need to know how to select animals and place them properly in their cages. It usually takes part of the morning to clean, feed and select the guinea pigs. The challenge is to improve the breed, but in order to do so he would have to acquire pure-bred animals and feed them properly. Adrian has the best intentions for his children, this allows him to continue improving as a father and farmer. This farmer yearns to improve his bread of guinea pigs so that he will be better known in order to take advantage of the various orders for export. In order to do so he is asking for a loan, this will allow him to buy animals of a better breed in order to improve their quality.

loans.use: Purchase of pure-bred animals to improve the quality of his guinea pigs.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando es un hombre de 46 años, quien vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 22, 19 y 5 años. Él es una persona muy trabajadora, que desde siempre se dedicó a la agricultura, sembrando diversas variedades de productos agrícolas; y por ahora está dedicado a la producción de verduras, durante esta temporada, sale de mañana de su hogar rumbo a sus lejanas chacras, para limpiarlas, regarlas y sobre todo abonarlas debidamente, lo que le toma largas horas de arduo trabajo.Para Armando este trabajo es muy duro, pero pierde las ganas de realizarlo porque se siente bien y está en compañía de sus animales, trabaja alegremente a pesar de la amenaza del incremento del costo de los abonos, lo que en algunas ocasiones perjudicó sus sombríos, por no tener el dinero necesario. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono para que su cosecha sea buena, y así ir mejorando la calidad de sus productos, y transportarlos cuidadosamente a las ciudades para su comercio.

Translated from Spanish Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Armando is a 46 year old man, who lives with his wife and three children who are 22, 19 and 5 years old. He is a very hard-working person who has always been a farmer who plants different varieties of agricultural products. For now he harvests vegetables; during this part of the year he leaves his home in the morning and goes to their remote fields to begin cleaning, watering and especially fertilizing which takes long hours of hard work. For Armando this work is very difficult, but he does not lose the desire to do so because he likes the feeling of being in the company of his animals and work happily regardless of the threat of increased cost of fertilizers. This has sometimes hampered their planting since they did not have the money necessary to buy fertilizers. He will invest the money in buying fertilizer to ensure that his harvest is good, and thus to improve the quality of their products, and transport them carefully to cities for their trade.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for her agricultural land.

loans.name: Dios Verdadero Group

texts.en:
Maria F. is a spirited young woman who lives in a small community on the outskirts of San Pedro de Macoris in the Dominican Republic.  She lives with her two small children (ages 5 and 2) in a tiny little home.

Maria has a small business in which she offers fried foods to members of her community. She asked for this loan to invest more money in her business by buying more merchandise. This includes having the capital on hand to periodically buy more vegetables and meats to fry. 

Her goal is to continue expanding her business so that, one day, she can own her own restaurant and a spot from which she can sell her goods. Her lifelong goal is to own her house. She thinks that this finally may be possible because, with the help of this loan, she can take better care of her children. Also, for the first time in her life, she has been able to start saving towards her dream.

Maria and her story represent the Dios Verdadero Bank of Hope. She belongs to a group of 10 men and women who work hard to improve their lives with the help of their small loans. Each of these men and women has taken out a similar loan to that of Maria's. On behalf of all of them, and our team here at Esperanza, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To invest in more merchandise such as fruits, meats and vegetables. to cook for her community members.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 4 años. Se dedica a la agricultura, labor que aprendió desde muy niña y que es hasta hoy la única actividad que realiza, a la cual se dedica todas las mañanas, a limpiar y abonar sus terrenos. Aurora nos cuenta que esta actividad le ayudó mucho para solventar los gastos de su hogar, por ello que se esfuerza al máximo y disfruta de su trabajo, porque desde muy pequeña aprendió a querer sus terrenos de cultivos y a pesar de las dificultades que se presentan, como los altos costos de los abonos y semillas, trata de no dejar de trabajar. Aurora trabaja arduamente con el fin de ofrecer a su menor hijo todo lo necesario para su crecimiento y desarrollo. Ahora, desea ampliar sus terrenos e iniciarse en el cultivo de café, ya que es lo más rentable por esta temporada, más adelante tener una bodega de compra y venta de fruta y café.

Translated from Spanish Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Aurora is 37 years old and lives with her husband and her 4 year old son. She is a farmer, something she learned as a child and up to today it is the only activity that she engages in; every morning she cleans and fertilizes her lands. Aurora tells us that this activity has helped cover the costs of her home, which is why she is trying to get the most out of it and she also enjoys herself. As a little girl she learned to love her farmland regardless of the difficulties that often arise such as the high cost of fertilizer and seeds and tries not to stop working. Aurora works hard in order to offer her youngest child everything necessary for their growth and development. Now, she would like to expand her land and start cultivating coffee, which is more profitable in this season. In the future she would also like to have a store for the buying and selling of fruit and coffee.

loans.use: Expand her land for the cultivation of coffee.

loans.name: Edelisa

texts.es:
Edelisa is 39 years old, she lives with her husband and her three children; 17, 15, and 8 years of age. She sells clothes offering a variety of models for all ages from door to door. She has been doing this daily for the past 3 years. It is not difficult for her to sell her merchandise as everybody likes her and she has succeeded in obtaining clients that place monthly orders. Edelisa enjoys offering her products as she has got a lot of friends everywhere, and that is very favorable for her. Nevertheless, the weather makes it difficult as it is exhausting to walk hours and hours in the blazing sun. Edelisa wishes to invest in buying more merchandise to be sold at the fairs, and later on, she wishes to purchase a motorcar as motorized transportation in the jungle represents the most favorable investment.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Edelisa tiene 39 años, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus tres hijos de 17,15 y 8 años. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, lo que realiza de forma ambulante por las calles, ofreciendo de puerta en puerta los diversos modelos para todas las edades. En esta actividad se ocupa todo el día, hace más de 3 años. No le es muy difícil vender su mercadería, puesto que con su gran simpatía ha logrado tener clientes que le hacen pedidos mensualmente. A Edelisa le agrada el ofertar sus productos, porque puede tener una gran cantidad de amigos por todos lados y eso es favorable para ella. Sin embargo, lo dificultoso es tener que lidiar con el clima, pasar horas de horas caminando en pleno sol, lo que es muy agotador. Edelisa desea invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercedaría para vender en las festividades, de la misma forma, desea con el tiempo, adquirir un motocarro, ya que en la selva el transporte en moto es la mejor inversión.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise to increase sales.

loans.name: Maria Casilda

texts.es:
Maria is 42 years old, has 4 children, 3 of them are independent and she lives with her husband, who is a chauffeur, and her youngest 6 year-old son. She works in her general store trying to satisfy the demands and needs of the neighbors; the store is built of pre-construction material and has been operating for 3 years. What she enjoys about her work is that she has been able to establish friendship with her neighbors and has their trust, but more than once she has thought of closing because of lack of safety at the premises, and this represents a problem that needs to be solved soon. Therefore Maria wishes to built her store to be safe, and in the future turn into an important general store with a vast variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

María, de 42 años tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos ya son jóvenes e independientes, ahora vive con su esposo, quien es chofer y su último hijo de 6 años. Trabaja en su bodega, tratando satisfacer las demandas y necesidades de los pobladores de la zona, dicha tienda está preconstruida, y hace 3 años que está en funcionamiento. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es que a través de ello pudo formar lazos de amistad con sus vecinos y lograr un alto grado de confianza con ellos, pero por más de una ocasión pensó cerrar, por la falta de seguridad de su local, siendo esto algo que quiere resolver pronto. Es por ello, que María tiene pensado construir su tienda, para dar seguridad a su negocio y con el tiempo ser una gran bodega con diversidad de productos. .

loans.use: Build safe premises for a general store.

loans.name: Lidia Teodosia

texts.es:
Lidia is a 38 year-old single mother of three children, 20, 17, and 10 years of age. She has had different jobs as she is responsible for the upbringing of her three children. At the present she works at home selling chicken and making crates, always trying to spend time with her family. Working at home makes is easier for her to be with her children as well as take care of business. What she likes the most is the flexibility to manage her time, but the difficult part is to satisfy the orders for crates because of lack of machinery or resources. It is Lidia’s dream and motivation that her children become professionals. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of wood to be able to meet orders and in the future become an important businesswoman in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Lidia tiene 38 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus tres hijos de 20, 17 y 10 años. Siempre trabajó en diversas actividades por la responsabilidad que tenía en criar a sus tres hijos, ahora se ocupa a la venta de carne de pollo y a la construcción de cajones, estas dos actividades las realiza en su domicilio, tratando siempre de prestar el tiempo necesario a su familia.Trabajar en su casa le ayuda a no alejarse de sus hijos y dedicarse a la par con sus dos negocios, siendo esto lo que más le agrada, la flexibilidad de tiempo, pero siempre existen los aspectos difíciles, siendo uno de ellos, el cumplir con los pedidos de cajones, ya que por falta de maquinaria o algunos recursos la limitan a seguir trabajando. Lidia tiene visualizado el ver a sus hijos profesionales, esto es su mejor motor de progreso. Está muy convencida en invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de madera y atender a las demandas de las personas, y con el tiempo ser una gran empresaria en este rubro en su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase wood to make crates in order to increase business.

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es:
Benjamín is 60 years old, lives with his wife and 13 year-old son, who is a student. Since he was a boy farming was important to him as he helped his parents on their land and therefore knows well how to grow different crops. From early in the morning and all day long he does what he likes and knows how to, and even if his work is tough and tiring he carries it out joyfully, except for the expensive supplies needed to farm his land such as fertilizers and medicines. Benjamín plans to extend his land and start sowing corn to be prepared for the season and be able to commercialize his production in the towns close to his locality.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Benjamín tiene 60 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 13 años, quien es estudiante. Desde niño, la agricultura fue la actividad que siempre lo acompañó, debido a que ayudaba a sus padres en las labores dentro de sus chacras, por ello es muy conocedor de cómo cultivar los diversos productos. Desde muy tempranas horas y durante todo el día hace lo que le agrada y sabe hacer, es por ello que aunque su trabajo es duro y cansado, lo realiza con alegría; salvo por los costosos insumos que requiere para el cuidado de sus terrenos, tales como fertilizantes, medicinas y abonos, los cuales son indispensables. Benjamín tiene proyectado ampliar sus terrenos y comenzar la siembra de maíz para estar preparado para la próxima temporada, y poder comercializar su producción en las ciudades cercanas a su localidad.

loans.use: Extend and prepare farm land for sowing corn.

loans.name: Famara Djere

texts.fr:
Famara is the owner of a cyber café. He is involved in the training of youths in NICT (new information and communication technologies) and thus contributes to the reduction of the digital divide in the south of Senegal. He is requesting a loan to buy a new computer and strengthen his cyber business. This way he’ll be able to meet the vacationers’ demand for an introduction course. This activity allows him to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Famara est un exploitant de cyber. Il participe a la formation des jeunes aux NTIC et contribue ainsi a la reduction de la fracture numerique au sud du Senegal. Il sollicite un pret pour renforcer son cyber en achetant une nouvelle machine ; afin de faire a la demande d'initiation des vacanciers. Avec cette activite, il arrive a prendre en charge sa famille.

loans.use: Strengthening of cyber cafe

loans.name: Vanesa Milagros

texts.es:
Vanesa is a 20 year-old lady who lives with her husband and her 5 year-old daughter. When she got married she started a business selling groceries and candies so she could take care of her family, as she administers her store and makes crates, all at home. As a young mother she had problems working and taking care of her baby at the same time, but thanks to her general store she can do both. Her only limitation is the high cost of the products and therefore she has little merchandise at her store and consequently few clients. Even though she became a mother at a very young age, her objectives are clear and the most important one is the well-being of her family which is her best motivation. Vanesa wishes to invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise in order to improve her store, increase stock and offer the best products in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Vanesa es una joven de 20 años que vive con su esposo y su hija de 5 años. Desde que contrajo matrimonio inició su negocio de venta de abarrotes y dulces, para así, no tener que descuidar a su familia en una labor fuera de casa, ya que juntamente con la atención en su tienda trabaja realizando cajones, es así que se encuentra todo el día ocupada en estas dos labores dentro de su hogar. Por el hecho de ser una madre muy joven tuvo muchos problemas para trabajar y atender a su bebe, pero ahora gracias a su bodega no desatiende a su bebe. Ahora, solo tiene algunas limitaciones con lo que respecta a los costos muy altos de los productos, esto se refleja en la falta de mercadería en su tienda y también limita a sus clientes. Aunque fue madre muy joven tiene en claro sus metas, y la primordial es el bienestar de su hogar, siendo esto, su mejor motivo de trabajo. Vanesa desea invertir el dinero en la compra de mercadería, para no disminuir sus productos, sino todo lo contrario, mejorar su tienda y ofrecer los mejores productos de la localidad.

loans.use: Improve stock to increase sales at general store.

loans.name: Eveline Katty

texts.es:
Eveline tiene 23 años, es una joven madre que vive con su bebe de tan solo 2 años. Se dedica a la venta de comida en un pequeño restaurante, local que alquiló en la entrada a la carretera de su zona, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 meses y gracias a Dios, no menciona, le está dejando grandes satisfacciones. Le agrada porque se dedica a lo que mejor sabe hacer, que es cocinar y atender al público, en lo que es muy hábil y tiene una riquísima sazón. Lo más difícil para ella, es atender a todas las personas que vienen a su establecimiento, debido a los pocos recursos con lo que cuenta, tanto en comestibles como en muebles (mesas y sillas.) Por ello Eveline desea adquirir utensilios y mesas para ampliar su restaurante y brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes, con el tiempo ser la propietaria de un restaurante de comidas típicas, ya que se encuentra en una zona donde la gente transita a varias de las ciudades de la selva central del Perú.

Translated from Spanish Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Eveline is a 23 years old young mother who lives with her 2 year old baby. She sells food in a small rented restaurant, which is at the entrance to a road in her neighborhood; she has been doing this for the last four months thanks to God, who is giving her great satisfaction. It makes her happy because it is what she knows how to do best, cook and serve the public, something that she is very good at and she has great skill. The most difficult thing for her is to serve everyone who comes to the restaurant due to her limited resources, both in terms of food and furniture (tables and chairs). Therefore Eveline would like to acquire utensils and tables to expand her restaurant and be able to provide better care to her customers; in the future she would like to become the owner of a restaurant serving typical food since it is located in an area where people travel frequently to several cities in Peru’s central jungle.

loans.use: Purchase of utensils (kitchenware and cutlery), chairs and tables to expand her small restaurant.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.fr:
This woman has a restaurant located close to the center of town, not far form the SONACOS factory. Every day, she welcomes several customers. Now, she would like to increase her stock of rice and other products (oil, tomato) in order to make an additional profit and to provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Cette femme a un restaurant situe pres du centre ville non loin l'usine SONACOS. elle accueille plusieurs clients chaque jour ; maintemant, elle vaudrait renforcer son stock en riz et autres produits ( huile, tomate..) pour recevoir davantage de benefice afin subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To strengthen restaurant

loans.name: Bety

texts.es:
Bety is 31 years old, studied until the end of middle school and speaks both Aymara and Spanish. She lives with her husband, with whom she has five children who are in school. She lives in the Marquiri del Centro Poblado of Caritamaya Distrito of Acora sector in the province of Puno.

She devotes herself to making crafts like puppets, gloves and shawls. She has done this for five years. She sells these products to people at the Acora fair. She is a member of the Communal Bank "New Horizons," where she had an initial loan of S. 300, with which she was able to buy 2 kilograms of synthetic wool and a pig, which she is raising.

With this loan of S. 300, which she will repay in four installments, she will buy 3 kilograms of synthetic wool in many colors and a young pig. She is a hard worker who makes her payments punctually.

Her great dream is to buy cows and pigs and thus increase her income so that her children can keep studying and become professionals.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Bety tiene 31 años, estudio hasta tercero de secundaria, habla el idioma aymará y castellano, actualmente convive con su pareja, con quien tiene cinco hijos, quienes están estudiando en la escuela; vive en el sector de Marquiri del Centro Poblado de Caritamaya Distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno. Ella se dedica a la producción de artesanía como títeres, guantes y chalina, a esta actividad se dedica hace cinco años, los productos que ella elabora los vende a personas intermediarias en la feria de Acora; pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Horizonte” donde tuvo un crédito inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que pudo comprar dos kilos de lana sintética para poder elaborar sus títeres y a su vez compro un chancho que lo esta criando; Con este crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles; el cual será pagado en cuatro cuotas, comprará tres kilos de lana sintética multicolor y un pequeño chancho. Nos cuenta que siendo socia ella aprendió a trabajar, ser solidaria y puntual en sus pagos. El gran sueño que ella tiene es comprar vacas lecheras, chanchos y de esa manera incrementar su capital y su ingreso económico; que sus hijos sigan estudiando y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchasing wool wholesale

loans.name: Gassama Et Freres Group

texts.fr:
The new hardware store is located on Boulevard of the 54m in Tilene. Ba Seckou G. runs this family business. He is requesting this loan to strengthen his stock of iron and concrete. This will allow them to make a bigger profit.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

La nouvelle quincaillerie est situe le boulevard des 54m a tilene. Cette entreprise famialle est dirigee par Ba Seckou G.. Il sollicite ce credit pour renforcer son stock de fer et ciment. Ce qui leurs permettra de realiser davantage de benefice.

loans.use: Hardware store

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is 50 years old. She is married and is the mother of three children who already have their own families. She studied until the fifth graD.. She lives in the Zepita district of the province of Chucuito - Juli in the region of Puno.

She is a partner of the Andrés Santa Cruz of Chuachua Communal Bank. With her first loan of S. 300 she bought two pigs and a sheep to fatten and sell at the cattle fair in the district. This transaction didn't go well, so she decided to buy more sheep to fatten. Thus she maD. a small profit and she bought some cows to fatten.

With the loan of S. 1, 500, which she will pay in four months, she will buy a cow to fatten and sell at the fair. If there is money left, she will invest it in the preparation of food to sell on Fridays in Desaguadero.

Catalina is slowly increasing her capital.She is very happy to belong to the Communal Bank, since she learned how to work on her own. She is grateful, since thanks to the support of Manuela Ramos she could improve her financial situation.

Her future goal is to have grassy land to install a farm.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Catalina tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada, madre D. tres hijos quienes ya tienen sus familias, ella estudió hasta quinto D. primaria, vive en el Centro Poblado D. Chuachua, del distrito D. Zepita, provincia D. Chucuito - Juli y Región D. Puno. Es socia del Banco Comunal Andrés Santa Cruz D. Chuachua, con el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles compró 02 chanchitos y 1 oveja para engordar y vender en la feria D. ganado del día jueves en el distrito, este no le fue muy bien y decidió comprar más ovejas para engordar. Con ello obtuvo un poco D. ganancia y compró ganado vacuno para el engorD., al igual que sus otras compañeras. Con el préstamo es D. S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará una vaca para el engorD. D. la feria dominical D. Ilave y si es que sobra lo invertirá en el preparado D. comida que realiza en Desaguadero los días viernes. Catalina, manifiesta que poco a poco esta incrementando su capital, ella se encuentra muy feliz estando en el Banco Comunal aprendió trabajar sola y esta agradecida ya que gracias al apoyo D. Manuela Ramos mejoró sus condiciones económicas. Su visión futura es instalar pastos cultivables para instalación D. granja D. cuyes.

loans.use: Purchasing one cow

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina is 58 years old. She studied all through elementary school. She is a widow and mother of two children, each of whom have their own families. She lives in the community of Huariquisana in the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao and region of Puno.

She is a partner of the Lupakas Communal Bank. Initially, she obtained a loan of S. 300. She invested this money in the purchase of clothing for women and men. With this business, her life improved. She has been doing this for a year.

With this loan of S. 1,500, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy a dozen pairs of stockings, three wool sweaters, new sheets, curtains, and so on.

Celestina is very happy because she is succeeding with her business. Her goal is to take her business to other regions.

Translated by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Celestina tiene 58 años D. edad, estudió hasta primaria completa, es viuda, madre D. dos hijos y cada una tiene su familia, ella sola vive en la comunidad D. Huariquisana, del distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao Ilave y Región D. Puno. Es socia del Banco Comunal Lupakas D. la comunidad Huariquisana, inicialmente obtuvo un préstamo D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles. Este dinero lo invirtió en compra D. ropas D. damas y varones, con el negocio mejoró su vida ya que ella estaba muy triste en su casa, a este negocio se dedica hace un año. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, que pagará en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra D. una docena D. medias, un cuarto D. docena D. chompas D. lana, sabanas nuevas, cortinas, etc hasta donD. alcance el dinero. Celestina esta muy feliz, por que sola está sobresaliendo con su negocio el cual viene creciendo. Su deseo es viajar con su negocio a otras Regiones.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing and bed sheets wholesale

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia is a member of the Communal Bank Lupakas in the community Huariquisana, belonging to the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of El Colao. She is fifty years old; she is married and has six children whom she supports. She finished elementary school. With her first loan of S. 300, she invested in the purchase of hemp to make rope.

Celia and her family have been working in the making of rope for 15 years. They start their work at 8:00 AM every morning; by 4:00 PM, they have made 100 products made out of rope. This is how her family is able to succeed.

With this loan of S. 1,000, which she will repay in 4 months, they will buy two packets of hemp-type material, since ropes made of that material are worth more. Celia is happy that her business is increasing her income; she can now buy many things that she wanted for her family. Her dream is to install more machinery so that she can sell retail and wholesale, and that her children grow up to be professionals.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Celia pertenece al Banco Comunal Lupakas de la comunidad Huariquisana, del distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Colao Ilave y Región de Puno. Tiene 50 años de edad, casada, madre de 06 hijos que aun depende de ella, estudió hasta primaria completa. Celia con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 nuevos soles que recibió invirtió en compra de material de cáñamo para elaboración de soga. En la actualidad doña Celia junto con toda su familia viene trabajando hace 15 años en elaboración de sogas, inician su trabajo 8:00a.m. hasta 4:00 p.m. logran hacer 100 frazadas de soga, así vienen sobresaliendo con todo su familia. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual cancelará en 4 meses, comprarán dos paquetes de material tipo cáñamo, ya que las sogas de ese material tienen un poco más de precio. Celia esta alegre con su negocio por que esta incrementando su capital y además ya puede comprarse muchas cosas que tanto deseaba para su familia. Su sueño grande es implantar más maquinas para elaboración de sogas con el fin de entregar por mayor y menor, y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchasing materials for making ropes

loans.name: Ndiaye Et Freres Group

texts.fr:
N. and Bros. is a young people’s business run by Mamadou N.. To boost their activity, they are requesting a loan to increase their working capital. This will enable them to better meet the ever growing demand. This way, they will be able to provide for themselves.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

N. ET FRERES une entreprise de jeunes dirigee par Mamadou N.. Pour accroitre leurs activites, ils sollicitent ce pret pour lui permettre d'accroitre son fond de roulemement en vue de mieux faire face a la demande qui est de plus en plus croissant. Ainsi ils pourront se prendre en charge.

loans.use: Manufacturing of cooking pots

loans.name: Delia Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina is part of the Zepita Communal Bank of the district of the same name in the province of Chucuito-Juli and region of Puno. She is 49 years old; she is married; she is the mother of four children; she studied until the fifth grade. She initially took out a loan of S. 300, with which she bought one bag of noodles, one sack of rice, two boxes of cookies, and one box of oil, among other things, for her grocery store. She has had this grocery store for 10 years.

She devotes herself to working at her grocery store every day, selling from 5 AM to 9 PM. With this loan of S. 1,200, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy four packs of soda, two sacks of rice, two bags of noodles, two sacks of sugar, one box of tuna fish and other items.

Delfina is happy because these loans will allow her to stock her grocery story and thus have a higher income level. She will thus be able to better pay for the feeding of her children, who depend on her. Her dream is to have a wholesale grocery store and for her children to be professionals.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Delfina pertenece al Banco Comunal Zepita, del distrito del mismo nombre, provincia de Chucuito - Juli y Región de Puno. Tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, madre de cuatro hijos, estudió hasta quinto de primaria. Inicialmente estando en el Banco accedió a un préstamo de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, con el dinero compró 1 bolsa de fideo, 1 saco de arroz, 2 cajas de galletas, 1 caja de aceite entre otros para su tienda de abarrotes que funciona hace 10 años en la plaza de armas de Zepita. Ella se dedica diariamente a su negocio de abarrotes vendiendo a partir de las 5a.m hasta las 9p.m. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 4 paquetes de gaseosa, 2 sacos de arroz, 2 bolsas de fideo, 2 sacos de azúcar, una caja de atún y otras. Delfina esta feliz, con los crédito esta logrando equipar más su tienda de abarrotes y de esa manera tendrá mayores ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos de alimentación de sus hijas e hijos que aun depende de ella. Su mayor sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes por mayor y sean profesionales todos sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchasing various groceries

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina is 33 years old. She completed technical college culminating in a career as a nurse. She speaks Aymara and Castellano, is married and has four children who are studying in primary school. Her home is located in the Marquiri Sector, in the town of Caritamaya, Acoro district, Puno province. She has worked making yogurt and Paria cheese for three years, products which she sells in the fairs at Llave and Acora, generally taking orders from customers.

She is a member of the Communal Bank, "New Horizons," where she had an inicial credit of $115, which she invested in the purchase of a thermometer and lactometer in order to make her products. With this credit of $75, which will be repaid en 4 months, she will purchase milk in bulk to make yogurt and cheese. Dina says that she was always active and particpating, the loan that you give her will help her to improve her business. Her dream is to have a yogurt and cheese business that can enter the national and international markets; She would like for her children to be entrepreneurs and have their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Dina tiene 33 años de edad, logro estudiar superior técnico culmino la carrera de enfermería, habla el idioma Aymará y Castellano, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos que están estudiando en educación primaria. Su domicilio esta ubicado en el Sector Marquiri, Centro Poblado de Caritamaya, Distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de Yogurt y queso tipo Paria desde hace tres años. Productos que los vende en las ferias de Ilave Y Acora, generalmente le hacen pedidos. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Horizonte” donde tuvo un crédito inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra de termómetro, lactómetro, para elaborar sus productos. Con este crédito de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, que será pagado en cuatro meses comprará leche al por mayor para la elaboración de yogurt y queso. Dina nos cuenta que siempre fue activa, participativa, el crédito que se le dio le ayudo a incrementar su negocio. El gran sueño que tiene es hacer una empresa de quesos y yogurt y poder entrar al mercado Nacional e Internacional; le gustaría que sus hijos sea emprendedores y que tengan su propia empresa.

loans.use: Purchase of milk in bulk

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Mrs. Dominga is 63 years old, finished high school, is married and has 7 children, two of which are girls, and has 3 granddaughters. They live in the Hyariquisana communtiy, Pilcuyo district, El Colloa Llave province, and Puno region. She is actually the secretary of the Lupkanas Communal Bank, which she decided to participate in due to lack of capital since her business was not doing well due to illness from being struck by lightning.

Initially she obtained a loan of $115, with which she purchased iron as springs, routers, electrodes, etc. to create of stakes, spikes, rings, and other items. With the loan of $350, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will continue investing in the purchase of raw iron, 1/8 electrodes, springs, and car parts, to make spikes, hatchets, stakes, and other tools. This activity allows her to stay close to her children and her husband.

She is very happy, because she has recuperated and her business is improving little by little, as well as her income, since she spends every Sunday selling her items at the Llave Fair. Her stand is located in Jiron Sucre, near the Santa Barbara Plaza. Her dream is to have more capital so she can make more agricultural tools, and that her grandchildren get an education.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dominga tiene 63 años D. edad, estudió hasta primaria completa, es casada, madre D. siete hijos a su lado están dos hijas y 03 nietas, viven en la comunidad D. Huariquisana, del distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao Ilave y Región D. Puno. Es actual secretaria del Banco Comunal Lupakas, decidió pertenecer por falta D. capital, ya que en ese entonces fracaso, por lo que estaba enferma por la caída D. rayo o relámpago. Inicialmente obtuvo un préstamo D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles. Con ello compró fieros como muelles rutas, electrodo, etc. para elaboración D. estacas, picos, argollas, entre otros. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, seguirá invirtiendo en la compra D. fieros D. media, 1/8, electrodo, muelles rotos D. carro para elaboración D. picos, hachas, estacas, entres otros, esta actividad lo realizan D. manera conjunta con sus hijas y su esposo. Ella se encuentra muy feliz, por que recuperó y su negocio está mejorando poco a poco sus ingresos también, ya que sale a vender todos los domingos en la feria D. Ilave, su puesto se ubica en jirón Sucre s/n cerca D. la plaza Santa Bárbara. Su sueño es incrementar más su capital para elaborar más herramientas agropecuarias y que sus nietas estudien.

loans.use: Purchase of Iron

loans.name: Dora Maribel

texts.es:
Mrs. Dora is 36 years old, studied until 3rd grade in primary school, is marries and mother of one daughter and one son. They live in the area of M. in the Camicachi Center, Llave district, El Collao province, and Puno region. She decided to participate in the Communal Bank of M., September 22, due to lack of capital to generate income for her family. Starting with a loan of $115, she invested in 3 black-faced sheep to fatten. Since then, she has increased her flock of sheep. She also decided to invest in the business of food sales such as: white soup and pot roast, selling dishes Fridays at the weekly Fair in Camicachi.

With this loan of $175, she will purchase 3 heads of black-faced sheep to fatten and sell. With this business she is generating, little by little, better economic income She will repay this loan within 4 months. She is appreciative to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for approving her for a loan. Now women have learned to work, generating income, and in this way can cover their costs and save money. Her dream is to build a stable to raise cattle, save well for retirement in town, and that her children graduate from college.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Dora tiene 36 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de primaria, casada es madre de una hija y un hijo. Actualmente viven en la parcialidad de M. del Centro de Camicachi, del distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y región de Puno. Ella decidió pertenecer al Banco Comunal 22 de Setiembre de la parcialidad de M. por falta de capital para generar ingresos económicos para su familia. Iniciando con un préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles invirtió en la compra 3 ovejas cara negras para el engorde, ya que ese negocio incremento la tenencia de ganado de ovino. Paralelo a ello decidió invertir en el negocio de venta de comida como: Caldo blanco y asado a la olla vendiendo los días viernes en la feria semanal del Centro Poblado de Camicachi. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles comprará 3 cabezas de ovino de cara negra para el engorde y venta. Con este negocio esta generando poco a poco mayores ingresos económicos. Dicho crédito lo cancelará durante cuatros meses. Ella está agradecida, a Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitir a acceder a crédito, ya las mujeres han aprendido a trabajar generando ganancias y de esa manera garantizar sus gastos y incrementar su capital. Su sueño más grande es construir un establo para el engorde de ganado vacuno, sacar una pensión grande en el Centro Poblado y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of 3 head of sheep.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs. Elizabeth is 22 years old, she completed high school, is married, and mother of a little boy. She lives in the Caritamaya section of Marquiri, Acora disctrict, Puno. She belong to the New Horizons Communal Bank. She works in purchase and sales of sheep in the Acora Fair on Saturdays, and in the Llave Fair on Sundays, which she invested her first loans in.

With this loan of $125, which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of colored wool to weave little animals such as: turtles, monkeys, small birds, etc., since they generate about $25 per week, allowing her to increase her art production. She is very happy, because in the Communal Bank, the women are working and as such are learning to be responsible and punctual for life. Her income is much better than before and she no longer lacks money to cover everyday costs. Her vision for the future is to export her artisan goods to other countries and for her son to graduate from college.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elizabeth tiene 22 años de edad, su nivel de instrucción es secundaria completa, es conviviente, madre de un hijito y es domiciliada en el Centro Poblado de Caritamaya sector Marquiri, del distrito de Acora, provincia y región Puno. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Horizonte. Ella Actualmente se dedica a la actividad económica de compra y venta de ganado ovino en la feria de Acora los día sábados y en Ilave los dìas domingos, ya que los primeros préstamos invirtió en ello. Con este crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que pagará en cuatro meses, invertirá en la compra de lana de colores para tejer animalitos como: tortuguitas,, monitos, pavitos, etc, ya que le genera semanalmente S/.50.00 nuevos soles, ello facilitará incrementar más su producción de la artesanía. Ella esta muy feliz, ya que en el Banco Comunal las mujeres están trabajando y además están aprendiendo ser responsables y puntuales para la vida. Su ingreso es mucho mejor que antes, ya que no le falta el dinero en el bolsillo y así asegura cubrir sus gastos económicos. Su visión futura es Exportar a otros países productos artesanales y su hijo sea profesional.

loans.use: Purchase of wool in bulk.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana is 32 years old, studies until 5th grad, is married, and mother of a daughter who still depends on her. In her small store she sells, sweets, soft-drinks, gelatin, candy, crackers, etc. Her store is located in the ENTEL of Zepita, in addition she sells general goods in the weekly Fairs of Huapaca, in the Pomata, Desguadero, and Zepita districts.

She is a partner of the Zepita Communal Bank, in the Zepita district, Chucuito district--Juli, of the Puno region, en which she obtained her first loan of $125. She invested this money in the purchase of 2 packages of soft-drinks, 2 boxes of crackers, 1 package of gelatin, and 4 bags of caramels. She says that with all of these loans her merchandise has grown, so that she can offer her clients all kinds of general good and snacks.

She is requesting this loan of $600 to purchase more items, such as 3 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 10 packages of soft-drinks, 5 boxes of crackers, among other things. This loan will be returned in 4 months.Emiliana is happy because her merchandise has increased in the same way that her income has. Her greatest desire is to roof her home and build a general good store, as well as making an education possible for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Emiliana tiene 32 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, es conviviente y madre de una hija que aún depende de ella. En su pequeña tienda vende golosinas, gaseosas, gelatinas, dulces, galletas, etc, que esta ubicada en el ENTEL de Zepita, además ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en las ferias semanales de Huapaca del distrito de Pomata, Desaguadero y Zepita. Es socia del Banco Comunal Zepita, del distrito del mismo nombre, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, de la región de Puno, en cual tuvo un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles. Este dinero lo invirtió en compra de 2 paquetes de gaseosas, 2 cajas de galletas, 1 paquete de gelatina, 4 bolsas de caramelos. Ella relata que con todos los crédito ha crecido su mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes tanto abarrotes y golosinas, por ello con el préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles, comprará más cosas por ejemplo 3 sacos de arroz, 2 bolsas de azúcar, 10 paquetes de gaseosas, 5 cajas de galletas entre otras. Este crédito lo pagará en cuatro meses. Emiliana esta contenta ya que su mercadería ha incrementado de igual manera sus ingresos económicos. Su deseo más grande es techar su casa y poner una tienda de abarrotes por mayor y menor, además hacer estudiar a su hijita.

loans.use: Purchase of general goods.

loans.name: Estefa

texts.es:
Estefa is 29 years old, finished 5th grade, is married, has a daughter and lives on Panamerican Avenue in the Desaguadero district, and sometimes is in the town of Chuachua, Zepita district, Chucuito-Juli province, and Puno region. She belongs to the Andres Santa Cruz Communal Bank. She decided to participate in the bank due to lack of start-up capital for her business in food sales. She sells items like, Sheep's head soup, stuffed chicken, and other dishes. With her first loan of $125 she bought a sack of rice, 2 measure of chuño (regional freeze-dried potatoes), among other supplies.

With this loan of $525, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase 2 sacks of rice, 1 kilogram of Quinua (regional plant), 3 bags of cornstarch, 1 kilogram of sugar, 3 measures of chuño, among other supplies, since she sells food and regional fruit juices with flour tortillas Tuesdays and Fridays each week on Odria street in Desaguadero.

Estefa must wake up at 3:30am for her business, and goes to sleep at 10pm on Tuesday and Friday. Doing so, she is able to successfully generate more income and increase her capital. She is appreciative to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for giving her support with the loan and as such, allowing her to move forward. Her dream is to purchase a car and open a auto shop in Desaguadero and improve her current business, as well as see her daughter become a professional.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Estefa tiene 29 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, es casada, madre de una hija, viven en avenida panamericana s/n del distrito de desaguadero y a veces está en el Centro Poblado de Chuachua, del distrito de Zepita, Provincia de Chucuito – Juli y Región Puno. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Andrés Santa Cruz de Chuachua, decidió pertenecer este banquito por falta de capital, para iniciar con el negocio de venta de comida como: caldo de cabeza de cordero, estofado de pollo y con su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 nuevos soles compró un saco de arroz, 2 arrobas de chuño entre otros. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 2 sacos de arroz, 01 quintal de quinua, 3 bolsas de maicena, 01 quintal de azúcar, 01 quintal de harina, 03 arrobas de chuño entres otras cosas, ya que ella se dedica a la venta comida y jugos de quinua y cañihua con tojtuche de harina los días martes y viernes de cada semana en calle Odria s/n de la ciudad de Desaguadero. Estefa para su negocio debe levantarse a las 3:30 a.m. y duerme a las 10:00 p.m. los día martes y viernes, de esa manera logra pues generar más ingresos económicos y incrementa su capital. Ella esta agradecida a Movimiento Manuela Ramos por dar el apoyo con el préstamo y así sobre salir adelante. Su sueño es comprar carro, implementar su taller mecánica en Desaguadero y ampliar su negocio actual, también que su hija sea profesional.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela is 29 years old and she studied until the end of high school. She speaks Aymara and Spanish, and she has 2 daughters who are in school. She lives in the sector of Marquiri Centro Poblado de Caritamaya, in the district of Acora, in the Province of Puno.

She makes toys in the shape of bears, lizards, birds, sheep etc, and also gloves and shawls in accordance with the association she belongs to, and she sells her products in the Cusco and Puno markets. She has been doing this for 5 years.

She belongs to the group 'Nuevo Horizonte' (New Horizons) and she started with a credit of 300 soles which she invested in a kilo of synthetic, multi-colored wool to make soft toys. With the rest of the money she bought furniture for her house as she had none, and so her life as a saleswoman started, and she paid the credit back by selling toys. With this credit of 300 soles, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy 6 kilos of multi-colored, synthetic wool and 2 kilos of stuffing for the toys.

She tells us that the in the group she learned to be responsible and punctual in her repayments, and she learned to work. She is very grateful for the credit as it was a great help for her when she really needed it.

Her dream is to buy her house and be able to open a small grocery store. Also she wants her kids to study and be good people.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Estela tiene 29 años de edad, logro estudiar secundaria completa, habla el idioma Aymará y Castellano, convive y tiene dos hijas mujeres, que están estudiando en la escuela; vive en el Sector Marquiri Centro Poblado de Caritamaya, Distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno. Se dedica a la elaboración de títeres como osos, lagartos pajaritos, ovejas, etc, guantes, chalinas chullos, de acuerdo al pedido que se le hace a la asociación a la que pertenece, sus productos los vende a los mercados de Cusco y Puno. Actividad a la que se dedica desde hace cinco años. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Horizonte” inicio con un crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra un kilo de lana sintética multicolor para elaborar títeres y con el resto de dinero compro sus muebles para su hogar puesto que no tenia nada, estaba iniciando su vida de convivencia y su crédito lo pagaba con la venta de títeres que producía. Con este crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que será pagado en cuatro meses, comprará seis kilos de lana sintética multicolor y dos kilos de napa para el relleno del títeres. Nos cuenta que siendo socia del Banco Comunal aprendió a ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos, aprendió a trabajar. Esta muy agradecida con el crédito por que fue un gran apoyo cuando ella mas lo necesitaba. El gran sueño que ella tiene es comprar su casa y poder aperturar una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y que sus hijos estudien y sean personas de bien.

loans.use: To buy wool in bulk/Compra de lana al por mayor.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
Eufemia is 28 years old and lives with her partner. She has one son and she was in school until 5th grade of secondary school and she lives near San Martin in the district of Zepita in the province of Chucuito - Juli in the region of Puno.

She is a member of the group Zepita where she got her first loan of 300 soles, which she invested in buying 3 bottles of fizzy drinks, 2 bags of noodles and 1 sack of noodles for her grocery store. With the following credits and with her earnings she has been putting it together bit by bit.

For a year she has been starting another business with her husband: raising bulls from 2-4 years old so that she can earn more. With the loan of 300 soles she will invest in 2 bulls to raise. She will pay this back in 3 lump sums.

Eufemia says that being part of this group has helped her to start more productive businesses, and for this she is grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Eufemia tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de un hijo, su nivel de instrucción es quinto de secundaria y vive jirón San Martín s/n del distrito de Zepita, provincia de Chucuito - Juli y Región de Puno. Es socia del Banco Comunal Zepita, en el cual obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, este dinero invirtió en compra de 3 paquetes de gaseosas, 2 bolsas de fideo, 1 saco de fideo, para su tienda de abarrotes. Con los siguientes créditos y con sus ganancias fue implementando poco a poco. Hace un año junto con su esposo han emprendido otro negocio que es engorde de ganado vacuno, especialmente toros de dos a cuatro dientes, ya que de ello obtienen mayor ganancia. Por ello con su préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, invertirá en comprar 02 toros para el engorde. Este crédito será pagado en 3 cuotas. Eufemia, cuenta que estando en el Banquito despierta más para emprender negocios más productivos, por ello está sumamente agradecida a Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Su sueño es construir establos para el engorde y que su hijo estudie para que sea profesional.

loans.use: To buy 2 bulls/Compra de 2 toros (ganado).

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys is 20 years old and studied at University. She lives with her partner in the 18 de diciembre avenue number 413 in the district of llave, in the province of El Collao and region of Puno.

She belongs to the group 22 de septiembre in Maquera. She has been an active member for 2 years and initially she started with a loan of 300 soles with which she started buying and selling sheep in the livestock market of the city of llave.

A while ago Gladys bought a cart of 'salchimote' thanks to some savings she had and the money she had earned. With the loan of 500 soles she will buy produce such as sacks of potatoes, sacks of maize and boxes of oil to make 'salchimote'. She will repay the credit in 4 months.

She is very happy because of all this, and she now earns more than before and has diversified her economic activities. Through being a member of the group she has learned to be responsible, about women's rights and administrating her funds.

Her vision is to strengthen the group with her companions so it never fades and to enlarge her business of preparing 'salchimote' in the city of llave.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Gladys tiene 20 años de edad, estudió hasta superior no universitaria, es conviviente y vive en avenida 18 de diciembre Nº 413 en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y región de Puno. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal 22 de Setiembre de la parcialidad de Maquera, hace dos años viene participando como socia activa, inicialmente con préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles emprendió la actividad económica de compra y venta de ovejas en las feria de ganados de la ciudad de Ilave. Gladys hace poco tiempo se compró una carreta de salchimote, gracias al ahorro interno y ganancias que tuvo. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles comprará productos como: papa por sacos, maíz por saco y aceite por caja para el preparado de salchimote. El crédito lo pagará en cuatro meses. Por todo ello, ella esta muy feliz, ya que tiene mayor ganancia que antes y está diversificando sus actividades económicas. Además manifiesta que a través del Banco Comunal aprende ser responsable, derechos de la mujer y administración del dinero. Su visión es fortalecer el Banco Comunal con sus compañeras para que nunca se desaparezca y ampliar su negocio de preparado de salchimote en la ciudad de Ilave.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk/Compra de insumos al por mayor.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys is 39 years old and is studying nursing. She has 2 daughters who are in high school. She is married and lives in the district of Acora near Puno in the region of Puno.

She works in her small factory making yogurt and soft drinks etc from her home. Due to lack of funds to enlarge her business she decided to join the group Nuevo Horizonte (New Horizons) in the Centro Poblado de Caritamaya in the Marquiri sector.

Since she was 11 years old Gladys has been making sweets, kids' toys, biscuits and now she is in the last years of her studies she has been making yogurt and soft drinks etc. She works from 5am and sleeps at 10pm. There's a lot of demand for her products and she distributes them in bulk to shops in the cities of llave and Acora, and in smaller quantities in llave on Sundays near San Martin in the port of Bordados in San Miguel. She is very happy.

With this loan of 1200 soles she will keep investing in merchandise and this is how she will generate more income. She will repay this loan in 4 months.

She also says that thanks to the loans she managed to move forward independently. Her biggest dream is to get machines to make and move her merchandise, and that her kids will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Gladys tiene 39 años de edad, es técnica en enfermería, es madre de dos hijos quienes están cursando en el colegio, es casada y vive en el distrito de Acora en jirón Puno s/n y Región de Puno. Ella trabaja en su pequeña fabrica de Yogurt, refresco entre otros, ubicado en su domicilio. Por falta de capital para incrementar su negocio decidió pertenecer al Banco Comunal de Nuevo Horizonte del Centro Poblado de Caritamaya del sector Marquiri. Gladys desde los 11 años edad se dedicó en el negocio de golosinas, caramelos, juguetes para niños, galletas y ahora en los últimos años ella al concluir sus estudios, se dedica a la fabrica de yogurt, refrescos entre otros, ya que trabaja todos los días desde las 5:00a.m. y duerme a las 10:00 p.m., tiene mucha demanda y debe distribuir por mayor a las tiendas de las ciudades de Ilave y Acora, y por menor vende en la ciudad de Ilave los días domingos en jirón San Martín en la puerta de Bordados de San Miguel. Ella está muy contenta. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, seguirá incrementando su mercadería y así mismo generará más ingresos económicos. Su préstamo lo pagará en cuatros meses. Además indica que gracias a los préstamos logró sobresalir adelante independientemente. Su sueño mayor es adquirir más maquinas para la fabrica, movilidad para trasladar mercadería y sean profesionales sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy sweets/Compra de golosinas.

loans.name: Gladys Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana is 24 year sold and she studied until 4th grade of elementary school. She speaks Aymara and Spanish and she lives with her partner with whom she has a son who is 5 years old. She lives in M. in the Centro Poblado de Camiachi in the district of llave in the province of El Collao.

She buys, sells and feeds up bulls which she buys in the markets of Pilcuyo, Llave, Acora and Camiachi and she sells them in the same markets after 2 months.

She started this business when she became a member of the group '22 de septiembre' where she had an initial credit of 300 soles with which she bought a baby deer which she raised for 6 months and then sold.

With this credit of 300 soles which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 2 bulls to raise.

She says that being a member of the group she has learned to be responsible and punctual in her payments. She is grateful for the credit which helped her to increase her earnings and her capital.

Her greatest dream is to buy a house in Tacna and to keep going with her business of raising livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Roxana tiene 24 años, estudio hasta cuarto de primaria, habla el idioma aymará y castellano; convive con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo varón de cinco años de edad. Ella vive en la Parcialidad de M., Centro Poblado de Camicachi, Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao. Ella se dedica a la actividad de compra y venta de vacas y engorde de toros que los compra en las ferias de Pilcuyo, ilave, Acora y camicachi y los vende en las mismas ferias después de dos meses. Ella inició con el negocio desde que se incorporó como socia al Banco Comunal “22 de Setiembre”,donde tuvo un crédito inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles con lo que compro una ternerita que lo crió seis meses y después los vendió. Con este crédito de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, que será pagado en cuatro meses, comprará dos toros para engorde. Manifiesta que siendo socia del Banco Comunal aprendió a trabajar, ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos; esta muy agradecida por el crédito le ayudo a incrementar sus ingreso y su capital. Su mayor sueño es comprar su casa en Tacna, seguir con el negocio de engorde de ganado.

loans.use: To buy 2 bulls/Compra de 2 toros (ganado).

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gladys is 34 years old ans she studied until 5th grade of secondary school. She is married and has 3 kids who still depend on her.

She currently works making sheets, curtains, pillows and she does this according to the demand of the clients in this market, thanks to the support of her husband and eldest son.

Gloria is a member of the group 'Lupakas' in the community of Huariquisana in the district of Pilcuyo in the province of El Collao llave in the region of Puno. She became a member of the group with the objective of buying more material and a sewing machine.

With the first loan of 300 soles she bought 15 sheets of 2 layers and with this she has, bit by bit, increased her capital and the merchandise of her business.

With the loan of 2300 soles which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy material to make 200 sheets of 2 layers which she will give to her friends and intermediaries in the cities of Juliaca, Puno and Llave.

She is very happy as her business is growing each day and her earnings have improved considerably over the last few years.

Her future vision is to have a small workshop in the city of Llave and have her kids be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Gloria tiene 34 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, es casada y tiene tres hijos que aún dependen de ella. Actualmente se dedica a las actividades económicas de confección de sabanas, cortinas, conchas, almohadas y elaboración de sojas, estas actividades vienen trabajando de acuerdo a la demanda de los clientes del mercado, gracias al apoyo de su esposo y su hijo mayor. Gloria, es parte del Banco Comunal de Lupakas de la comunidad de Huariquisana, del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao Ilave y región de Puno. Su pertenencia al Banco fue con el objetivo de comprar más telas y maquina de coser. Ella con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró para 15 sabanas de 2 plazas, con ello poco a poco ha incrementado su capital y mercadería para su negocio. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en cuatro meses lo invertirá en la compra de telas para elaborar 200 sabanas de dos plazas, ello lo entregará al por mayor a sus amigos e intermediarios, en las ciudades de Juliaca, Puno e Ilave. Ella esta muy feliz, ya que sus negocios están creciendo día a día y además sus ingresos a mejorado considerablemente en los últimos años. Su visión futura es tener un taller de confección en la ciudad de Ilave e hijos profesionales.

loans.use: To buy material in bulk/Compra de telas al por mayor.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Señora Julia is a member of the communal bank called "Nuevo Horizonte" in the town of Caritamaya in the area of Marquiri and region of Puno.

With her first loan, she bought a milking cow and now has calves. Her milking cow is a money-maker since Julia sells the milk to a company called Yogurt which belongs to another member named Gladys Aroapaza. She makes money doing this and has been able to save some as well.

She has many ideas as to what she would like to do with this loan. First, she wants to lease some acreage to raise livestock. Second, she would like to purchase color wool to knit some small animals like turtles, turkeys, etc. since she delivers these items in a weekly basis in the region of Puno and on Sundays in the city of Acora. By doing this, she has fixed weekly income plus more. She will repay this loan within 4 months.

She's very happy due to her high earnings since she's been able to diversify. She's 45 years old. She finished second grade. She's married and has 5 children.

Her dream is to one day own a dairy, become better at her sewing so that she can export her art work to other countries. She also wants for her kids to finish school and become professionals.

Transalated by a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Julia, es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Horizonte del Centro Poblado de Caritamaya sector Marquiri, del distrito de Acora, Provincia y Región de Puno. Ella siendo parte del Banco Comunal, con el primer préstamo que adquirió compró una vaca lechera y en la actualidad tiene una cría, y al mismo tiempo esta provee leche a la fábrica de Yogurt de la compañera Gladys Aroapaza, ella está generando su ganancia y incrementando su ingreso económico. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, invertirá de la siguiente manera: S/. 200.00 nuevos soles alquilará dos hectáreas de pastizales para ganado lechero y los S/.300.00 nuevos soles comprará lana de colores para tejer animalitos como tortuguitas, pavitos, etc ya que entrega semanalmente al intermediario de Puno los días domingos en la ciudad de Acora, con ello tiene ingreso seguro y aumenta su capital semanalmente. Su préstamo será pagado en cuatro meses. Ella, está muy contenta, por tener mayores ingresos gracias a la diversificación de actividades económicas. Actualmente tiene 45 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo de primaria, madre cinco hijos y es casada. Su deseo grande es tener fábrica de quesos tipo paria, mejorar su artesanía para exportar a otros países y sean profesionales sus hijos.

loans.use: To lease some land and to purchase some color wool

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Señora Lucía is 41 years old. She completed 5th grade. She's married and has 2 children ( a boy and a girl) who currently depend on her financially.

She's a member of the communal bank called "Primero de Agosto" in the district of Zepita in the state of Chucuito-Juli in the region of Puno. She became a member because she needed to increase her merchandise in her butcher shop called "Emporio La Rueda" which is located in the local supermarket in Zepita. With her first loan, she bought 2 sheep to process the meat.

With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase 4 lambs to process meat. She's very happy since every day she's able to increase her inventory and her bottom line.

Her future goal is to one day own a bakery shop and that her kids will finish school and become professionals.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucía tiene 41 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, es casada y madre de 2 hijos (01 mujer y un varón), quienes aún depende de ella. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Primero de Agosto, del distrito de Zepita, provincia de Chucuito – Juli y Región Puno. Se asoció al Banco por falta de capital para incrementar más mercadería en su tienda de Carnecería Emporio La Rueda, que está ubicada en el mercado de abastos de Zepita tienda Nº 4. En el cual, su primer crédito fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, con ese dinero compró 2 ovejas mejorados para carnear. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 4 corderos para carnear. Ella esta feliz ya que cada día está incrementando su mercadería y capital, asimismo está obteniendo un poco más de ganancia de su negocio. Su visión es instalar una tienda de plastequería en la ciudad de Desaguadero y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To purchase lambs to process the meat

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
Dorotea is 43 years old. She completed elementary school. She's married and mother of 5 children who depend on her financially. They live in the town of Chuachua in the district of Zepita in the state of Chucuito.

She's a member of the communal bank called "Andres Santa Cruz D. Chuachua". With her previous loans, she invested the money in some livestock and with the savings she decided to open up a store six months ago in the downtown area.

With this loan, she would like to purchase 3 boxes of soda, 2 bags of noodles, 2 boxes of cookies, 6 cans of oil, etc. to stock up her store. She will repay this loan within 4 months.

Dorotea is very happy since she was a young girl she always wanted to own her own grocery store. Little by little, she's able to increase her merchandise and her profit.

Her future goal is to have her own farm and raise guinea pigs, stock up her store and that her children will all finish school and become professionals.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

Dorotea tiene 43 años D. edad, estudió hasta primaria completa, es casada, madre D. cinco hijos todos depenD. D. ella y están domiciliados en el Centro Poblado D. Chuachua, del distrito D. Zepita, Provincia D. Chucuito – Juli y Región D. Puno. Es socia del Banco Comunal Andrés Santa Cruz D. Chuachua, los préstamos anteriores se dedicó en el engorD. D. ganado y D. ello tuvo ganancias y hace seis meses decidió abrir una tienda en la plaza D. armas del centro poblado, quien en la actualidad se dedica a ese negocio. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará 3 paquetes D. gaseosas, dos bolsas D. fideos, dos cajas D. galletas, media docena D. aceite entre otras para la tienda. Su crédito será pagado en cuatro meses. Dorotea esta muy feliz, por que tiene ya una tienda que anhelaba desD. su juventud, además poco a poco esta incrementando su mercadería y mejorando sus ingresos económicos. Su visión futura es tener una empresa D. crianza D. cuyes, equipar más su tienda y sean profesionales sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy items in bulk

loans.name: Alejandro José

texts.es:
Alejandro Jose, 38, is married and has 2 school-aged children. He lives in the Ticuantepe municipality and works alongside his wife in the agricultural industry. Six years ago he decided to begin to cultivate land that he owned. He did so to generate more income that would enable him to support his family. Alejandro, like the majority of farmers in Ticuantepe, grows pineapple, which he must give the proper care so that he can produce a full, healthy harvest. He will use the loan money to buy inputs that will enable him to improve production yield. He has discovered over the years that he enjoys doing this job, and that's why he will continue to use loans in order to improve his farm and become a better farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandro José tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos estudiantes. Habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, y se dedica junto a su esposa a la agricultura. Hace 6 años decidió empezar a cultivar unas tierras que tenía, esto en busca de generar ingresos que le permitieran la manutención de su familia. Alejandro como la mayoría de agricultores de Ticuantepe, tiene sembrado piñas, a las cuales le debe de dar el mantenimiento necesario para que pueda salir una cosecha completa y sana. El uso del préstamo será para la compra de insumos que le permitan mejorar el rendimiento de la producción. Descubrió a través de estos años que ésta es la actividad que le gusta y es por eso que seguirá trabajando con créditos para así poder mejorar su finca y convertirse en un mayor agricultor.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs in order to improve production yield

loans.name: David Concepción

texts.es:
David, 26, lives in the Ticuantepe municipality. He is married and has one son, age 3. His wife is a storekeeper and helps pay household expenses. David works as a waitor and also sells tortillas. He has eight years of experience running this business, which he began with his own money. The money he is applying for will go towards improving construction of the tortilla-selling business so that it is more welcoming and can provide better service. His plan is to pay for his son's education and create a more decent life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

David tiene 26 años de edad, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, es casado y tiene un niño de 3 años de edad, su esposa es comerciante y ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Don David trabaja como mesero, y también se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene ocho años de experiencia en este negocio e inició con fondos propios. El dinero que está solicitando es para mejorar la construcción del local donde tiene el negocio de venta de tortillas para estar más cómodo y dar un mejor servicio. Sus planes son poder brindar ecuación a su hijo y tener una vida más digna para su familia.

loans.use: Improve the infrastructure of his tortilla-selling business

loans.name: Las Mañaneras Group

texts.es:
This is a very good communal bank group. The group meets its obligations with responsibility. The members of Las Mañaneras have a commitment with our organization (Fundación Agrocapital) to continue working and meeting their obligations. The group is maD. up of 13 people who work in a variety of business activities. Rosa, who shares the presidency of the group with Gregorio, as well as Justina, Sofia and Martiniana all work weaving blankets. Dorys is a street vendor selling juices, Agustina and Francisca each own a grocery store in their neighborhood, Alicia sell sports clothing, Felix takes care of a game salon, and, finally, Eusebia sells shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

En este grupo D. Banca Comunal es muy bueno, cumple con responsabilidad con sus obligaciones, tienen compromiso con nuestra institución D. continuar trabajando y cumpliendo con sus obligaciones. El grupo que está conformado por 13 personas se desenvuelve en diferentes tipos D. actividades: por ejemplo Rosa que es su presidenta junto con Gregorio, Justina, Sofia y Martiniana se desenvuelven en el rubro D. los servicios en general. Hilarion venD. ropa desD. hace 3 años atrás, Mercedes se dedica al tejido D. mantas, Dorys en vendedora ambulante D. jugos, Agustina y Francisca tienen su tienda D. abarrotes en los barrios donD. viven, Alicia venD. ropa deportiva, Felix atienD. un local D. juegos y por último Eusebia venD. zapatos.

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Picaflor Group

texts.es:
The Picaflor group is maD. up of 14 people, among them 13 women and one man, Zeñon, who works selling household gadgets on the plaza "16 D. julio" . Apart from that work, Zeñon is also a carpenter who sells furniture on the same plaza on fair days. Doña Blanca, the founder of the group, returns in this third loan cycle with an excellent payment history earned in the two previous cycles. She travels to the Desguadero River transporting merchandise back and forth. The other members of the group work handcrafting sweaters and shawls. Most of the group's members have stable businesses and average earnings. Mary sells essential and convenience store items, Elena sells CDs, Adriana and Venancio weave blankets, Rosalia has a general store, Magdalena sells clothing for infants, Nancy has a grocery store, Leocadia sells stockings, Jimena sells lingerie, Filomena makes sweaters, Carolina sells shoes and finally, Carolina tends to her own grocery stand.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Grupo conformado por 14 personas entre el grupo D. mujeres existe un varón, Zenón, que se dedica a la venta D. artefactos en la 16 D. julio, a parte D. esa actividad es carpintero que en días D. feria va a vender muebles en la 16 D. julio. Doña Blanca fundadora del grupo Picaflor ingresa como nueva en este tercer ciclo con un antecedente muy bueno que se gano en los dos ciclos anteriores.
