Esta señora se dedica a la venta D. artefactos y general. Ella viaja al desaguadero llevando y trayendo mercadería. Las otras socias se dedican al tejido D. chompas y mantillas. La mayoría tiene negocios estables y con ingresos medios. Mary tiene una venta D. viveres, Elena venD. CDs, Adriana y Venancio tejen mantas, Rosalia se dedica al comercio general, Magdalena venD. ropa D. bebe, Nancy tiene su tienda D. abarrotes, Leocadia venD. medias, Jimena venD. lencería, Filomena teje chompas, Carolina venD. calzados y por último Carolina atienD. en su puesto D. abarrotes.

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Rosas De Ballivian Group

texts.es:
The Rosas de Ballivian group is in its fourth loan cycle and is made up of returning members and new members. The group's members have an excellent payment history with no payment problems and the group's meetings have always taken place on time. In the current loan cycle we expect the same excellent payment behavior. This group is almost a family with each member working in a different business. The group's president, Elsa, works selling prepared food, Patricio is a chauffeur who owns his own car service business, Armando sells sports clothing and Angélica is a street vendor. Yovana, Violeta, Viviana, María Elena, Dominga and Emma own stores whileTrinidad sells prepared food and Felicidad sells sweaters.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El grupo ROSAS DE BALLIVIAN se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo, conformado por antiguos y nuevas, con excelente comportamiento pagaron sus cuotas sin ningún problema, las reuniones se llevan a cabo en hora exacta, por la temporada algunas socias del grupo se rebajaron el monto, con la esperanza de que en el próximo desembolso o ciclo se solicitará montos de acuerdo a su categoría correspondiente, en este ciclo que va en marcha se espera el mismo comportamiento del grupo, son casi un grupo familiar que tienen diferentes actividades. Su presidenta Elsa se dedica a la venta de comida, Patricio es chofer propietario, Armando vende ropa deportiva, Angélica en vendedora ambulante, Yovana, Violeta, Viviana, Maria Elena, Dominga y Emma se dedican al comercio en general, Trinidad vende comida y Felicidad vende chompas.

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Señora Ana María is 50 years old. She went to school up to the 5th grade. She didn't finish school because she got married. She has 3 children who currenlty work.

This entrepreneur began by selling jewelry in small quantity out of her home located in the district of San Pedro in the state of La Libertad. Since she wanted to grow her business, she decided to join the communal bank called "San Pedrito". With the first loan she obtained, she purchased jewelry. With this loan, which she will repaid within 6 months, she will purchase gold and silver jewelry.

She also works along her husband who has a carpentry shop. He makes the furniture and she's in charge of selling it.

Señora Ana is president of her communal bank and she's happy to work for the well-being of other women. Her dream is to one day be able to buy a locale where she can sell her jewelry from.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana María, está casada, tiene 50 años, estudió hasta 5to año de secundaria no continuó estudiando porque se casó, tiene 03 hijos, se encuentran trabajando. La empresaria empezó vendiendo alhajas, joyas, pero en pequeña cantidad en su casa en el Distrito de San Pedro de Lloc en la Provincia de Pacasmayo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Como quería incrementar el negocio decidió participar en el Banco Comunal “SAN PEDRITO” y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró joyas. Con el crédito de S/. 1500.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses tiene pensado comprar joyas, alhajas de oro y plata. La socia además trabaja con su esposo en su carpintería el confecciona los muebles pero es ella quien se dedica a la venta de los mismos y a conseguir clientes. La señora Ana es presidenta en el banco comunal al que pertenece y está muy contenta de trabajar por el bienestar de otras mujeres. Sueña con comprar un local para una tienda de joyas.

loans.use: To purchase gold and silver jewelry

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: Sandra Marilu

texts.es:
Señora Sandra Marilú is 33 years old. She's a single mother. She studied to become a First Response assistant but she never got to exercised. She also studied cosmetology and couture. She has one son who goes to primary school. She lives in the district of Trujillo in La Libertad.

This entrepreneur has bought a name-brand sewing machine and since she's very knowledgeable when it comes to sewing, she decided to start making sports apparel. Since she needed to make more money, she began to sew other types of clothing. She decided to take her mom's advice to join the communal bank called "Luz Divine" (Divine Light) and with her first loan she obtained money to purchased fabrics, thread, cotton, etc.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she's hoping to buy more cotton, fabrics, thread, elastics, etc. to make intimate apparel.

She hopes to one day be able to provide sewing jobs to other women in the area and to be able to export their clothing.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sandra Marilú, tiene 33 años, es madre soltera, estudió la carrera de auxiliar en educación la cual nunca ejerció, así también estudió cosmetología y costura, tiene 01 hijo, es estudiante del nivel primaria, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad-Perú. La empresaria ha comprado una maquina remalladora y como tiene conocimientos sobre confección de ropa empezó a confeccionar polos deportivos pero necesitaba mayor capital para ampliar su negocio y dedicarse a la confección de otro tipo de prendas, por lo que aceptó la invitación de su mamá par integrar el Banco Comunal “LUZ DIVINA” y con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 compró telas, algodón, hilos, etc. Con el crédito de S/. 800.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses tiene pensado comprar algodón, telas, hilos, encajes, elásticos para confeccionar ropa interior. La socia sueña con tener una empresa sólida, dar trabajo a otras mujeres y porque no poder exportar sus prendas.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread, elastics, etc.

loans.name: Sartawi Group

texts.es:
SARTAWI is a communal bank group that works with our organization (Fundación Agrocapital). At the close of the group's last loan cycle they had demonstrated a good history of making their scheduled payments. In this new cycle the group, now led by Juan Felix, includes both returning and new members. Juan Felix, like Juan, Fanny, Juan C., Francisca and Jhovina, owns a store. Maria Isabel sells American clothing, Victoria also sells clothing, but of all types, Julio sells soft drinks, Beatriz is a teacher, Elizabeth is a seamstress who makes clothing, Ana is a salesperson in a pastry business and Maria Victoria tends to a wallyball (a combination of volleyball and racquetball) court.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

(SARTAWI es un grupo D. Banca Comunal que trabaja con nuestra institución, al cierre D. su anterior ciclo demostraron un buen comportamiento en cuanto al pago D. sus cuotas. Este nuevo ciclo tiene personas antiguas y nuevas que ahora están liderizadas por Juan Felix que junto a Juan, Fanny, Juan C., Francisca y Jhovina se dedican al comercio en general. Maria Isabel venD. ropa americana, Victoria también venD. ropa pero D. todo tipo, Julio venD. refrescos, Beatriz es profesora, Elizabeth costura prendas D. vestir, Ana trabaja en una repostería es encargada D. ventas y Maria Victoria atienD. un Wally.

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: María Zoila

texts.es:
Señora María Zoila P. C. is 58 years old. She's a single mother. She didn't finish high school because she got engaged at an early age. She has a total of 6 children. Three are currently working and the other 3 are going to school. Her economic situation was not good to begin with so she started to do laundry (wash clothes by hand) of people she knew. She always wanted to start her own business but she never had the money to do so, but with this job she was able to save some money. She began by selling sandwiches and refreshments and some jewelry for gifts out of her house located in the district of San Pedro de Lloc in the state of La Libertad.

One of her friends recommended her to the Communal Bank called "La Libertad" and with the first loan she obtained she bought some jewelry (rings, necklaces, etc.)

She has been a partner with Manuela Ramos for about 6 years. She committs in paying this loan back within 6 months. She plans to purchase ingredients to make sandwiches and purchase refreshments (soda and beer). Her goal is to see her 3 kids graduate from school and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María Zoila P. C., tiene 58 años, es madre soltera, estudió hasta 2do año de secundaria no continuó estudiando porque se comprometió con un joven, tiene 06 hijos, 03 trabajan y 03 son estudiantes. Su situación económica no era muy buena por lo que Para ayudarse empezó lavando ropa a particulares, siempre pensaba en tener un negocio pero no tenía capital para hacerlo, con lo que pudo ahorrar de su trabajo se dedicó a la venta de tortas, gaseosa, cerveza y algunas joyas para regalos, en su casa en el distrito de San Pedro de Lloc en la Provincia de Pacasmayo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Una amiga la animó a participar en el Banco Comunal “LIBERTAD” y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró joyas: sortijas, cadenitas, dijes. La socia viene trabajando seis años con Manuela Ramos y con el préstamo de S/. 2500.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses tiene pensado comprar adornos para la decoración de sus tortas, cerveza, gaseosa. Tiene como meta ver a sus tres hijos profesionales.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make sandwiches and to purchase refreshments (soda and beer)

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: Urania Del Carmen

texts.es:
Urania is a commercial carrier. She has a taxi which she hires out. She is 47 years old, is married and her husband dedicates himself to selling used cars. She has three children one of whom is independent and the rest are of school age. Four years ago she was able to acquire the taxi with her own savings. She hopes in the future to acquire another vehicle to be able to hire it out to obtain greater income for her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to plaster the walls in her home which she has been improving slowly and which she hopes will be finished soon.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Urania es transportista. Tiene un vehículo taxi al que alquila a una persona determinada para su uso. Tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, su esposo se dedica a la venta de autos usados. Tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales uno ya es independiente, y los otros dos se encuentran en edad escolar. Hace 4 años logró adquirir el vehículo taxi productos de ahorros propios. Espera en un futuro poder adquirir otro vehículo para así poder alquilarlo y tener más ingresos para su familia. El préstamo lo usará para repellar las paredes de su vivienda, la que ha ido mejorando poco a poco y espera terminarla pronto.

loans.use: Stucco of walls in home.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
The Santa Maria group is a new grouped formed in the RIncón del Tigre neighborhood, with 15 members, each of whom will repay the loan through the proceeds of a different business activity. All of the members of the group have a guarantee to repay their loan; if someone is unable to repay their loan, the group will assume responsibility for its repayment. The members of the group all know each other and are able guarantee the repayment of their fellow members because they know them well. Eladia is the president of the group; she works baking bread. Irma sells prepared foods, Juan is a bricklayer, Luis is the caretaker of a building, Nancy is a nurse's aide, Modesta works as a cleaning woman, Agustina sells empanadas, Mirtha sells clothing, Viviana sells beauty products, Verónica sels bread, Belizaida is a domestic worker, Marcela sells clothing, Marco has a transport business and Martha and Daniela both sell bread.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El grupo Santa Maria es un grupo nuevo que se a formado en un barrio denominado barrio Rincón del Tigre, con un total de 15 personas las cuales cuentan cada una con diferentes actividades para poder cancelar sus cuotas son personas que cuentan con una garantía para su crédito. Todos se conoces y garantizan debido a que se conocen muy bien. Eladia es la presidenta y se dedica a la elaboración de pan, Irma vende comida, Juan es albañil, Luis es portero, Nancy trabaja como auxiliar de enfermería, Modesta trabaja como empleada de limpieza, Agustina vende empanadas, Mirtha vende ropa, Viviana es promotora de productos de belleza, Verónica vende pan, Belizaida es empleada doméstica, Marcela vende ropa, Marco se dedica al transporte, Martha y Daniela también venden pan.

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs. Maritza Elizabeth, is 47 years old, is married, and studied until the 5th year of secondary school and did continue to study because she got married. She has 4 children, 3 of which are working, and her last daughter is a student of secondary school level.

To help herself economically, 2 years ago she began to sell chicken in the market and also has a cosmetology business in her home in the District of San Pedro de Lloc, in the Province of Pacasmayo, in the Department of La Libertad. While working in the market she met a lady who received loans from Manuela Ramos, through her invitation she was able to become a member of the “Liberty” Communal Bank.

She began to sell more, and with the first loan of S/. 300.00 she purchased a scale, which she urgently needed because she rented one and that had become very costly. With the loan of S/. 1000.00 that will be repaid within 6 months, she intends to invest in the purchase of chicken, hair dyes, curling products and scissors. The entrepreneur dreams of seeing her daughter become a professional, and she will continue working for her future. In the short-term she would like to buy a television and fix her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maritza Elizabeth, tiene 47 años, está casada, estudió hasta 5to año de secundaria no continuó estudiando porque se casó, tiene 04 hijos, 03 se encuentran trabajando, y su ultima hija es estudiante del nivel secundaria. Para ayudarse económicamente se dedica hace 02 años a vender pollo en el mercadillo y también tiene un negocio de cosmetología en su casa en el Distrito de San Pedro de Lloc en la Provincia de Pacasmayo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Como ella trabaja en el mercado sé conoció con una señora que solicitaba crédito en Manuela Ramos, por invitación de ella ingresa al Banco Comunal “LIBERTAD”, empezó a vender más, y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró 01 balanza, la que necesitaba con urgencia porque al no tenerla la alquilaba y eso le resultaba muy costoso. Con el crédito de S/. 1000.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses tiene pensado invertir en la compra de pollo, tintes, liquido para ondulaciones, tijeras. La empresaria sueña con ver a su hija profesional para lo cual tiene que continuar trabajando además a un corto plazo quiere comprar un televisor y arreglar su casa.

loans.use: Purchase poultry as well as hair dye and other supplies.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: Caridad Del Rocio

texts.es:
Mrs. Caridad del Rocio is married, is 35 years old, is an elementary school teacher, and has 2 sons, they are students at the primary and secondary school levels respectively. To help herself economically, apart from working in a kindergarten class, 8 years ago she began working in the development of educational materials. She also works on sashes for beauty queens and sells jewelry at her home in the District of San Pedro de Lloc, in Pacasmayo Province, in the Department of La Libertad.

The entrepreneur is a member of the "Libertad" Communal Bank; her mother is a founding partner of the bank and thanks her for her entry into the communal bank. Three years ago she began working with Manuela Ramos.

With the first loan of S/. 300.00 received, she invested in jewelry, thread, ribbons, and fabric. The amount of S/. 1500.00 that will be repaid within 6 months, will buy embroidery ribbon, zippers, buttons, thread, etc. In addition she will have enough money to purchase a computer for her children. She dreams of her children becoming professionals and to have a house of her own because she is currently living in her mother’s house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Caridad del Rocío está casada, tiene 35 años, es profesora de educación inicial, tiene 02 hijos, son estudiantes del nivel primario y secundario respectivamente. Para ayudarse económicamente, a parte de trabajar en un jardín de niños dicta clases particulares y hace 8 años se dedica a la elaboración de material educativo así como también bandas para reinas y vende alhajas en su casa en el Distrito de San Pedro de Lloc en la Provincia de Pacasmayo en el Departamento de La Libertad. La empresaria pertenece al Banco Comunal “LIBERTAD”, su Mamá es socia fundadora de este banco y gracias ella ingreso al banco comunal. Hace tres años viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió invirtió en joyas, hilos, cintas, tela. Con el crédito de S/. 1500.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses comprará bordados en cinta, cierres, botones, hilos etc. Y además completará para la compra de un computador para sus hijos. La socia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una casa propia porque actualmente está viviendo en la casa de su Mamá.

loans.use: Purchase ribbon, buttons, thread, etc.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: 16 De Nobiembre Group

texts.es:
The "November 16th" group is a new group that was formed with people from two different existing groups. The 12 people who are in the group are partners who want to better themselves through their own businesses. The largest subset of the group's members sell sweets outsiD. of the graD. school "La Floresta". The loan will allow them to stock more products and a wider variety of products. The president of the group is Elena, who has a business in her home. In the photo, only 10 members appear because the other two members were working and didn't arrive in time for the photo. Petrona is an employee in a local business , Marelene sells prepared food, Aida sells clothing, Ignacio does bodywork on cars, Rolando is a painter, Rosa sells empanadas, Adrian sells American clothing, Roberto sells vegetables, Eldy and Victoria sells sweets and finally, Alberto is also currently employed by a local business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Grupo 16 D. noviembre es un grupo nuevo que se formo con 2 personas D. diferentes grupos. Las 12 personas que estan en el grupo son socios y socias que quieren superarse en su negocio. La mayor parte D. los integrantes venden dulces fuera del colegio la floresta en los tres turnos y el credito le servira para surtir y ampliar con nuevos productos para su venta. El grupo esta con la presidencia D. la sra. Elena quien cuenta con un negocio y casa propia. En la foto solo aparecen 10 personas por lo que dos estaban trabajando y no llegaron a tiempo para la foto. Petrona es empleada, Marelene venD. comida, Aida venD. ropa, Ignacio hace chapería, Rolando es pintor, Rosa venD. empanadas, Adrian venD. ropa americana, Roberto venD. verduras, Eldy y Victoria venden pastillas y por último Alberto es empleado.

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria de los Angeles is married, is 40 years old, and studied until her 5th year of secondary school and did not continue studying because she did not want to, and preferred having a business. She has 2 children and they are elementary school students.

To help herself economically she began selling candy in her home 20 years ago, in the District of San Pedro de Lloc, in the Province of Pacasmayo, in the Department of La Libertad. She needed capital to expand her business and decided to join the "San Pedrito" Communal Bank; she currently has a small shop in the main square of San Pedro.

In the communal bank she obtained her first loan of S/. 300.00 with which she purchased soft drinks, sweets, chocolates, etc. With the amount of S/. 500.00 that she will repay within 4 months she intends to buy sweets, cookies, caramels, chocolates, sweets, etc. Her dream is to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María de los Angeles está casada, tiene 40 años, estudió hasta 5to año de secundaria no continuó estudiando porque no quiso, le gustó más el negocio tiene 02 hijos, son estudiantes del nivel primaria. Para ayudarse económicamente empezó hace 20 años vendiendo dulces, en su casa en el Distrito de San Pedro de Lloc en la Provincia de Pacasmayo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Pero como la socia necesitaba capital para ampliar su negocio decidió incorporarse al Banco Comunal “SAN PEDRITO” actualmente tiene una pequeña tienda en la plaza de armas de San Pedro. En el banco comunal obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con el cual compró gaseosas, golosinas, chocolates, etc. Con el crédito de S/. 500.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses tiene pensado comprar golosinas, galletas, caramelos, chocolates, dulces, etc. Su sueño es poder comprar un carro.

loans.use: Purchase sweets at wholesale.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: Cecilia Pairazaman

texts.es:
Mrs. Cecilia is 34 years old, is married, and studied until her 4th year of secondary school but did not continue studying because she became engaged. She has 3 children, one child is working and the others are students.

The entrepreneur began selling bananas at a small table as well as biscuits, and soft drinks with her own capital in her house located in the District of San Pedro D. Lloc, in the Province of Pacasmayo, in the Department of La Libertad. Since she needed more capital to expand her business she decided to participate in the "San Pedrito" Communal Bank, as she received the loans she implemented her business.

With the first loan she received of S/. 300.00, she bought soft drinks, toilet paper, etc. With the loan of S/. 1000.00, that she intends to repay within 6 months, she plans to invest in the purchase of potatoes, eggs, noodles, cookies, candy, chicken, and vegetables. Her partner is the secretary of the communal bank to which she belongs, and is very happy with all the members working with Cecilia to enable her to perform her job well. Her goal is to buy a stall at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Cecilia tiene 34 años, está casada, estudió hasta 4to año D. secundaria, no continuó estudiando porque se comprometió, tiene 3 hijos, 1 que está trabajando y los demás son estudiantes. La empresaria empezó a vender en una mesita plátanos, bizcochos, gaseosas, con un capital propio en su casa en el Distrito D. San Pedro D. Lloc en la Provincia D. Pacasmayo en el Departamento D. La Libertad, como necesitaba mayor capital para ampliar su negocio decidió participar en el Banco Comunal “SAN PEDRITO” conforme iba recibiendo los préstamos implementaban el negocio. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que recibió compró gaseosa, papel higiénico, etc. Con el crédito D. S/. 1000.00 que cancelará en un plazo D. 06 meses tiene pensado invertir en la compra D. papa, huevos, fideos, galletas, dulces, pollo, verduras. La socia es secretaria en el banco comunal al que pertenece, está muy contenta con su cargo porque todas las socias colaboran con ella para que pueda realizar bien su trabajo. Tiene como meta comprar un puesto en el mercado.

loans.use: Purchase a selection of groceries.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ligia has a small business selling clothing from her home. She lives in the Ticuantepe municipality. She is 39 years old, is married and has two children who are in school. Her husband helps support the family from the income he obtains as a commercial carrier. Ligia has had her business for seven years and she carries it out with a lot of effort and dedication because with her business she helps her husband so that all the burden is not on him. Also, her husband has allowed her to grow as a small businesswoman and in turn to feel useful to society and her family. With the loan she is requesting, her business selling women’s clothes will improve since she currently relies on a small inventory of these products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Ligia tiene una pequeña venta de ropa en su casa de habitación, con la cual surte a los vecinos de su barrio. Habita en el Municipio de Ticuantepe, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos estudiantes. Su esposo la apoya en la manutención del hogar con los ingresos obtenidos de su actividad que es transportista. Ligia tiene 7 años de tener el negocio, lo cual lo desarrolla con gran esfuerzo y dedicación porque con éste apoya a su marido y no le deja toda la carga a él. Además que le ha permitido desarrollarse como mujer microempresaria y también sentirse más útil a la sociedad y a su familia. Con el préstamo solicitado aumentará su negocio en ropa para dama ya que actualmente cuenta con poco inventario de este producto.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to stock business.

loans.name: Nancy Piedad

texts.es:
Mrs. Nancy Piedad is 50 years old, is widowed, and completed her 4th year of secondary school but did not want to continue studying. She has 2 children, one son studies in Senati and her second son works as a driver. She lives in the District of San Pedro de Lloc, in the Province de Pacasmayo, in the Department of La Libertad.

The entrepreneur sells prepared food and snacks, this was her mother’s business but due to illness Nancy inherited and manages the business. A neighbor invited her to participate in the "Libertad” Communal Bank. With the first loan received of S/. 300.00, she bought sweets, rice, oil, vegetable stew, sugar, chicken, meats, etc. She has been working with her partner, Manuela Ramos, for three years.

With the S/.1500.00 loan that she will pay within 6 months she plans to buy rice, sugar, milk, noodles, etc. She dreams of seeing her children become professionals, for them she has to work every day with more effort especially as a single mother that receives no support from the father of her children. She also dreams of slowly purchasing some articles such as a TV, DVD player and sound equipment for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nancy Piedad tiene 50 años, es viuda, estudió hasta 4to año de secundaria, no quiso seguir estudiando, tiene 02 hijos, un hijo estudia en Senati y su otro hijo trabaja en una combi (transporte), vive en el Distrito de San Pedro de Lloc en la Provincia de Pacasmayo en el Departamento de La Libertad. La empresaria se dedica a la venta de comida y de golosinas, este negocio era de su mamá, pero por motivos de enfermedad se lo dejó para que lo administre. Una vecina la invitó a participar en el Banco Comunal “LIBERTAD”, y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró golosinas, arroz, aceite, menestras, azúcar, pollo, carne, etc. La socia viene trabajando tres años con Manuela Ramos. Con el préstamo de S/.1500.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses piensa comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, tallarines, etc. Sueña con ver a sus hijos profesionales para lo cual tiene que trabajar cada día con mayor esfuerzo porque es madre soltera y no tiene apoyo del papá de los niños. Sueña también con ir comprando poco a poco algunos artefactos como televisor, DVD, equipo de sonido para su casa.

loans.use: Purchase supplies at wholesale.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es:
The association “Siempre Adelante” [Always moving forward] has worked for many years with the micro-lender Pro-mujer, a Kiva field partner. Association members are from the “Los Andes” zone in the city of El Alto, Bolivia. Most of the members are married with an average of 6 children each, and their children are of varying ages. Group members perform a variety of activities. Arminda, for example, is dedicated to the sale of beef, and Marcelina has a grocery store in her neighborhood. We could mention Leticia’s work, which involves selling gold jewelry. She travels to various parts of the city of La Paz, including Batallas and Achacachi, in order to sell her jewels, taking advantage of holidays when the women dress in their finest attire. Leticia sells her wares for cash or on credit, as do many of her fellow association members. For this reason they need capital in order to invest in their businesses and prosper as both businesswomen and housewives.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La asociación “Siempre Adelante” trabaja hace muchos años junto a la familia de Pro-mujer, la podemos encontrar en el centro focal de la zona Los Andes ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Casadas en su mayoría con un promedio de 6 hijos cada una de distintas edades. Existen diversas actividades dentro el grupo, es el caso de Arminda que se dedica a la venta de carne de res o Marcelina tiene una tienda de consumo en su barrio, podemos mencionar la actividad de Leticia que se dedica a la venta de joyas en oro, para lo cual realiza viajes a Batallas, Achacachi, y otras localidades de la ciudad de La Paz, para poder comercializar sus joyas, aprovechando fechas festivas donde las mujeres lucen sus mejores galas, vendiendo al contado y también a crédito. Por lo que al igual que sus compañeras de grupo necesita capital para invertir en su negocio, y de ésta manera prosperar tanto como empresaria como ama de casa.

loans.use: This group needs capital in order to invest in a variety of retail businesses.

loans.name: Zoraida De Los Angel

texts.es:
Zoraida is 52 years old and for 20 years has had a grocery store in her home. She lives in the Ticuantepe municipality. With her own efforts she was able to establish this business in which she has been successful and hopes to continue to be successful. Her husband is a farmer and Zoraida sells some of his harvests in her store. All of their children are married. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase various articles for her grocery store in order to have it well stocked so that she can maintain the clients who currently shop daily at her store. She hopes for an increase in her business to obtain better profits and to be able to grow in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Zoraida tiene 52 años de edad y 20 años de tener una pulpería en su vivienda. Habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe y con esfuerzos propios pudo poner este pequeño negocio, en el cual cuenta que le ha ido bien y que espera que vaya bien como hasta ahora. Su esposo es agricultor y parte de los productos que cosecha Doña Zoraida los vende en su pulpería. Todos sus hijos ya son casados. El préstamo será usado para la compra de artículos varios para su pulpería y así no dejar de tenerla surtida para poder mantener a sus clientes que diariamente asisten a comprar a su negocio. Espera aumenta el negocio para obtener mejores resultados, y llegar a poner una miscelánea y crecer como comerciante.

loans.use: Purchase of articles to invest in her grocery store.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
Karla has been working as a cashier in an electronics store for a year. She is 33 and a single mother of three, with a lot of effort she has managed to raise them well, she also has the support of the father of two of her sons. She wants to give her family a good house, that’s why she will use the loan to tile the floor of her house. Later on she will improve the rooms of her house, so her children can live more comfortable. She thinks that a single woman has to endure more sacrifices, but she endures them proudly because she wants to have a stable and happy family.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Karla es asalariada, trabaja como cajera en una tienda de electrodomésticos, tiene un año de tener este trabajo. Tiene 33 años y es madre soltera de 3 hijos, a los cuales con mucho sacrificio los ha sacado adelante, aunque cuenta con la ayuda del padre de dos de sus hijos. Desea darle una vivienda digna a su familia, por eso con el crédito le pondrá cerámica al piso de su vivienda. Y después invertirá en la mejora de las habitaciones de su vivienda para así darles más comodidad a sus hijos. Piensa que la mujer soltera tiene muchos más sacrificios, pero ella orgullosa los hace porque quiere formar una familia estable y feliz.

loans.use:
Tile the floor of her house

Poner cerámica en el piso de su vivienda

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
Karla is 29 years old and lives in the Enramadas neighborhood of Ticuantepe, Nicaragua. She is single and has two children ages 12 and 9 months.

Karla’s business involves selling fruit at the eastern market, and she began this work through her own efforts. She now has 16 years of experience. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more products and thereby obtain better earnings from her sales.

In the future she hopes to increase sales and improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Karla tiene 29 años de edad, habita en el barrio las Enramadas del municipio de Ticuantepe, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 12 años y uno de 9 meses. Su negocio es venta de frutas y las vende en el mercado oriental, e inició con esfuerzos propios, tiene dieciséis años de experiencia. Con la solicitud que está haciendo es para comprar más productos y así obtener más ganancias con las ventas. A futuro es incrementar más las ventas y mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gloria Magdalena

texts.es:
Gloria Magdalena is 61 years old, married, completed grade school but couldn’t complete high school because she didn’t have the support of her dad, she has 3 sons and all of them are currently working. She started her business 35 years ago with the little savings she had. She sold Mondongo (local soup) in a spot at the San Pedro de Lloc market. She saved all her earnings until she had enough to buy and sell small groceries and liquor from her house in the San Pedro de Lloc district, at the Pacasmayo province, in the Libertad area.

She has been a member of the Banco Comunal “LIBERTAD” for four years and with her first loan of 300 PEN she purchased noodles, rice, sugar, stew, etc.

With the loan for 1000 PEN, which she will pay back in six months, she plans to purchase rice, sugar and oil, do to the current high prices its better for her to buy in bulk to get better prices.

Currently her husband is sick, she is in charge of maintaining the household, she is reliable and a hard worker.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gloria Magdalena tiene 61 años, está casada, estudió primaria completa, no pudo continuar estudiando porque su papá no la apoyó, tiene 03 hijos, ellos actualmente están trabajando. Se inició en el negocio hace 35 años, con poco dinero que tenía ahorrado, vendiendo mondongo en un puesto del mercado de abastos de San Pedro de Lloc, lo que ganaba lo iba ahorrando y cuando tuvo algo más de dinero se dedicó a la venta de abarrotes y licor, en su casa en el Distrito de San Pedro de Lloc en la Provincia de Pacasmayo en el Departamento de La Libertad.

Hace 4 años pertenece al Banco Comunal “LIBERTAD” y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 invirtió en la compra de tallarines, arroz, azúcar, menestras, etc.

Con el crédito de S/. 1000.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses comprará arroz, azúcar y aceite porque como los precios han subido últimamente le conviene comprar al por mayor para obtener mejores precios.

Actualmente su esposo se encuentra delicado de salud, la señora es la que se encarga de generar ingresos para poder subsistir, es responsable y luchadora.

loans.use:
Purchase products for her store.

Compra de diversos productos (abarrotes).

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: Ortencia

texts.es:
Second Loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=30374&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Ortencia is a member of Banco Comunal Azucenas.

Ortencia is married, 52 years old and has 9 sons, of which only one of them still lives with her. Ortencia has a store located at her house in the Miraflores neighborhood. There she sells groceries, fruits, vegetables and meats, which she buys from whole sellers and markets in the city where she goes early in the morning everyday. Ortencia also sales meals on Sundays at the “America’s Fair”, she always has the help and support of her husband and daughter.

Ortencia needs a loan of 1050 PEN to purchase rice, sugar, tuna and milk.

Ortencia’s dreams are to improve her house, expand her business and have her sons become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Segundo prestamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=30374&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Ortencia es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.

Ortencia es casada, tiene 52 años y 9 hijos de los cuales solo 1 vive con ella, Ortencia tiene una tienda en su casa que esta ubicada en el barrio Miraflores, donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas , carnes, sus productos los compra de las tiendas mayoristas y del mercado de abastos de la ciudad a donde va diariamente por las madrugadas. Además Ortencia los días domingos vende comida, bebidas en la feria las Américas, en ambos negocios cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo e hija.

Ortencia necesita un préstamo de 1050 dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, atún y leche.

Los sueños de Ortencia son mejorar su casa, ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use:
Ortencia needs a loan for 1050 PEN which is going to be used to purchase rice, sugar, pasta, tuna and milk.

Ortencia necesita un préstamo de 1050 dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, atún y leche.

loans.name: Ni Made Indah Sutant

texts.id:
Made Indah Sutanti was still young when married to Nengah Koden. Since then Made Indah Sutanti was given capital to run the food stall and also the activities to increase family's income. Since capital was low, her items had no variations, and had very low volume. Through Traditional organiztion in her village, who is already included in Dinari foundation, Made Indah Sutanti obtained a loan. From this loan Made Indah Sutanti could expand the food stall by obtaining additional stall needs, and add several variation. From this business Made Indah Sutanti could obtain profit of Rp40,000-50,000. (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00). From this Made Indah Sutanti could help Nengah Koden income, and their 3 year old child. Her hope is that in future the business could expand and obtain increase income.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Made Indah Sutanti masih dalam usia muda sudah dipersunting menjadi istri Nengah Koden.Sejak itulah juga Made Indah Sutanti diberi modal untuk mengurus warungnya sekalian menjadi kegiatan yang dapat menambah pendapatan keluarganya. Karena belum mempunyai modal usaha warungnya maka barang dangannya tidak bervariasi dan jumlahnya pun masih sedikit. Melalui Lembaga Adat yang ada di desanya yang sudah bergabung menjadi binaan Yayasan DINARI, Made Indah Sutanti mendapat pinjaman dana. Dari pinjaman dana ini Made indah Sutanti dapat mengembangkan usaha warung dengan melengkapi kebutuhan belanja warungnya, serta menambah berbagai macam variasi kebutuhan warungnya. Dari usaha inilah Made Indah Sutanti dapat memperoleh keuntungan Rp. 40.000.- s/d Rp. 50.000.- dari usaha inilah Made Indah Sutanti dapat membantu pendapatan Nengah Koden dan seorang anaknya yang masih berumur 3 tahun. Harapan kedepannya usaha ini dapat berkembang sehingga dapat memperoleh penghasilan lebih meningkat.

loans.use: To increase capital for additional variation in her food stall (Menambah modal usaha untuk melengkapi variasi dagangan di warungnya)

loans.name: Jero Kadek Windri

texts.id:
Cow raising was initially done to assist in husband's work. However, after several years and promising profit, Jero Kadek Windri tried to raise other people's cow by profit sharing system. Jero Kadek Windri's dream for future is to own her cows, however it was still not possible. Her dreams becomes reality after Jero Kadek Windri obtained a loan from Tempek organization (a traditional Balinese organization) in her village, and Tempek was grown by DINARI foundation. That loan was used to buy a mother cow that is raised well. Jero Kadek Windri obtained assistance and training regarding her cow's health, and was done systematically by DINARI foundation. Within one year profit obtained was one male calf that was sold for Rp 3,000,000. (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00). From this cow farming Jero Kadek Windri could obtain additional income besides her husband's income.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan beternak sapi pada awalnya hanyalah membantu pekerjaan suaminya. Namun setelah berjalan beberapa tahun dan mendapatkan keuntungan yang menjanjikan, maka Jero Kadek Windri mencoba untuk memelihara sapi kepunyaan orang lain dengan cara sistem bagi hasil. Impian Jero Kadek Windri untuk masa yang akan datang dapat mempunyai sapi miliknya sendiri, namun saat ini masih belum tercapai. Impiannya dapat terwujud setelah Jero Kadek Windri mendapat dana pinjaman dari Lembaga Tempek ( organisasi adat di Bali ) yang ada didesanya dan Tempek tersebut merupakan Tempek binaan dari Yayasan DINARI. Dana tersebut dipakai untuk membeli satu ekor induk sapi dan dipelihara dengan sangat baik. Jero Kadek Windri memperoleh pembinaan dan pelatihan tentang kesehatan ternak sapinya yang dilakukan secara berkala oleh Yayasan DINARI. Keuntungan yang diperoleh dalam satu tahun yaitu dapat memperoleh sekor anak sapi jantan yang dapat dijual Rp. 3.000.000.- Dari hasil beternak sapi inilah Jero Kadek Windri dapat memperoleh pendapatan tambahan selain dari pendapatan suaminya.

loans.use: To buy mother cow (Membeli induk sapi)

loans.name: Ni Putu Dian

texts.id:
Putu Dian is famous in her village as expert in Banten (items for Hindu prayer) although her age is still young. Expertise was obtained from her parents who is also in the business. Initially she only helped her mother, however after marriage she started the business to assist husband's income. With capital limitation, Putu Dian could only prepare these prayer items on daily basis. If there were a big order, usually it is done with her parents and other friends in the surrounding. To bridge the capital limitation, Putu Dian requested a loan to Lempek organization in her village, Lempek was grown by Dinari foundation. From here Putu Dian obtained the additional capital and also several guidance from Dinari Foundation. The loan obtained is used to buy raw materials, like coconut leaves, bamboo and other needs. From this Putu Dian could expand her business and assist in adding family income.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Putu Dian terkenal di desanya sebagi tukang Banten ( sarana persembahyangan umat Hindu ) walaupun usainya masih muda. Pengalaman ini didapat dari orang tuanya yang juga berusaha dagang seperti itu. Pada mulanya hanya sekedar membantu membatu ibunya, tapi setelah menikah mulailah usaha ini ditekuninya sebagai usaha yang dapat membantu pendapatan suaminya. Dengan keterbatasan modalnya maka Putu Dian membuat sarana sembahyang harian saja. Jika ada pesanan untuk persembahyangan skala besar, biasanya dikerjakan bersama orang tuanya dan beberapa temannya yang ada disekitarnya. Untuk mengatasi kekurangan modal usahanya, Putu Dian mengajukan pinjaman dana pada Lembaga Tempek yang ada didesanya yang sudah menjadi Tempek binaan Yayasan Dinari. Dari sinilah Putu Dian mendapatkan modal tambahan dan berbagai pembinaan yang diberikan oleh yayasan Dinari. Pinjaman yang didapatnya digunakan untuk membeli bahan baku, seperti daun kelapa, bambu dan keperluan lainnya. Dari usaha inilah Putu Dian dapat mengembangkan usahnya dan dapat membantu menambah penghasilan dalam keluarganya.

loans.use: To buy raw material (Membeli bahan baku)

loans.name: I Wayan Uma Wardana

texts.id:
Everybody dreams of expanding their business, so is Uma Wardana . The furniture business he started a year ago started to go, and has received many orders. Many efforts has been taken, like asking friends to work together, however it did not solve his challenges. The expensive wood raw materials and limited machineries/production tools are the main challenge in this business. Nowadays Uma Wardana .employs 3 carpenters on a daily pay system. On average they are paid Rp35,000/day. (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00). Every day those 3 carpenters could produce about Rp250,000. Not included electricity expense and equipment wear and tear. His products results are quite good, clean and guaranteed quality, since all carpenters work in their expertise, so that his customers increase. Dinari gave Rp10,000,000 additional loan for Uma Wardana, that was used to buy furniture making machinery and other raw materials. With this additional capital, Uma Wardana hopes that his business could increase, and fulfill all orders, so that his income would also increase.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Setiap Orang memiliki cita-cita untuk mengembangkan usaha yang di tekuninya. Begitu juga halnya dengan Uma Wardana .Usaha meubel yang telah dirintisnya sejak setahun belakangan ini kini mulai berjalan dan menerima banyak pesanan Namun karena keterbatasan modal membuat Uma Wardana belum bisa menerima semua pesanan yang masuk. Berbagai upaya telah diusahakan termasuk di antaranya meminta teman untuk bekerjasama, namun belum juga bisa menyelesaikan kesulitan yang dihadapi. Mahalnya bahan baku kayu dan terbatasnya mesin –mesin / alat produksi yang ada, masih menjadi kendala utama dalam usaha ini. Saat ini Uma wardana telah mempekerjakan 3 orang tukang dengan sistem gaji harian . Rata –rata mereka digaji Rp. 35.000.- / hari. Dan dalam sehari ke tiga tukang ini bisa berproduksi rata-rata Rp. 250.000.- Belum termasuk biaya listrik dan penyusutan alat-alat Barang- barang yang di produksinya hasilnya cukup baik, rapi dan kwalitasnya terjamin karena hampir semua tukang yang ada bekerja sesuai bidangnya.sehingga pelanggannya makin hari makin bertambah . Dinari memberi tambahan modal Rp 10.000.000 untuk mengembangkan usaha Umawardana yang olehnya di pergunakan untuk membeli mesin skap / serut dan bahan baku lainnya. Dengan tambahan modal ini Uma Wardana berharap usahanya akan lebih maju dan bisa memenuhi semua order, sehingga hasil yang di perolehpun akan meningkat.

loans.use: To buy furniture tools to support production (Membeli peralatan mebel yang mendukung produksinya)

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Soa V., 43, lives in Siem Reap with her husband, Sok Sarin, and their five children. Her husband is a trailer driver and travels to various locations around the city, making US$6 each day of income. Their son works in a local restaurant and his income helps to support the family as well, however, public transportation expenses have been rising rapidly alongside gasoline prices and it is expensive for him to commute to work each day. Soa V. has asked for a loan of US$300 to purchase a small motorbike for her son to commute to work each day. A small motorbike that is gas-efficient can save the family money and allow them to improve their lives with the extra funds.

loans.use: Soa would like to purchase a gas-efficient motorbike for her son to travel to work each day.

loans.name: Thlong

texts.en:
Mr. Thlong B., 36, is the Deputy Director of Chhuok Khsach Public Primary School, earning about $3 per day. His wife, Mrs. Tuon Sovan, also 36, earns about $2 per day selling cooked rice and food. They live in Baray Commune, Kampong Thom Province.

In order to increase the family's income, Mr. B. is requesting a loan of $700 to dig a pond to raise fish for sale, with the remainder of the money being used to purchase small pigs to be raised for sale by Mrs. Sovan. The loan will help them to improve their living conditions.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To dig a pond to raise fish for sale and to purchase small pigs to raise for profit

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan V., 40, is a widow living in Siem Reap with her four children. Each day she sells souvenir items out of her little stand near the temples of Angkor. She typically makes US$ 6 each day, but she has noticed a higher customer demand and believes she can increase her income.

Chan V. has asked for a loan of US$ 400 to purchase a wider variety of souvenir products to expand her business and reach more customers. With any extra profits that she accumulates, she would like to continue expanding her business and provide her customers with an even wider variety of products.

loans.use: Purchase more souvenir products for re-sale

loans.name: Nem

texts.en: Nem S., 35, sells fried bananas out of her home while her husband, Terb Bunthoeun, operates a motortaxi service. They live in Phnom Penh with their two children and they are seeking to improve their businesses. The fried banana business typically generates US$2.50 each day, while her husband makes US$4 per day operating his motortaxi service. The motortaxi business is struggling lately, because the motorbike needs to be replaced. With high gasoline prices, a motorbike needs to be especially gas-efficient to generate the maximum profit. Nem S. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband and with any leftover money, she would like to expand her own business.

loans.use: Nem would like to purchase a motortaxi for her husband's business.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long T., 40, lives in Phnom Penh with her husband, Yim Chhun, and their children. She sells fish in the local food market each day making US$3 per day, while her husband is a construction foreman and he makes US$3.5 per day. The family is also supported through the employment of one of the children who works in a local garment factory. Selling fish in the market typically involves purchasing them from a local fisherman and reselling them at a higher price. Long T. has seen customer demand rise for her business and right now the price of fish is rising. She has asked for a loan of US$1000 to invest in her business and to see it grow. She believes that this investment can help to increase her customer base and will provide improvements that can benefit her in the long term.

loans.use: Long would like to invest in her fish selling business.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang T., 55, lives in Phnom Penh with her two daughters, one son-in-law, and her three grandchildren. She purchases and resells recyclable materials, making US$3 per day, while her two daughters work in a local garment factory to help support the family. Hang T. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase more recyclable materials for her business, believing that she can increase her profits and expand her business with this investment. She looks forward to the opportunities that this loan will provide for her family and wants to see her family's standard of living improved.

loans.use: Purchase more recyclable materials

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: Mrs. Reth E. sells firewood in the village of Sre Sa Village iin Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Huon Yorng, gathers firewood for his wife to sell. They have six children, four of whom are attending school while the others are too young to work or enroll in school. Mrs. Reth E.'s family now lives in an old house and in poor conditions. In order to improve her living conditions, Mrs. Reth is requesting a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family. Mrs. Reth E. had previously obtained a loan to buy a cow for breeding and she has paid the loan back in full.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for her family

loans.name: Oeu

texts.en:
Oeu C. S., 49, works on her farm each day while her husband, Kung C. Thorn, operates a small mechanic shop out of their home. The live in Phnom Penh with their three children, two of whom work in the local garment factories and help to support the family. The mechanic shop typically generates US$2 in income each day, leaving the family desperate for options to increase their income and improve their standard of living. Oeu C. S. has asked for a loan of US$150 to purchase more seeds for her field and expand her variety of crops. She sees this improvement to her business as a sound investment in her future that will allow her to help support her family.

Oeu C. S. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband is pictured above.

loans.use: Oeu would like to purchase more seeds to increase her yields on her farm.

loans.name: Edth

texts.en: Mr. Edth T. is a construction worker in Sre Sa Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. His wife, Mrs. Nom Phaly, is employed in a garment factory makes a small salary. They have a child who is too young to work or study. Since their living conditions are poor, they would like to start a cow breeding business as a way to improve their life. Mr. Edth T. has decided to request a loan in order to begin the business. Previously, Mr. Edth T. had obtained a loan to buy a cart for use in daily life and he has succeeded in paying the loan back.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a cow breeding business.

loans.name: Rith

texts.en: Mr. Rith C. is 29 years old and lives in Sre Sa Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He and his wife, Mrs. Ra Heang, are farmers who cultivate rice and vegetable. Aside from this business activity, they sell firewood and coal in the local village. They have three children, one of whom is enrolled in school while the remaining two are too young to work or study. Although Mr. Rith C. and his wife work hard at running three businesses, their family still lives in an old house. Thus, Mr. Rith C. requests a loan to increase his savings in order to build a new house. Mr. Rith C. had previously obtained a loan to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice and he has paid it back in full.

loans.use: To add to savings in order to build a new house.

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um V., 40, lives in Phnom Penh with her husband, Soa Bun Thoeun, and their nine children. Her husband operates a large trailer taxi service making US$3 per day, while three of her children work in the local garment factories making US$90 per month each. Five of her other children are still young and in the local school system. This large family depends heavily upon the trailer service to maintain a steady flow of income for the family, however, the trailer is currently in need of repair. Um V. has asked for a loan of US$150 to repair her husband's trailer, allowing the family to improve its economic stability.

Um V. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband is pictured above.

loans.use: Um would like to repair her husband's trailer transport.

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Soa P., 24, is a single young man from Phnom Penh living with his mother who he helps support. He operates a trailer transport service that is attached to his motorbike and typically makes US$3 per day transporting garment factory workers and others who are traveling short distances. He can usually be found near the local food market, where his business is pretty good, however, it has suffered lately, because his motorbike is in need of repair. His motorbike is really his livelihood and he has asked for a loan of US$150 to repair it.

loans.use: Soa would like to repair his motorbike for his trailer transport service.

loans.name: Zareena's Group

texts.en:
Zareena Begum baji is the wife of Muhammad Ashraf, and she lives in the city of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is a driver by profession. She is a housewife, and she notes that she prefers to do work around the house. Moreover, she is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her oldest son works in an oil mill, while another son sells plastic shoppers. Notably, she successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now, she is applying for another loan to buy more plastic shoppers to expand her son’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by the following entrepreneurs: (1) Aneela Shaheen baji seeks a loan in order to buy cloth and thread for her boutique; (2) Sakeena baji is in need of a loan for her furniture business; (3) Rahat Baji requests a loan to buy more clothes for her clothing business; and (4) Waheeda baji would like a loan to buy wood to make more furniture.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest the funds into her own business. The members mutually guarantee the other members' loans so that the other members are responsible if one member does not repay.

loans.use: To expand and improve their respective businesses

loans.name: Ni Ketut Darti

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Darti is greatful for the tailoring skills that she has since youth is helpful nowadays. Ni Ketut Darti is now 41 years old. Ni Ketut Darti and husband Komang Delem have 3 children, and are all married by now. Ni Ketut Darti's husband is a farmer. Ni Ketut Darti receive a loan from the organization in her village who works with DINARI for Rp 5,000,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00). Ni Ketut Darti bought a sewing machine for Rp 1,000,000; the rest were used to buy needles, string and fabric for sale. Ni Ketut Darti owns 2 sewing machine, and 3 worhers in her home and 3 freelance workers who works in their own homes. Every day Ni Ketut Darti could process 2-3 clothes at a price of Rp25,000/cloth. Monthly income is about Rp500,000, and with this Darti could save for Ngaben (cremation) ceremonies such that when they pass away, they would not burden their children.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Ketut Darti sangat bersyukur, ketrampilan menjahit yang dimiliki waktu masih muda sangat membantu saat ini . Ni Ketut Darti saat ini berumur 41 tahun. Ni Ketut Darti dengan suaminya, Komang Delem, memiliki 3 orang anak dan semuanya sudah berumah tangga. Pekerjaan suami Ni Ketut Darti sebagai seorang petani. Ni Ketut Darti mendapat pinjaman dari Organisasi di desanya yang bekerja sama dengan DINARI, dengan pinjaman Rp. 5.000.000.- Ni Ketut Darti membeli mesin jahit dengan harga Rp.1.000.000.- sisanya dipergunakan untuk membeli jarum, benang dan kain untuk dijual. Sekarang Ni Ketut Darti memiliki 2 Mesin Jahit dan memiliki 3 Tenaga Kerja di rumahnya dan 2 orang tenaga kerja lepas yang bekerja di rumahnya masing-masing. Setiap hari Ni Ketut Darti bisa mengerjakan 2-3 potong pakaian dengan harga jahit per pakaian Rp. 25.000.- Penghasilan perbulan rata-rata Rp. 500.000.- dengan keuntungan ini Darti bisa menyisihkan uangnya untuk ditabung dan biaya Ngaben ( upacara bakar mayat ) jika mereka meninggal supaya tidak menyusahkan anak-anaknya.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine and items for tailoring production like string and fabric (Membeli mesin jahit dan sarana penunjang produksi menjahit seperti benang dan kain)

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.en:
Fazilat baji is the wife of C. M.Aslam, and she has been living in the city of Raiwind, Pakistan since 1978. She owns a two-room house. Fazilat baji is a housewife, and she states that she prefers to do work around the house and to take care of her children. Indeed, she is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her oldest son completed his education through 10th standard, while the next oldest son completed 8th standard. Her husband, meanwhile, has worked as a driver for the last 30 years. More specifically, he drives his own vehicles (36 seated coasters). At the same time, Fazilat baji’s oldest sons drive the coasters to help their family (i.e., to improve the family's financial situation).

Notably, Fazilat baji successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now, she is applying for another loan in order to change the tires and bodies of the vehicles used in her husband's business.

loans.use: To repair vehicles used in her husband's business

loans.name: Ni Luh Suci Muliani

texts.id:
Ni Luh Suci Muliani and husband, I Ketut Suliana, has been married for almost 17 years, and have 3 orang children. The first named I Putu Elba Antarika is 16 years old, in highschool. Second child I Made Elga Riana, 14 years old, Junior High. And third I Komang Elvira Riantini, 5 years old, kindergarden. Her husband's occupation is working for a private company. To fill in time after finishing housework, Ni Luh Suci is raising 3 piglets for fattening, that she just bought after receiving a losn from DINARI. The price for those 3 pigs were Rp 900,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00), and the rest to build a stall and buying feed. Ni Luh Suci bought mixed feed of wheat shells, concentrate and rice shells. After 6 months old, the 3 pigs will be sold at Rp 3,600,000, at a 6 months expense of Rp 2,600,000 due to high feed cost. Thus 6 months profit would be Rp 1,000,000. Ni Luh Suci is very much helped by this Dianri loan so that it would help in increasing her capital.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Luh Suci Muliani dan suaminya, I Ketut Suliana, sudah menikah hampir 17 tahun dan memiliki 3 orang anak. Anak yang pertama diberi nama I Putu Elba Antarika umur 16 tahun, SMA. Anak yang kedua I Made Elga Riana, 14 tahun, SMP. Dan anak yang ketiga I Komang Elvira Riantini, 5 tahun, TK. Pekerjaan suaminya sebagai pegawai swasta. Untuk mengisi waktu setelah selesai mengerjakan pekerjaan rumah tangganya Ni Luh Suci memelihara 3 ekor babi penggemukan yang baru dibelinya setelah mendapat pinjaman dari DINARI. Harga 3 ekor babinya Rp. 900.000,- dan sisanya untuk membuat kandang dan membeli pakan. Ni Luh Suci memberi campuran pakan dedak gandum, konsentrat dan dedak padi. Setelah berumur 6 bulan, 3 ekor babinya dijual dengan harga Rp. 3.600.000,- dengan pengeluaran selama 6 bulan Rp 2.600.000,- karena kebutuhan pakan saat ini mahal. Jadi keuntungan bersih yang didapat Rp.1.000.000,- selama 6 bulan. Ni Luh Suci sangat terbantu oleh pinjaman dari dinari sehingga bisa membantu dalam menambah modal usahanya.

loans.use: To buy 3 pigs, building the stall and buying feed (Membeli 3 ekor babi, membuat kandang dan pakannya)

loans.name: Mem

texts.en: Mem S., 62, purchases and resells recyclable materials while his wife, Koe Nary, sells fish in the local food market. They live in Phnom Penh with their one child and are looking to expand the recycling business. Reselling recyclable materials typically generates US$5 per day in income, while the fish business makes US$3 per day. Mem S. has asked for a loan of US$700 to purchase more recyclable materials and expand his current business. He sees that customer demand is high and believes this investment can increase his daily income.

loans.use: Mem would like to purchase more recyclable materials to resell.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina baji is the wife of Muhammad Aslam, who operates a scrap business. She lives in the city of Riwind, Pakistan, where she owns a four-room house. Rubina baji is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter, all of whom are in school. More specifically, her oldest son is in 10th standard; her next oldest is in 9th standard; her next oldest son is in 7th standard; and her youngest son and only daughter are in kindergarten.

Rubina baji is a housewife, and she notes that she prefers to do work around the house. Meanwhile, Rubina baji’s husband has been in the scrap business for the last 18 years. Notably, Rubina baji successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now, she is applying for another loan in order to buy more scrap (e.g., empty medicine bottles, plastic bottles, etc.) to expand her husband's business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her husband's scrap business by purchasing additional scrap

loans.name: Ni Kadek Murtini

texts.id:
Despite her young age, Kadek Murtini is highly motivated in running her convenient kiosk business in front of her house. Her husband, I Gede Murdana, also helps her with her business. They live with their 2 young children.

With an initial capital of $215.35, Murtini buys supplies for her convenient kiosk. All sorts of household items exist in her kiosk: rice, soap, oil and cosmetics. Her daily profit is $5.38, which is used for her daily needs, capital for her business, her children's school tuitions, and savings.

Kadek Murtini and her husband bought their house, which is built with semi permanent materials. The loan from DINARI will be used to increase their business capital. They hope that their business will grow towards a better future.

Translated by Joan, Kiva Volunteer.

Kadek Murtini yang usianya masih muda tetapi dengan tekun menjalankan usaha warungnya didepan rumahnya. Suaminya, I Gede Murdana, juga membantu usaha warung istrinya. Mereka tinggal berempat bersama anaknya yang masih kecil-kecil. Dengan modal awal Rp. 2.000.000,- Murtini membeli perlengkapan untuk keperluan warungnya. Segala kebutuhan rumah tangga ada diwarungnya, seperti beras, sabun, minyak dan kosmetik. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp. 50.000.- per hari. Keuntungan ini di pakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari, modal usaha dan sekolah anaknya yang masih TK dan sisanya untuk ditabung. Rumah yang mereka tempati adalah rumah sendiri yang bangunannya semi permanen. Pinjaman dari DINARI di pakai untuk menambah modal usaha dan harapannya usahanya semakin maju dan berkembang kearah yang lebih baik.

loans.use: To increase capital for more inventory

loans.name: Yaqoub Allah

texts.en:
Yaqoub A. is married. He lives in Kamari, an area that is 30 minutes from Kabul. People of that area are always busy in agriculture; Yaqoub is the same. He was in Pakistan during the war in Kabul but when he came back to Kabul, he started again from begging. Now his life is good but he needs some money to do his business well.

He has requested an individual loan with a term of 18 months to complete his stock and start working on his land to get some of his land ready for cultivation of wheat to sell at the bazaar and get good benefit to help his family and make a good future for his children. He wants to enroll them in a better education. He loves to see his children in school because Yaqoub is an uneducated man.

He would love to grow his business in the future and make a good business. He wishes to have a retail shop in the future. He is happy with this process of loans. He would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To complete his stock and start working his land

loans.name: Ni Ketut Tari

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Tari has 2 married children, and her husband is a farmer. Although her children are married, she is still driven to expand her business. The $538 loan from DINARI will be used to fatten 2 pigs: $64.61 for buying the pigs, $215.35 for building pig pen, and the remaining for 5-month worth of pig food.

After finishing her chores everyday, Ni Ketut Tari tends her pigs. First, she cleans the pig pen. Then, she washes the pigs, and lastly, feeds them. She feeds the pigs twice a day (in the morning and evening) with a mix of rice padi chaff, wheat chaff and concentrates. She is planning to spend $161.51 for food during the next 5 months, and sell the pigs for $279.96. Thus, her net profit for 5 months will be $53.84. Her first loan will be used to build pig pen. After she pays off this loan, she is planning to buy a pig sow.

Translated by Joan, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Ketut Tari memiliki 2 orang anak dan semuanya sudah menikah.Walaupun semua anaknya sudah berumah tangga, tidak mengurangi semangatnya untuk berusaha. Suami Ni Ketut Tari seorang petani. Modal yang di dapat dari Dinari dipakai untuk memelihara 2 ekor babi penggemukan. Ni Ketut Tari memperoleh pinjaman sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,-. Modal yang dikeluarkan untuk membeli bibit babi sebesar Rp. 600.000,-. Untuk membuat kandang menghabiskan Rp. 2.000.000,- dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan selama 5 bulan. Setiap hari setelah selesai mengerjakan pekerjaan rumah, Ni Ketut Tari segera mengurus babinya. Pertama yang dilakukannya adalah membersihkan kandang, setelah itu memandikan dan terakhir memberi makan. Setiap hari Ni Ketut Tari memberi makan 2 kali setiap pagi dan sore hari. Adapun campuran pakannya : dedak padi, dedak gandum, dan konsentrat. Sampai panen menghabiskan pakan Rp.1.500.000,- Sedangkan penghasilan kotornya Rp. 2.600.000,- Jadi keuntungan bersih yang diterima Ni Ketut Tari selama 5 bulan Rp.500.000,- Pinjaman pertama ini difokuskan untuk membuat kandang dan kelengkapannya, setelah melunasi pinjaman ini, ia berencana untuk membeli induk babi.

loans.use: To build pig pen and buy pig food

loans.name: Hout

texts.en: Hout C., 25, is a young farmer who lives in Kampong Cham with her husband and their two young children. Her husband is an electrician who operates out of Kampong Cham making US$3.50 per day, while her own farm can only generate US$0.50 per day. The electrician business is struggling with expansion, however, because they lack the capital necessary to purchase the proper tools and materials that the business needs. Hout C. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase these tools and materials to facilitate her husband's business and increase the family's income.

loans.use: Purchase electrical tools and materials

loans.name: Ni Ketut Nurhaeni

texts.id:
Hardships and increasing burdens in her life make Ni Ketut Nuraheni work tirelessly. Ni Ketut Nuraheni has 3 children. Her oldest one is married. Her second one, I Made Winarta, is now in college. Her third one, Ni Nyoman Yudiantari is in high school. Ni Ketut Nuraheni's husband is an elementary school teacher, who uses his salary to support their two children's educational needs.

Besides becoming a homemaker, Ni Ketut Nuraheni also raises a sow with 6 piglets. The $538 loan that she is requesting will be used to buy pig food for these 6 piglets. Being nurtured well by Ni Ketut Nuraheni, the piglets are growing bigger and needing a lot of food. Ni Ketut Nuraheni feeds greens as alternate food for the piglets. Otherwise, she usually feeds them with combinations of rice padi chaff, concentrate and tofu dregs. In 6 months, these piglets will be ready for sale for $753.73. With $538 cost for pig food, her net profit will be $215.35.

Translated by Joan, Kiva Volunteer.

Kehidupan yang sangat keras dan kebutuhan hidup yang semakin berat, membuat Ni Ketut Nuraheni terus berusaha tanpa mengenal lelah. Ni Ketut Nuraheni memiliki 3 orang anak. Anak yang pertama sudah menikah, anak yang kedua bernama I Made Winarta saat ini kuliah diperguruan tinggi dan anak yang nomor tiga bernama Ni Nyoman Yudiantari, SMU. Suami Ni Ketut Nuraheni seorang guru SD yang penghasilannya dipakai untuk membiayai pendidikan kedua anaknya. Disamping sebagai seorang ibu rumah tangga, juga memiliki usaha memelihara induk babi yang saat ini sudah beranak 6 ekor. Modal yang didapat dari DINARI Rp.5.000.000,- dipakai untuk modal pakan keenam babinya karena semua anak babi ini akan dipelihara. Dengan perawatan dan juga ketelatenannya sekarang anak babinya sudah besar dan memerlukan pakan yang banyak. Ni Ketut Nurhaeni juga rajin memberikan pakan hijauan yang berupa dedaunan sebagai makanan selingan. Adapun campuran pakan yang diberi : dedak padi, konsentrat dan ampas tahu. Umur 6 bulan keenam babinya sudah siap untuk dijual . Total penghasilan kotor yang diterimanya Rp.7.000.000,-. Biaya pakan selama 6 bulan Rp. 5.000.000,- Keuntungan bersihnya Rp. 2.000.000,-

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Zakar Allah

texts.en:
Zakar Allah is married. He is uneducated but he works in agriculture. He started this business when he was 8 years old, and still he is working. He learned this business from his father and his big brother, and now he is the one responsible for furthering agriculture in his family. He would like to make his business grow but he is unable. He has tried many times; he wanted to enlarge his business but he could not. After finding AFSG in Kabul, he completed his documents and would now like to take out a loan.

Now he has requested an individual loan of US$ 1075 with a term of 18 months to complete his stock and buy some seeds to be able to plant all his land. Some of his land is still fallow, so he will make his land ready for cultivation to get good benefit from it and help his family.

Zakar is very happy about this loan. He wants to say that without AFSG in Afghanistan, it was impossible for him to plant all his land. He would like to thank the people of the world who are helping poor people around Afghanistan. Through this sort of loan, every worker can expand their business. He would like to thank Kiva.

loans.use: To complete his stock and buy seeds

loans.name: Ni Putu Sulasmi

texts.id:
Ni Putu Sulasmi and her husband, I Putu Rama, have been in the sculpturing industry for quite some time. Their talents and skills are inherited from both their parents. At this time, Sulasmi is in great need for an additional capital. Through a local organization, who collaborates with DINARI, Ni Putu Sulasmi could get a loan of $538 to increase her capital.

Ni Putu Sulasmi employs 4 contractors in her business. She recently received a sculpting order for 1 door and 2 windows, which she would sell for $753.73. The order would take a month for her team to finish. A month worth of labor and raw materials would cost her $592.22. Thus, in a month, she is expecting to receive a $161.52 profit from this order. Ni Putu Sulasmi and her husband are very grateful for this loan from DINARI, and are hoping that DINARI can help promote their sculpting business. They will use this profit to meet their household needs, including paying for their 2 children's school tuitions.

Translated by Joan, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Putu Sulasmi dan suaminya I Putu Rama sudah lama menekuni usaha ukir kayu. Bakat dan ketrampilan yang dimiliki sekarang diwarisi oleh orang tuanya. Kebetulan saat ini Sulasmi sangat memerlukan tambahan modal untuk usahanya. Lewat organisasi yang ada didesanya yang bekerja sama dengan DINARI akhirnya Ni Putu Sulasmi mendapat tambahan modal Rp.5.000.000,- .Ni Putu Sulasmi mempunyai 4 orang tukang ukir yang dibayar borongan. Saat ini Ni Putu Sulasmi memiliki pesanan ukiran 1 pintu dan 2 jendela. Harga 1 pintu dan 2 jendela mencapai Rp. 7.000.000,-. Proses pembuatan memerlukan waktu 1 bulan untuk mengerjakannya. Adapun modal yang dikeluarkan selama 1 bulan mulai dari bahan sampai ongkos tukang mencapai Rp. 5.500.000,-. Sedangkan pendapatan 1 bulan Rp.7.000.000,- jadi keuntungan bersihnya Rp. 1.500.000,-. Ni Putu Sulasmi dan suaminya sangat bersyukur mendapat pinjaman dari DINARI. Dan harapannya supaya DINARI bisa mempromosikan ukiran kayu yang dimilikinya. Supaya lewat usaha ini bisa untuk mencukupi semua kebutuhannya, termasuk membiayai 2 anaknya yang masih sekolah.

loans.use: To add business capital and buy raw materials

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim Akhtar baji is the widow of M., and she lives in the small city of Riwind, Pakistan. She owns a two-room, brick house, which she and her family have lived in for the last 24 years. She is the mother of seven children: six sons and one daughter. Her oldest son has a compact disc (CD) shop, and he has 6 years of experience in the business; her next three oldest sons work as tailors; and her other sons and daughter are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.

To generate income for her family, Shamim baji makes school bags and sells them in various areas. Moreover, she does work around her house and takes care of her children. Notably, she successfully repaid three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now, she is applying for another loan in order to buy more CDs to expand her son’s business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her son's CD-selling business by purchasing additional CDs

loans.name: Ni Made Indriani

texts.id:
Life in the village is not busy, but this doesn't steer Indriani away from opening her convenient kiosk. With renewed spirit everyday, Indriani left her home by 5:00 am to the market to buy her inventory. With an initial capital of $107, Indriani completes her convenient kiosk with snacks, drinks and everyday household supplies. Indriani's kiosk is open from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm. The profit that she earns is used to help her husband, Nengah Yudiartama, who has his own business. Indriani also uses her profits to meet her financial needs and pay for her children's elementary school and kindergarten tuitions. Her house is built on a land that they purchased with quite solid structure. This loan from DINARI will be used to add her business capital and expand her business.

Translated by Joan, Kiva Volunteer.

Kehidupan didesa memang tidak begitu ramai, tetapi tidak membuat Indriani putus asa untuk membuka usaha warung. Dengan semangat baru setiap harinya, pukul 05.00 pagi, Indriani sudah pergi kepasar untuk membeli bahan dagangannya. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000, Indriani melengkapi isi warungnya dengan bermacam-macam barang dagangan seperti makanan ringan, minuman ringan dan kebutuhan keluarga sehari – hari.. Indriani membuka warungnya pada pagi hari pukul 06.00 pagi dan tutup pada pukul 06.00 sore. Keuntungan yang didapatnya dipakai untuk membantu suaminya, Nengah Yudiartama, yang bekerja sebagai wiraswasta. Keuntungan itu juga dipergunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan ekonominya dan juga untuk pendidikan anak-anaknya yang masih sekolah SD dan yang kecil masih TK.
